text: As expected from a fine dining establishment everything was amazing - the Mac and cheese is a must try

Total disappointment. The menu looked so promising, brasserie classics, and unique starters. It was so loud that a conversation could not be held across the table, and on top of the echoing voices there was out of place club type music.

We started with the charcuterie board. Overall very nice, but we did not get to finish it because our food came out. There was not place on the table for the entrée plates so I had to hold my hot plate while the food runner piled everything on the table on our half finished food. The waiter made us so uncomfortable about wanting to finish the starter that we just let him clear it.

My husband had a steak and fries, he enjoyed the steak, but the fries were not edible. We were able to squeeze grease out of them, and not just a drop. I had the pork, it came highly recommend from our server. It was overcooked, poorly butchered, and lacked flavor. The sauce was disappointing. The horseradish mashed potatoes tasted like raw garlic...which is strange. We only took one bite each, and decided they too would go uneaten. 

The biggest problem came a few hours later, when we had to take turns in the restroom. A horrid end to our otherwise fantastic trip to Vegas.

Really terrific experience.  We ate at the bar to watch NBA Playoffs while eating steak frittes...Had the lardon frisee salad which was also delicious...Bartenders and staff were very friendly and attentive...and great bread!  Check it out!

edible expensive food but mediocre for French food.  the ambience is superior to food quality. the half chicken is deliciously cooked. the fresh green beans are bland American style.  the bread must be requested and is not uber fresh, a norm for a good French restaurant.  the escargot is sub mediocre.

Wonderful French Bistro with a warm dark wood interior located on the Promenade level of The Aria Hotel and Spa in Las Vegas. The food was very good, as well as the drinks and desserts. We went there for dinner, as well as brunch. We received unlimited Rosé during brunch, and the french toast was excellent. The sommelier, Kelly, was very nice, knowledgeable and professional. Both times we were there we had a wonderfully sweet and attentive server named Shannon. It's a great place to go if you enjoy quality French Fare with great service and a great atmosphere!

Tried Bardot for brunch and we were not disappointed. Very nice Helene cocktail to start. The French omelet was simply, lovely, and delicious. The hash browns and toast served alongside made for a hearty breakfast. The bacon is amazing, super thick and crispy, I recommend a side of that. The croque Madame was a massive serving, rich and very good as well. I probably would not recommend the French toast. It is one huge hunk of bread. It's ok, but most of it doesn't have the griddled flavor as it is so large.

Food ***
Price **
Service *****

Came here on Sunday.  There was no wait.  Nice ambience.  Great service.  Bread was nice and warm.  King crab crepe was awesome!

However, the flat iron steak was a huge disappointment.  Very chewy.  I also got a coke, which was kind of flat.  So I was not happy paying $5 for a flat soda with no refills.

To me this restaurant is 2.5 stars.  I bumped it up to 3 because of their great service and awesome crepe.
The service is always impeccable. The food is delicious. It feels so good going to a place where you know you will never be disappointed.

My wife and hardly go to the Strip, especially for food but we always to find ourselves coming back to Bardot. Not only is the food exquisite but the service is exceptional. Kim S. And Eric H. are both very knowledgeable of the menu and friendly in the highest regard. We came dressed in full costume for Halloween (Ursula and Cruella) and they personalized our dinning experience regardless. Way to show a WOW experience! 

Beef Wellington is amazing. Perfect red core and flaky outer shell. Make sure to order this right away because it takes 40 minutes to reach your table. The steak tartare is the main reason we go back. It is a healthy portion for an appetizer. Subtle flavor but the texture is where it is at. This is highly recommended. 

'Twas a great Halloween date night!
One of our favorite brunch spots on or off the strip. Get there early cuz it does fill up pretty quickly
Had the most Uh-mazing onion soup gratinee "deluxe" style with black truffle & poached egg... I died!

The hostess was friendly but our waiter was just ok in terms of friendliness. We had steak and Alaskan cod. Good was cooked to perfection but it was too loud to have any intimate conversation. Also wish the waiter was bit more friendly.

We visited on the second evening that it was open.  Other than the host stating that he usually asks guests whether they have been here before, I discerned no indications of opening week jitters or kinks in the operation.  Our server was knowledgable and confident in the menu, fielding several questions on food and drink.  Timing and presentation were flawless with just the right amount of follow up.  Most importantly, all the dishes were a hit.  Gnochi, croque, flat iron steak, chicken, beet salad...all were a success.
The food is highly overrated and overpriced. Not impressed. In addition, dining room very loud. Save your money and eat elsewhere

We've been to Vegas a few times.  We've tried different brunch places and this was by far the best.  Wife had the French Onion soup and the 4" tall French Toast.  French Onion was perfect, not salty like most spots.  french Toast was great and not overly sweet.  Will definitely be back.

I wanted to love his restaurant, but I didn't. The foie gras was excellent, and so was the bread, but nothing else was. The steak and frites were ridiculously salty--more so than a ballpark pretzel. The lamb was undercooked,  which was remediable, but less than I'd expect at the price. Don't waste your money. There are WAY better restaurants in Vegas.

04/25/2015...went for brunch on Saturday & it was great. Attentive server was very helpful & friendly.  Had a Kir Royale...my fav champagne cocktail....Chambord & champagne & croque madam which was good but had way too much cheese sauce.  They bring a fresh mini baguette w/salted butter before your meal.  Also had the Mille feuille....a layered pastry with puff pastry & vanilla custard with a cinnamon sugar crunchy top. So good....I want to go here for dinner next time I'm in Vegas.

This place won't disappoint. Great food and service. Ordered the bone marrow and lamb. Food was a tad on the salty side and environment was a bit noisy because of the music but other than that, fantastic food and nearly impeccable service.

Brunch was incredible! I ordered the Hunter's Waffle with glazed duck confit. We had a party of 10 and each of us sampled each other's plates ( I enjoyed them all). A few of us ordered the Everylasting Rose for $25 which was well worth it! I am partial to French cuisine but the quality of the ingredients and preparation were excellent. I will be back next time I am in town.
This place was great! The service was outstanding, and the food was incredible. The steak tartare was the best I've had, the beet salad had so much flavor, and the mussels were absolutely incredible!

Excellent lunch dining experience at Bardot. Raul, our server was very attentive. Excellent food and excellent server and no wait time is the best recipe for an excellent dining experience. Must try: escargot with puff pastry, hunter's waffles, Maine lobster Benedict. The French toast is quite humongous; unless you have a bottomless stomach, don't attempt it so that you may save some space for their dessert.

Michael Mina, if you are reading this, please open one (Bardot) in San Francisco! Pleaseeee! :)

This was one the best places my wife and I ate at while in LV this past May. It was fantastic! Modern french with no fuss. Sommelier was helpful. Waiting staff was professional, helpful, and made us feel comfortable. The food was outstanding. I would highly recommend this to anyone staying in Las Vegas. This was a breath of fresh air amongst many dated and clearly tired restaurants on the strip!

We did the Valentine's Day brunch and had an amazing culinary experience. The food is excellent, I can't even name one, everything we tried from appetizer to main to desert was delicious! Our server JP was really sweet and he brought the girls roses at the end of brunch. We'll be back for sure
One of my favorite places to go for Sunday brunch :) salmon eggs Benedict never seems to disappoint and their restaurant has a nice and pretty ambience !

Another great Michael Mina restaurant!  We had a lovely evening starting with happy hour. Happy hour was great (nice beverage choices at a really good price) followed by a great meal. The service was also really good. We will return for sure!!

One of the best looking restaurants around - all black lacquer, brass, tile, and marble.  It was "fancy brasserie" done right.

We ordered the pastry basket - yum, hunter's waffle, crab crepe, and eggs with bacon.  The duck and bacon were a little on the salty side, but the food overall was great.  We paid a little extra to separate the waffle from the duck and eggs and get whipped cream and strawberries instead.  The strawberries were the sweetest I've ever tasted.  How they got them to the desert, I don't know. 

The bread and butter also deserve their own shout-out.  I basically filled up half my stomach space on those alone.

I'm a huge Chef Michael Mina fan and so naturally was excited to try this one. We arrived late, an hour before closing so sat at the bar whole waiting for a table without reservations.  They had just began happy hour so instead of $26 glass of pinot noir,received a glass of Acacia pinot  for only $8. Score!
The restaurant was about 1/4 filled but it was a 10 minute wait to set the table...not sure why son e the tables were already all set. 

Service was mediocre,our server took about 10 more minutes to get us waters which was heavily chlorinated. In a restaurant where you serve good food, maybe invest in a ro system for water?

We ordered 4 courses of appetizers : 
1) escargot- too buttery ,nauseatingly rich because the butter was trapped within the pastry
2) king crab crepe- light texture but also too heavy on butter,trumpet mushrooms were a nice touch
3) foie gras parfait- light, fluffy and melted perfectly 
4)prime beef tartare- delicious!! Egg yolk mixed in with grade A beef ,perfect 

Our friends ordered the 4 course summer prefixe meal and it looked like a great deal.  

Overall if they lightened up on the butter, I would've given more stars.

This is my favorite restaurant in LV right now. I have been 4 times over the last 2 months and they hit a home run every time! Sunday night myself and 3 friends had an amazing meal some of the highlights included the Duck a l'Orange which is a mush have. steak tar tar and the bone marrow appetizer are also excellent. as for main courses the lobster thermidor and the steak and frites our to die for. also if your a pork chop fan they have a chop that is the most tender I have ever had.

I enjoyed the appetizer and dessert the most here. There are too many other places you can go for good, fresh oysters so I won't mention that here. Having said that, all
chocolate lovers must try their CHOCOLATE MACARON (french chocolate cookie and valrhona chocolate mousse). This dessert for the win!!!

We are already big Michael Mina fans, so needless to say, we really enjoyed Bardot. Started with escargot Bardot (escargot in puff pastry), foie gras parfait, and the steak tartar. The fois gras parfait was amazing - whipped with a thin layer of port gelee on top. Our server described it as "adult PB&J." The steak tartar has a very delicate flavor, so start with that first if you're going to have it because it didn't quite stand up to the other appetizers. 

For mains, my friend ordered the Parisian gnocchi and it was excellent. I had the pork chop (it was huge and saltier with the bacon). Came with delicious horseradish mashed potatoes. My husband had a steak, which he enjoyed. The wine service was very nice - the server came with 3 recommended wines (one for each of us) and he poured us samples. The only downside was that we were completely unaware of the price (he quoted one glass at $18 and it was actually $25). 

For dessert, don't miss the chocolate macaroon. It's big enough to share.

It was a bit pricey, but I'm told their brunch is a steal with bottomless rose. We will certainly be back!

Wife and I had an early dinner at Bardot before seeing Zarkana (The Circus de Soleil show at Aria.). The Zarkana theater is right next door to this restaurant. The food was very good and prices reasonable (OK...I did pay $60 for my petite filet. But it was one of the best steaks I've ever had!) Let's start with the bread-freshly made baguettes. Bardot makes its own baguettes every morning and they're great. We shared a crab crepe for an appetizer. It was very creative with a sunnyside-up fried egg, chunks of crab, spinach and garnished with green apples on a whole wheat tortilla. I had steak frites (a petite filet) and my wife had a cod fish entree. The cod was somewhat bland, but the cut of fish was very good. Here's my basic breakdown of Bardot:

1. Food: B+ (I don't believe in grade inflation; so the food really was quite good eventhough my wife's entree could have been better.

2. Waite Staff: B+  Our waiter was a little cold, but very efficient and professional. We told our waiter that we only had 1 1/2 hours for dinner because of our theater tickets. No problem. We were easily served within that time and got to our theater seats 5 minutes before show time. Perfect.

3. Ambiance: A-  This restaurant has a beautiful bar. It's generally a quiet restaurant with the tables spaced far enough apart so you don't have to be an unwilling listener to the next table's gossip.

4. Presentation of Food: B  Nothing too over-the-top

5. Table Setting: C  This is my biggest complaint of Bardot's. The tables were marble with very little on them. The tableware, china, etc. did not seem on a par with a restaurant of this caliber. The table setting was quite cold. But this is a very minor point and shouldn't stop you from eating at this wonderful restaurant.

Highly recommend this restaurant. We'll be back.

Classy ambience with amazing food and service. We ate brunch there and had the pastries as a starter. I don't think I can ever eat a store-bought pastry again. They were works of art and made to perfection. Beautiful, high-quality, and absolutely delicious.

Good food, super friendly staff.  The only disappointment for me was that I didn't go with their prix fix menu.  I don't remember the cost, but there was a good selection of options for the three courses, but I'd had my heart set on the escargot.  Escargot is one of those things - if it's on the menu, I will get it, and I will choose the rest of my menu around it, so since that was not one of the appetizer options I went a la carte.  Unfortunately, the escargot was not what I expected. I knew it came wrapped in a pastry puff, and I like anything in a pastry puff, but this just didn't do it for me.  Not bad, just not great.  A bit on the dry and chewy side.  The mussels that I had for dinner made up for it.  A huge bowl of plump mussels in a delicious creamy broth that I just soaked up with the warm baguette that came with it.  I wish I had room for dessert but I was stuffed at that point.  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, checking-in regularly to see if we were ok, or if we needed anything else.

Best Authentic French Cuisine. Our  waitress Cassie was very professional.
You want real French  food, this is the place.

Our menu were : Salmon Lentils, Crab Crepes and Boulanger Basket.

Bardot Brasserie ROCK!!!!!!!

My guy and I are not the "fancy type" but we appreciate great food that a lot of thought has been put into.  We have been here twice and they have never disappointed-great food, great wines, great wait staff and wonderful atmosphere!  We love dressing up and coming here for a nice evening out.  Never are we rushed and always are we taken very well care of.  Not cheap, but not as pricy as some of the other equally top notch nice restaurants on the strip.  Great value and makes always for one of our most memorable nights out!

One of the best overall dining experience we've had for a while. Our server was very kind and down to earth. She recommended some great wines and drinks with our food. The salted butter and bread to start was delicious. The shrimp cocktail was amazing, soft, tender and fresh. They gave us hot plates before our food got to the table. The Parisian Gnocchi was divine and the Mac and Cheese was unlike anything on this planet. The way it was prepared was definitely worth taking a quick instagram. To finish we had the Chocolate Macaron which are the best and biggest I've ever had.
The place does't skimp on attention to detail with the French glassware, the interior design, the graphic identity, the kitchen, and even the restrooms had character. This is a place worth your time...and money of course.

This restaurant has been the highlight of our dining experiences in Vegas. 

From the moment we set foot in the door, we were treated to candlelit lighting and a venture into classic Parisian style. The grandiose bar upon entry was simply stunning and I almost requested a perch just to admire it. 

We were lead to a booth seat which allowed for a view of the kitchen, and granted we enjoyed a late-night (after 10pm) meal, we noticed every member of the staff carried themselves as if it was the dinner rush, with the same hustle and care you might expect. 

Our server Kim, or LIl' Kim as she was labeled by her colleagues treated us with utmost respect, care and offered genuine suggestions to assist in our meal. Cocktails were super yummy and the pace at which the food arrived was seamless. 

In fact, the second round of cocktails my partner ordered was not as good as the first and our server happily exchanged it without billing us for the switch. 

We ordered the chickpea frites, the Chiteaux cheese, the Tarte Flambee and the Croque Madame. The first two options came on wooden and marble slabs, respectively and the portions were perfect for an amuse buche, In all honesty, I was feeling rather full after the appetizers. Our mains were scrumptious and clearly made to please. Savoury and well-orchestrated was the norm for the food we enjoyed here. 

The ambience is lends itself to being both modern & romantic. From the presentation to the portion size to the flavour Bardot's food went over and above our expectations. Their Chef is a wizard and we were delighted with every bite. 

If you are staying in Vegas and wish to blow your date away, take them here. Unpretentious service and reasonably-priced, decadent food - you simply cannot go wrong. Thank-you for a treat of an evening Bardot Brasserie -- we will most definitely be back!
Amazing!!!! The food and service were fantastic, this was a great pick for my birthday celebration!!

If you want to spend a fortune on a highly unremarkable meal, this is your spot.  The Prime Rib, at $55, was no better than a steak at Sizzler. Simply nothing notable about this place to justify a $140 tab for two main courses and 6 Oysters, no wine, no dessert.  Highway robbery. Friendly enough service.

My husband and I dined there on a whim and a taste for French and the whole experience from the moment we entered until the last sip of espresso was drunk, was amazing! The flavor combinations that the chef prepares are divine and the upscale high quality service and cuisine do not disappoint. Although this is a very high end restaurant, we arrived in jeans and sneakers and did not feel u comfortable at all! Staff was wonderful and attentive. The food was outrageous. We started with the specialty crepe: Lobster and egg with pear and sweet butter. Need I say more? Main course of lamb and polenta with polenta fries that were so crispy and moist they almost stole the show! For dessert, it was nothing less than fine French baked pastries and cream puffs. We will for sure return the next time we are in Vegas! One of the best dining experiences we've had.

Best brunch! I was lucky enough to go here with my best girlfriends during my bachelorette party. It was recommended by a friend, who did not steer me wrong. The bellini's were delicious, and the rosé all day was a killer deal. I loved my food, I got the eggs Benedict that was placed on top of a perfectly flaky croissant, the hollandaise was creamy and perfectly rich. And to top off an already amazing brunch we shared a sticky bun, made with NUTELLA!!! To. Die. For.

Hands down the best steak tartare I've had ANYWHERE. Every dish we had here was phenomenal and the steak just melts in your mouth. The staff are top notch and extremely personable, they will give you excellent recommendations and pairings. Makes for a lovely date and dining experience.

Very good experience.
Pleasant place to start your day.

Food 5/5 Decor 5/5 Ambiance 5/5 Staff&Service 5/5
The ratings says it all, everything about this evening was perfect. Our waiter knew everything about the menu, and gave us the best recommendation for drinks based on what we liked. For desert we had the chocolate macaron, I am not a fan of chocolate mousse but this was incredible. Would go back every night if I could. A must try when in Vegas.

The food here is excellent. We came on a Sunday morning for brunch and made a reservation. They were very busy as it was Labor Day weekend. We ordered the assorted pastries as appetizers which were great. I got the French toast which was massive! My husband got the French-American breakfast. Definitely try the bacon and the hash browns! They were delicious! The only complaint I have is that the service was very slow. The chef made up for it by giving us a complimentary sticky bun.

My daughter and I love brunch and have eaten at many locations but this was the best brunch we've ever eaten. The omelette was perfection, the brioche French toast is to die for and the fruit plate has a frozen yogurt that is unique and refreshing. We will eat here again for certain!
Very good food. Impressive customer service. Would recommend to try. A lot to choose for vegetarian menu.

"Great food but poor service"
3 of 5 stars
Pending review

Made a reservation for a table for 3 for dinner and were seated by the bar area, which was very disappointing. We asked if we could be seated in the main restaurant and were told there were no tables available. Perhaps we should have been told this when the reservation was made? We ordered cocktails and it took 45 minutes just to get our drinks. The waitress kept apologizing that the bar was backed up. Honestly-45 minutes to get drinks?? By the time our drinks came, we finished our appetizers and were ready for our main meal. The manager did comp our drinks but it did not make up for the long wait time. The food was well prepared and very tasty but overall this was not a great experience. There are too many excellent restaurants in Vegas where they appreciate your patronage. I would not recommend spending your money here.

The food was excellent, the service was excellent, and the ambiance was great. If your from Vegas or just visiting Vegas this is a must try. One of if not the best Michael Mina restaurants I've been to. I highly recommend trying the beef tartare and the Duroc pork chop.

I will start by saying the food was fantastic. We had the hunter's waffle, king crab crepe, foie gras, and escargot. Stunning presentation and absolutely delicious! I wish the service and atmosphere were onboard. Our server would ask questions (frequently) as soon as either had a mouthful of food, and then stood awkwardly as we would chew, swallow, and then respond. He hurried our experience, and didn't seem to understand the European style allowing for the enjoyment of a delicious meal and spirits. The other clientele just simply ruined our experience. They were obnoxiously loud and rude (at 2:00 pm). I love Las Vegas and the fine dining opportunities afforded here. Unfortunately, this was loud, unorganized, and uncomfortable.

This place is very good. Had tartare and bine marrow to start which were both good. The baguette is as good as i remember in Paris and the butter is outstanding.  I had the branzino which was cooked perfectly and perfectly seasoned.  Would definitely come back. Dessert was ok. Chocolate macaron.

Very nice spot for dinner! I had the smoked pork chop. It was simply delicious and the potatoes were amazing! They have horseradish in them so it gives them a nice kick. The macaroni and cheese was great as well, very rich! They serve the macaroni standing up with a creamy sauce on bottom and cheese that looks like it was melted with a torch on top. Great presentations!

We went here based on the previous glowing Yelp reviews for the happy hour. The restaurant itself is beautiful, particularly the bar. We got there at 6pm, planning to get a few drinks and some snacks before our show that evening. I had to ask the bartender if they were serving happy hour which he then presented only the drink menu. I knew from fellow yelpers (and after calling the Aria concierge) that their happy hour -food and drink-is everyday from 5-7. I asked to see the HH food menu to which he replied "we don't have that right now". Ok...at the time I thought I must have misread something or got the times mixed up.  We  ended up ordering a few drinks and some food from the lounge menu. The steak burger was good, but the charcuterie plate's contents looked and tasted as if they had been sitting out in the open air for quite awhile. I was pretty bummed about the experience, especially since we made a point of walking here from the Cosmo before our show at Caesars. Next time I want a decent "brasserie" experience in Vegas I'll shlep over to Bouchon.

Bardot's probably the new kid @ Aria and I think it's a case of better late than never.

I love the whole set up although I was very apprehensive when I was only reading the intro. 

I had the pan seated foil gras and it was melt in your mouth good. Went on the the entree and I ordered the Pork Chop was recommend by Yelp. It was superbly cooked, pink and tender inside. 

Will be back to try the other dishes for sure.

Bardot is a great place. Came here for my first anniversary with a group of six, so we were able to share and try a lot of things. Highlights for me were the Duck L'Orange wings and the mussels. My husband loved the tuna tartare and the cheese plate. And of course, the giant macaron is the stuff that dreams are made of.

Service was top-notch and the restaurant itself is beautiful. We will definitely return.

Had a really nice brunch.  The service was very good. Food was ok. French toast was huge was pre-cooked then finished off before serving.  You can see sheet pans of the prepped toast in the kitchen.  Eggs Benny was a solid choice.
Great service and menu selection! Get the French toast for the table to share! The chicken French dip and croque madame were amazing! If you're looking for a something refreshing get an Bellini!
Wow. Amazing. The foie gras parfait was spectacular and the fresh bread and butter is just like what you'd find in Paris. Excellent restaurant and service. I'll be back.
Fantastic food, great service in a beautiful restaurant. Make sure to try the escargot in puff pastry with chartreuse butter. To die for. Highly recommend this place

We came here for dinner over the Fourth of July. It's a beautiful bistro, very elegant, with marble top tables, black furniture with gold highlights. Unfortunately when my boyfriend tried to order a salad with bacon added, they charged him an extra five dollars just to scatter bacon over it.  
It took a long time to just get bread and butter. How long should it take to get bread and butter?? I'm mystified that a sophisticated hotel like the Aria has such spotty service.  
The rest of the food was great but the first experiences with the restaurant simply marred the rest of the meal.

Let me start by saying "the food is pretty good" but there were highs and lows. Highs: gnocchi with goats cheese, trumpet mushrooms, truffle was awesome and perfectly balanced in texture and flavor. Smoked pork chop was good but the smoke over powered the mustard sauce and horseradish potato purée. Lows: beets were my least favorite, very ordinary, under dressed and seasoned, a bit of acid would have gone a long way and the goats cheese just wasn't enough to save the dish. All of this would have been okay if the place would allow a bit more space between tables and service was friendly, but sadly I had to YELL so my wife could hear me(so many business bro's) and the server never smiled, not one smile over an hour and a half.

Our entire group had been looking forward to eating here leading up to our trip, and were slightly disappointed.

We ordered the charcuterie board to begin with which wasn't amazing. We wished we had ordered a different appetizer. Then the four of us ordered moules frites, gnocchi, scallops, and a filet mignon w/ frites. 

I wish I had ordered something other than the gnocchi. The filet was okay but I've definitely tasted better. The fries that came with the mussels and filet were just not good. They were really crispy but had basically nothing inside. I can't speak for the scallops or mussels, but my friends weren't ecstatic about their choice either.

The inside of the restaurant is nice and dark, but once again nothing amazing. It's mainly disappointing because we had been looking forward to coming here for weeks leading up to our trip. It might be a better choice to come here for brunch in the future!

This afternoon, a close friend and I enjoyed a lovely brunch. The food was great and the service was good. However, one employee went above and beyond the call of duty and I believe needs to be acknowledged. His name is Oscar. 

Shortly after receiving our meal, my friend wanted ketchup and orange juice. Our waitress was not around, so we asked another passing by. That waiter agreed to help, but never returned. Oscar passed by and was given the same request. Before he could return, our waitress showed up and we told her of the request believing that the others had relayed the information to her. Shortly there after, the waitress returned without the ketchup proclaiming that the restaurant was "out of orange juice" and that someone was sent downstairs to get more. However, less than 60 seconds later, Oscar arrived with both ketchup and a full glass of fresh OJ. Our waitress never returned to address this issue. 

While our waitress did a fine job, in general, it was Oscar who seemed to go above and beyond for a table that was not his responsibility. When leaving, we attempted to give him a separate tip, but he refused. He said that he loved his job and that sometimes it's just good to do the right thing. So, for that, Oscar is to be commended!  Great job and Thank you, Oscar!

I Celebrated my birthday at this French restaurant which was amazing.  You walk in and it feels like you are in Paris. The atmosphere is awesome and the food was fabulous. I highly recommend to start with the Bardot Royale, a seafood tower with crab, lobster, clams, shrimp and oysters.  We then orderd the Duroc Pork Chops and Filet, which was perfectly cooked.  Thank you again to Nicholas our server and to Chef Michael Mina for the unforgettable dinner.  We will be back.

Great ambiance and nice menu selection. I enjoyed their escargot and bone marrow appetizers. You also Clcan't go wrong with their steak frites or gnocchi. Save room for the giant macaron dessert!! Our server was amazing! I think his name was Nelson.

Honestly, for the price the place really isn't all that. The roast marrow bones could have used a tad more under the broiler, and they should not have had ketchup or bbq sauce or whatever that was slathered on them. It provided a nice tang, but in the end prevented any sort of caramelization of the marrow. The onion soup was so so -- too thick a crust of cheese that set up way too quickly. The lamb rack was delicious, if a little stringy in places. The tarte tatin was difficult to eat, due to the pastry being impervious to every provided utensil.

Good service, OK food, nice (but very heavily marked up) wine list.

Was really looking forward to dining here and was refused service because I was dressed too "provocative". It was dead inside and I was in disbelief that they would turn away business, rudely might I add. Definitely not coming back. They need to learn how to speak to patrons!!! Next pre shift topic maybe?

Great food!  Came here with a party of 12 and they immediately brought over the Sommelier to give us some wine recommendations.  The somme was very accommodating for our red/white wine choices.

I split the red-eye (medium) with the surf and turf and they brought it out pre-split.  The sides were really good.  Loved the bread and the Lobster bisque was pretty big.  The only thing I would ding them on is it took a long time for them to refill our drinks.  Aside from that, the steak tasted great and the crab was awesome.
From start to finish. Hostess to waitress, to somm and the work of the chefs....this experience is worth the money and the hype. Can't wait to celebrate more great meals.
Bar staff was amazing, they are a great team!! Thank you Brooke and Dino, I'm sorry I don't remember the other bartenders name but they were all so friendly :) thank you guys!!

To be honest...my bf and I were thoroughly disturbed after what happened last night at the restaurant. Food was great and service was great however the incident completely ruined our dinner.

We were approached by a photographer who asked if we wanted our photo taken. We didn't think much of it and said sure. Then the photographer started having us do poses...still didn't think much of it although we thought it was a bit odd. Later at the end of dinner the photographer came back with a collage of our photos in an album. She set it down and said nothing to us and kept standing there...we were thoroughly confused as to why she kept standing there...so I took out a bill thinking she wanted a tip and as I handed it to her and at that point she finally spoke and she said its "$145" for the photos...We were both dumbfounded...if she had said something to us or explained the costs we would have considered possibly purchasing a photo but the whole situation made us feel uneasy.  Just shady...

We left immediately after dinner as we felt creeped out as now she had a full collage of our photos...everything was great for dinner but the situation totally ruined our night...

LOVE this place! What I would say is that their food is delicous & the service is great! My husband ordered the duck waffles & it was overcooked but i ordered the Croque Madame & it was delicious! Despite that my husband asked to get the egg re-cooked, we loved the meal & couldn't have imagined a better place to eat brunch in Vegas!

BARDOT delivered exactly what we were looking for in a quality boozy brunch after a night out in Vegas. The ambiance has a nice high-end feel. Our party of four opted for the $25 bottomless Rose which got us right back in the Vegas spirit. 

For food, we started by sharing a Nutella sticky bun which hit our sweet spot. For the entree two of us had the French toast and two had Eggs Benedict. Both were great, but one 'loaf' of French toast is more than enough for a party of four.

Ask for Tish! She's a pro and very nice.

5 stars for brunch service.

Came on a slower weekend, with an OpenTable reservation at 10 am. Every staff member we met was friendly, helpful, and professional; I was pleasantly surprised. Our waiters knew their menu very well and gave us great suggestions for our orders. Water and coffee was always refilled with the attentive staff.

Fois Gra Parfait: bold in flavor, no fillers, just fois gras and ruby port gelée. Grilled country bread and mini pickles on the side. It seemed small at first, but then we realized how rich, dense, and flavorful it was and we ended up having leftover. Definitely worth a try. 

Short-rib Croissant Benedict: RICH, delicious, savory. I don't know if I'd order this again, but I only regret my stomach wasn't big enough for this to fit comfortably.

French toast with mascapone, almond brittle, and almond syrup: huge, perfectly balanced in sweetness and textures. This is definitely large enough for 2 people to share.

Food was generously portioned, ambiance was Parisian-elegant/chic, and the staff was fantastic. I will definitely be visiting Bardot again for brunch next time I'm in town.

Brunch here was fantastic! A true French bistro that exceeded our expectations. Delicious foie gras to start on homemade bread.

We also ordered the burger which was amazing flavor. Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. Our server explained the process of them grinding to different types of meat together. Quite delicious without being overfilled from the bun. Of course paired with perfect fries that was so light and airy.

Their ham Benedict on croissants was a nice change to the traditional Benedict. Great sized portions to share.

Service was excellent, would highly recommend!

We went there for brunch and we had a really good time. It is a beautiful restaurant the food is great. Make sure to try the pastry basket. I had the Hunter's waffle and it was really good. Everyone in our party was happy with what they had ordered.

Tres bien.

I ordered the foie gras with a glass of the Bartender's Choice as my happy hour cocktail, which happened to be on this day a smooth and simple concoction of tequila with a splash of lime. Eric, the bartender who served me, was very professional and pleasant. The foie gras was delicious. It was served with thick, fresh from the oven bread. It was a perfectly smooth texture. This particular foie gras is served with ruby port gelee, so if you like it without the sweetness of the "jam" you may want to let the server/bar staff know so they can accommodate you. I finished my happy hour with a slice of lemon meringue tarte. I don't like my desserts too sweet and this one was a smidgen on the sweet side, but the right amount of lemon flavor was the redeeming quality.

It was a nice happy hour for a last night in Vegas. I'll go back for a proper lunch or dinner since my experience was a positive one.
Superb service.  The seafood tower, moules-frites, and prime rib were delicious!  The decor is classic bistro with a splash of romance: roses, dark wood, marble, and mercury glass everywhere.

OMG, I could eat every meal here! 

It was our last day and didn't want to be in the buffet line, way too long so I'm glad it forced us to go to Bardot :) We sat at the bar and got to look around, people watch ;)

Hubby got the steak brekkie and I got the lobster croissant benedict. OMGOMGOMG! I'm still day dreaming over it. Salivating as I type. It was perfect. Croissant was still crunchy, the sauce was divine, lobster pieces were generous. I wolfed it down! Oh so goooooood! I'm back in Vegas in Oct so I can't wait! I regrettably gave my hubby a bite. Even though I had a bite of his steak, the lobster benedict eclipsed the taste of the steak that I can't even remember what it was like. 

I also noticed that they have lots of baked goods on display. I loved that they had canele. Yum! I'm grateful that the bartender let me try one as the display had not been changed. I got one worthy to play hockey with. He was very apologetic and appalled. He went to the kitchen and got fresh ones. Didn't get compensated but at least I got an apology.

This place is on my list to 'must try'!

Definitely worth the visit -- Pork chop entrée was absolutely amazing; tender, flavorful and the best I've ever had. The bone marrow appetizer was tasty and flavorful. Dessert was OK; the Mille Feille was so-so, however the Chocolate Macaron is chocolate lovers delight and good enough to share. French wines in particular the Sancerre white was crisp, fresh, fruity and had a clean finish. Was recently told they do weekend brunches and ask for Shannon to be your server, she is a gem and provided outstanding service.

This bistrot is truly a gastronomic delight with service to match.  Bistro cuisine with Maxim's prices, you will find something to delight your tastebuds from the truffled french fries to the luscious smoked duroc, double cut pork chops.  The food is fairly authentic and the wine list superb.  Be ready to let go of some serious cash for a 3-4 course meal with wine; however, in my opinion it would be better to spend your hard-earned dollars on some exquisite paté de campagne than blowing it at the casino tables! The former will leave you with some deliciously fond memories while the latter will leave you with a bitter taste in your maw!

We sat at the bar before I had to take my girlfriend to the airport for a flight and Brooke was incredible. They had a full menu at the bar and Brooke was so helpful with my dietary restrictions with her recommendations and accommodating once the order came out. Pro Tip: Ask for the soft bread instead of or in addition to the baguette before your meal

I never was a fan of French food and was dragged here by my spouse and in laws.  Had to start off with a Hors d'age draft beer.  Wow this beer had me buzzing before the appetizers arrived.  The CHARCUTERIE BOARD and Pate de Campagne were excellent.  I never liked escargot but I have to admit Bardots was good. I won't list everything we had but for a non fan of French cuisine I was mildly surprised by the food.  Waiter, Michael, was great.  Only issue I really had was the noise level.  It was pretty loud once the dining room filled up.  I enjoyed the decor and vibe of the restaurant.  I would recommend it if you are in the mood for French.

Was on the hunt for a good French onion soup after having cocktails at Alibi Lounge inside of Aria- and wow am I glad I came across Bardot!

Las Vegas has so many good restaurants to eat at, on and off the strip there are celebrity chefs and delicious options, so service is really important to me and is what sets a restaurant and culinary experience apart in my opinion. 

Upon walking up, the hostesses greeted us kindly and took us in without a reservation. Sadly enough, its rare to find friendly hostesses on the strip, but not here! Very personable.

Andrea was my server and the experience was flawless from start to finish. 

We ordered the:

French Onion Soup (and I added the truffle, short rib, poached egg)- a must! This is all I planned on getting but it was so good I had to try more.

 Heritage Chicken- This was the star of the meal. So juicy, I'm not typically a fan of meat on the bone but this was so tender it literally fell off. Even came with a side of green beans and mushroom bread pudding!

Pork Chop- Yummmmy. If you like pork chops, you will love this one.

Mac & Cheese- This macaroni and cheese had an awesome presentation, the noodles are individually standing up, very impressive. I wanted to take a picture but it looked so good I had to dig in!! 

For Dessert, I had the infamous chocolate macaroon they advertise and it was very, very rich. If you're a chocolate lover, this will be your go to. I wanted to finish it so bad but I was so full I  almost rolled out of this place.

The restaurant is loud like previous reviews said, but I was still able to have conversation without a problem. I loved how I felt like I was in Paris. The service was very attentive but not overbearing. The hostess and manager even asked how we enjoyed our meal on the way out!

Bardot- I will be back!
Fantastic meal at a reasonable price (for Vegas). Highly recommended, especially if you have a show to catch afterwards. We had tickets to O at the Bellagio and this was perfect.

We stumbled upon Bardot Brasserie while strolling through the Aria Resort Casino.  We tried their HH and it did not disappoint.  Quite a few food selections but on the other hand their service is better than the food.  Nothing creative or out of the ordinary.  Mind you, it is good quality food and a nice place for lunch or dinner inside Aria.  

We will repeat on our next visit and hope to see some new and different HH menu items.  You will enjoy this place.

One of higher priced and higher-end restaurants where we'd expect high quality food and service, but haven't found it.
1. Small table squeezed between other seated tables in small area of the room, while half the room was empty until we left. I think they could've at least spread the customers/parties farther away from each other until more customers arrive. I saw another customer complaining about the same issue in a previous Yelp review, but looks like this restaurant doesn't learn or doesn't care much about customer experience. The table also felt too small for 4 people.
2. Very long wait for the soup before the entrée and no waitress around, until we had to ask the water server if we could get the soup soon.
3. I ordered medium-rare wagyu steak, but gotten one of the rarest/uncooked steaks I've ever eaten. I felt like I'm eating raw cow. Also, I didn't see much marbling in the meat, associated with wagyu beef. Although there was some nice crust on the outside that tasted really good, and whatever I could eat was good. I could only imagine that the steak could be really good if cooked a little better.
4. The waitress recommended mac-n-cheese as a side dish, which looked interesting, but tasted ordinary and somewhat too cheesy. At least they should've recommend a better side dish, unless they don't serve anything better...
5. The waitress asked if we like the food and need anything before we started eating, but later never came back to follow up when we actually needed her. We haven't seen her again until finishing the meal. Although this could be the restaurant's fault, as the waitress seemed to be serving a lot of tables, possibly around 10. Although it shouldn't take too much time for her to ask couple more times if we need anything else.
6. The waitress looked and acted like someone who should be cleaning tables at a buffet, without even basic education or food serving skills. She made the whole place feel like a low end country diner. Do they just hire anyone from the street to wait tables here?
7. Overall the rest of the food was good, but the sides somewhat ordinary. Ordinary fries, ordinary tasting mac-n-cheese, ordinary onion soup, undercooked steak. We wanted to be just a little impressed with something.
8. We waited long time for a dessert menu, after finishing the food. It was so long that we've decided to go somewhere else for dessert. While every restaurant should know that the most important time to serve customers is when they arrive, and when they are finishing eating. How can you even run a restaurant not understanding such basics, or not training your staff?
9. A manager came to check on us when finishing our dinner, but it was too late to complain about food, while it didn't feel appropriate to ask him for dessert menu. I also wanted to gather my thoughts to write some notes for this review. Though maybe we should've talked to him.
10. Our bill was $280 and felt overpriced considering the above (we didn't order drinks except couple bottles of water).

We were initially excited and looking forward to visiting this place, but left quite disappointed. We are a family of 4 and initially each of us rated the place between 2 and 4, but agreed on 2 after discussing the above issues.
We visited Jan 4 2018 for dinner (6pm).

Bardot was amazing! Atmosphere is inviting, warm, and cozy. Food was great and service was impeccable.
We had several appetizers: the king crab crepe (which was my favorite and very tasty), the Foie Gras Parfait(which was also great), and the French onion soup. Wow, were they great teasers!
For the main course my husband had the sea bass (which he loved and ate every last bite) while I had the lamb chops which was just delicious.
Dessert: rum cake with a smooth cream topping (can't remember the name).

Overall this place was just great! Our server, Nelson, was even better. Very knowledgable about the menu, provided excellent recommendations and was very attentive! Definitely recommend this restaurant for all French food lovers!!!

Slow service at the bar but we eventually got a menu for the happy hour 5:30-730. Truth be told, the items are not available after 730 on the dinner menu. Crossing fingers with a burger, Cubano n the mac n cheese. French 75 only 7 bucks during happy hour!

I feel rather conflicted reviewing this place...if there was an option to give 3.5 stars, that would probably be more accurate. I so very much want to rate this place 4 stars. The decor and ambiance are top notch, exuding a classy feel of a refined and upscale Parisian bistro. I also love the look and layout of their bar. Beyond this, that's where my disappointment started trickling in. Their house bread was for my preference, too hard. My latté was rather average. Their French omelette I'll have to say boasted great flavors. The cheese inside the omelette was very tasty, and the side salad with the vinaigrette cuts nicely into the heaviness/richness from the omelette. Before my main dish, I started off with their puff pastry escargot, and that I hate to admit was my biggest disappointment. Escargot is my favorite Parisian delicacy (I eat them almost everyday whenever I'm in Paris...probably not the healthiest thing to do). I definitely appreciate the different way they prepare them here, but it was quite honestly rather bland. If you're curious about trying this restaurant, I would still recommend giving it a go. Maybe at some point, I'll come back and try dinner...but I unfortunately had a less than stellar first  experience here.

BARDOT is nothing less than incredible. From the moment the  hostess seated us, you could tell just the dining experience was going to be amazing. Then our server Kim came. She was the cutest, most helpful server anyone could ask for. Her knowledge and suggestions for the menu were spot on. Then the food came out.  I have never had so much deliciousness before in my life. The chef is pretty much a miracle worker with the food he prepares. I have already recommended BARDOT!

Made a reservation for two, were quickly seated and sat for 10 minutes with no service, menus and drinks. My wife and I watched two waiters attend to our neighbors, while we managed to pour our own water. We left and asked the hostess for directions to another restaurant. Highly disappointed based on reviews and expectations of the brand.

Went for raw bar and mussels and did not disappoint again!

Went again over Labor Day weekend while staying at Aria. This time around was a disappointment.  We went after being at the pool for a little while and went during brunch.  It was very busy and food was coming out fast. Unfortunately mine was wrong, I specifically asked for lobster Benedict and ended up with smoked salmon. I mentioned it to the bartender and they looked at the computer and said that I did order lobster.  After looking forward to it and not being a real fan of smoked salmon I was not thrilled with the meal. Then there was a problem with charging the bill to the room so this was well below the experience of my last few visits and hopefully not an indicator of what the future holds.

Stopped in for a late dinner. Jesus our server was incredible. Professional yet very warm. Recommended some delicious dishes and took the experience to the next level.

For starters we did the duck wings à l'orange, escargots bardot, and bone marrow en persillade. All incredible flavors. The sauce for the wings was a perfect sweetness allowing for the wood grilled flavors to still come through combined with a mayonnaise based dipping sauce. Escargots strong as well. Unique dish with each piece wrapped in puff pastry. Bone marrow incredible. Very rich flavors supplemented with grilled bread to balance. 

For entrees we did the king crab crêpe, rack of lamb frites, and loup de mer ah fenouil (sea bass). Very delicious blend of flavors in the crêpe. The crab flavor shines through despite the mix of apple, mushrooms, and egg. Lamb was perfectly tender. Large portions with a perfect mix of flavors. Interesting chickpea fries with spinach and tomato. Sea bass delicious. Light but flavorful. Cooked to perfection. 

Dessert we had both the crème brûlée and frozen Paris-Brest. Perfect sweetness and unique flavors in the latter. Almost like a fancy donut. 

All in all definitely would recommend!
Nice ambiance. Little away from the crowd. Awesome bartenders and even better drinks during happy hour. We had fun!

This is one of the best places to eat in Vegas
The service is really good
The food is amazing
I think the oysters are great, fresh, size is good
The mussels are delicious
I like the beer menu, with unique, and rare ales
The crepe with crab is my favorite appetizer

First time to bardot for bunch and it did not disappoint.  Amazing butter,  fantastic bisque, crepes and traditional steak and eggs. Oscar was amazing.  This is one of our favorites which should say something about the food and service since we are locals. Ask for Oscar... he takes pride in his work! #vegasborn
Bardot's Brasserie will remain on my list of places to visit every time I visit Las Vegas!  The entire experience is wonderful.

I absolutely adore Bardot Brasserie and have been for dinner, brunch, and happy hour.  First the decor and atmosphere are really lovely, walking that fine line between relaxed and upscale.  My absolute favorite item to order here is the steak tartate.  It's packed with flavor and served with salty thin chips that are a perfect compliment.  At brunch they have multiple eggs benedicts that are all served on these perfectly crunchy but pillowy croissants.  The oysters are fresh and phenomenal. They also have everlasting rose in both sparkling and regular that is a fun joy to add to the experience.  The service is always spectacular as well - friendly and prompt.  I highly recommend visiting Bardot when in Vegas at the Aria.

Great food, atmosphere, service and drinks. I'm not much of a 'yelper' but because of my experience here, and the fact that there is so much restaurant 'noise' in Las Vegas, I felt it was warranted. I've been to Vegas a ton of times, and have eaten in most of the high end places. I've eaten in many Michael Mina restaurants around the country as well. This time, I was here for a national sales meeting and had dinner at Bardot with my team of 12 from across the country. When I plan group dinners I prefer a prix fix as it's easier on everyone, and on my budget. Bardot had a great choice of menus in multiple price points that featured main courses that are high on the normal menu. Everything was great and everyone enjoyed their meals. What really set Bardot apart for me was in the service. Of course, we all enjoyed the food but for a 3 month old restaurant in Vegas, where there is so much transient help, I was impressed. I eat a vegan diet and also love to eat. In NY it's easy to eat where there are many inventive chefs and I'm not just getting a salad...in other places, it is hit or miss. At Bardot I got a great meal of multiple courses that followed the rest of the group. My dishes were plentiful in variety of ingredients and prepared quite well. Our entire service team, led by John Paul was great. He was attentive and responsive, timely and traditional in service. Explaining my vegan meal and the point of view of the chef de cuisine, which was greatly appreciated. Even after multiple rounds of champagne, wine and cocktails, managing a group of 12 women after all day meetings in Vegas, was easy for them all.  I will be back at the end of June and will visit again. We all enjoyed our experience (vegan and foie gras lovers alike) and would highly recommend Bardot.

I have nothing bad to say about this place. We went for dinner, our service was excellent, the food was delicious. Prices were very reasonable for what it was. We started with the escargot which was to die for. I had the gnocchi and my husband had the pork chop. Like all french dishes, the sauces on each entree were very rich. Unfortunately there was no room for desert.  Maybe next time!

As Virginia Woolf said, "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." At Bardot, you will dine well. We found it to be a very solid and mostly authentic French bistro. We had the steak tartare, the escargot, and foie gras and the fish. All were very good. The escargot critters were not in the shell but stuffed into puffed pastry. First time we had them this way but still good. We loved the Mille Feuille with delicious cream. Well done, Michael Mina.
Best brunch/breakfast I have had in Vegas. Service was great and the food was everything I expected it to be. Don't skip the basket of pastries to start your meal.

Well, I've successfully found the perfect romantic dinner spot in Vegas. Bardot Brasserie was classy and sophisticated from the outer decor, fresh flowers in the foyer, French modern interior decor, exceptional service, well-crafted drinks, and fabulous food. 

We went for a bachelorette and this place made us feel like we were living our absolute best lives. I would recommend this spot for Bachelorette parties (perfect photo ops and excellent dirty martinis) but would also want to go back for a date with my husband. This place was a breath of fresh air from the typical tacky Vegas vibes. I will be back!

Excellent!! It's our second time here and I must say that this is one of our favorite Brasseries. 
Service is great, food is delicious and drinks are well made. 
Highly recommended.

I had already read a lot of good reviews and we always try new places in Vegas. Bardot was fabulous, we loved it a lot. The service was the best. I  recommend Sean who was the Sommelier. I love cognac and wanted to try something different than my regular Remy. He suggested the Guillon Painturaud Hors d'Age Cognac, which was amazing great price for such an amazing taste. They have a large list of cognac and I loved it. 
We started with the duck l'orange and king crab crepe. Wow. the duck was wonderful. I loved the crepe but not so much my wife. The onion soup was good but the best was the pork chop. The mac and cheese another tasty one. OMG yummy. 

We recommend this place if you love great food. Oh and on a side note we saw Antonio Esfandiari , Poker, come in and sit about three tables away. Nice.

Somehow I had missed this place opening, and I was taken here for a group meal. Those are always enjoyable, but the food normally fails to please. In this case the food was fantastic, and I need to come back again for a normal meal here. The place and decor are very cool, the prices are pretty reasonable, and the food was spot on. Highly reccomend.

First, note that we came here for brunch, not dinner, and oh my, what a brunch! We were served by Nereida, who had a friendly demeanor, plentiful knowledge, and made great recommendations throughout.

Cocktails were standard morning fair- a peach bellini for my girl, mimosa for me. While wonderful, 15 bucks a pop is a little much. All the other food was well worth the price.

Charcuterie board to start and it was divine. The prosciutto was just a touch fatty and hard to cut, but the flavor was excellent. The pate went beautifully with the bread served, and the pork spread even better.

For entrees, steak and eggs for the girlfriend. She growled when I tried for a bite of the steak so I'm assuming it was spot on.

As for me, I would live on my entree if I could. The Hunters Waffle was duck confit on a waffle with over easy egg on top. I really can't describe it, but can say if you're here for brunch, this should be a serious first look. It was beyond amazing. Melted in my mouth, the egg yolk and duck went together so well, and the waffle soaked up the excess. All in all, an experience not to be missed. Aria continues its stellar reputation for fine dining, even for something as simple as brunch. A new staple to add to my vegas favorites. Look for many return visits from me!

This is one of my top favorite restaurants in LV. The menu is amazing and so if the atmosphere (and I live the decor). I recommend the French onion soup (I asked to add truffle, it's a $6 Addition but worth every penny- it's not the same without it. For the same price they will also add an egg and beef but I didn't want that). The crab was amazing!

Pros: Great service, great food, great drinks

Cons: Kind of expensive, but that should be expected

Details: We went here for a celebration with family from out of town. I had heard it was very good and was not disappointed. The highlight is the service because there are a lot of places to get great food in Las Vegas but the service here was next-level. The staff was extremely personable and worked with us almost like we were old friends. For alcohol, I only had one drink (rum based) and a sip of another (bourbon based) so I can't speak to all of the drink menu. But the drinks I had were great. The food was also great, from what I had and what my fiance had. I am not sure if the menu changes or not but it looks like it might rotate some items in. The atmosphere is also great, you lose the sense of being in the middle of a large casino. I did not get the reservation so I cannot speak to that but it was quite busy so I imagine you want to book ahead.
First of all the bartenders here are amazing! The service was great and my meal was perfect. Highly recommend dessert here as well.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night.  Easily got reservations via OpenTable and no problems getting seated.  Very nice ambience with a classy yet old-fashioned decor.  The noise level is not very loud, and great for conversation without having to yell.  Ordered the special for that night - Bluefin and tuna belly.  The fish was absolutely delicious!  The bluefin was cooked to perfection and the tuna belly was so tender it melted in my mouth.  My gf got the flank steak, which was also tasty.  A somme also came by and paired our wine with our dinner to perfection.  They even gave us a comped mousse macaroon for dessert.  Overall, great dining experience at Bardot!

Did u like French kitchen?  Doesn't matter, because this plates, what cooked in Bardot Brasserie - awesome! All my friends was together with me for 1 year which I live in Las Vegas. Best oysters what I'm try in my life - kushii from British Columbia. Expensive restaurant. But if like gastronomic experience - not big deal
I'm writing this because I have been left waiting for a check for 25 minutes and I'm bored. The food was excellent but the service was terrible. Waiter was incredibly slow and inattentive.

THE BEST FRENCH FOOD . And I'm not even a big fan of French cuisine.. but this place was exceptional! Everything is 5 stars from service, atmosphere and quality of food. I would definitely come back for the French Toast..It was HEAVENLY. So moist, soft, fluffy, but crispy on the outside. Not sweet at all. Syrup is served on the side. 

Make sure to order the French bread that comes with "the worlds best butter" ... it really is the worlds best butter... sooo rich in flavour but not too heavy or thick. So soft and silky with a creamy buttery salt flavour. The French bread is also very fresh and served warm

I love Michael Mina and have enjoyed his other restaurants in the past.  I wanted to love Bardot but ended up "only liking" it.  Why?  Because they were out of 75% of what I wanted -- sparkling wine from burgundy : out, Michael Mina Cabernet Sauvignon : out, mussels : out.   Clearly Sunday night is not a good night.

The warm beet and goat cheese was fantastic and a generous portion.  My friend had the french onion soup which she said was good.  I'm still unsure about the mussels.  Our server took the order and returned 10 minutes later to say they were unavailable because the chef didn't want anything of inferior quality to leave the kitchen. Was I the first order of mussels for the day (9p)? Or the last and those mussels were dead?

However, as disappointing as the food was, the service was excellent. The sommelier gave good substitute recommendations and we received a chocolate macaroon complimentary.  One of the dining room managers came over to apologize as well.  I'd give if a 2nd try but wouldn't put it above any of my other favorite Vegas restaurants.

Classic French style cookery at this Michael Mina restaurant with reasonable prices (especially for Vegas) with deeeeelicious food. I ordered the tasting menu ($65) fir dinner, which consisted of:

Summer melon with cheese (fresh burrata), cantaloupe, honey dew, and a balsamic reduction. The fruit was amazingly sweet and the burrata paired so well with the fruit! It was soft, creamy and delicate.

A play on duck a l'orange, where duck breast was replaced with duck wings. They were tender and perfectly cooked. But! I wanted duck skin and did not get it. It was fine but less preferred. It came with 3 wings. 

Sole meuniere...stop all the clocks.. lol. If you like fish, butter, and artichoke flavors, this dish is a must. I loved it! Little bit of capers, two fillets of sole rolled and placed on top of an artichoke puree... all tied together with butter.. it was tres tres perfect. This is a dish I'll remember for a while! 

For dessert, the cherry clafoutis. They did not keep the cherry pits in (like traditional ones), but it was still yummy, if just a tad on the sweet side. I loved how It paired with the nutty and less sweet pistachio ice cream! 

Now go!! Reservation not needed. :)

This place has some of the World's Best Butter...ask them they will tell you. They will also explain why it is the best, and after the explanation from our waiter I totally believe it. 

This place is absolutely lovely, I don't use the word lovely too often and there's reason for that (a lot of spots don't warrant it). The little touches from the interior, lighting, old-school feel and fresh roses all over the place really add to your overall experience. 

We ordered a ton of different things and I also convinced all of my friends to try their Escargot they had on the menu. They were baked into these perfect little pastries and topped with an amazing sauce, tres magnifique! Hopefully I used that properly, either way I would definitely recommend this spot if you are in Las Vegas and it is definitely worth the reservation and price tag.

Came here on a Lip Smacking Foodie tour (which also awesome - check them out) but we got the Blood Orange duck wings and omg they were phenomenal!!!

I've also come for their boozy brunch which is a total hangover lifesaver. That French toast is unbelievable.

I went here on the recommendation of one of my coworkers.  Me and the man friend weren't celebrating anything just a date and a night out.  I really like french food and nicer restaurants, but he hasn't been to a lot of them. The atmosphere and the look of the restaurant is very cook, brassy and mirrors and glass everywhere its very cute and I really enjoyed it. 
We made reservations for 7:30 and arrived a little early, they were able to seat us right away.  We were led by whom I believe to be the maitre d' or perhaps one of the managers, to a table for four people, even though we were only 2, that also had a card on the table.  Once I sat down I realized that the name on the card was not mine nor my man friends.  
I asked the gentleman who had sat us if he needed this, to which he replied and stated to my man friend, "you're not victor?", my man friend stated no, and I made a joke about him seating us at the wrong table, (I work in the hospitality industry, and have worked in restaurants before, so I understand that things happen), the gentleman's response was a half laugh and to ask again if he was not Victor.  Still not Victor. The entire encounter was a bit strange but again I understand.
The waiter then came over to take our drink orders, and bring us some menus as we had not been given them when sat.  I asked for a recommendation on a wine that was similar to a Merlot, and the man friend got an old fashioned. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and asked if we had any questions or anything.
We got escargot for a starter which I love and the man friend isn't normally a fan of, but he really liked them as did I. They were cooked perfectly, seasoned very well, and the crescent crust they are surrounded in was amazing.  I have eaten at bouchon and they do something similar there, but this is amazing as well, very impressed for just having opened up.  
I got the gnocchi for my main dish and he got the chicken, we got the macaroni to share for a side.   The waiter complimented our choices and stated that we would indeed enjoy them. He was a very great guy, shame that I never did get his name, he did not tell us, and wasn't wearing a name tag to my  knowledge.  
The mean was amazing, every thing tasted amazing, the chicken was cooked perfectly, my gnocchi was amazing and the macaroni was to die for. 
We then decided to have some desert which was amazing, we got the chocolate macaron, and I am a fan of macarons so that was already a plus.  Its an over sized chocolate macaron, with salted caramel and a chocolate ganoch over the top of it. Melted in my mouth, was so very rich and decadent.  
I also got an after dinner drink that the waiter recommended and stated would taste sort of like a chocolate shake, he was indeed right. Delicious! 

Our overall experience was amazing! I will certainly be coming back again and recommend it to my friends and those who come into the hotel I work for. They have a few bumps that need to be worked out, but I am confident that they will have a wonderful go of it in Las Vegas and a very successful restaurant and bar.

We had Happy Hour at the bar on Sunday 4/2/17.  The drinks were very good, and the French 75 was notable.  We had Oysters, which were good but not great. The reason we will come back is for the Tartines.  We had both the Bouef Bourguinon and the Avocado Tartines.  We had never tried Tartines before, but have found a new favorite appetizer.  The bartender was friendly, professional, attentive and very good at offering advice on what was good.
Everything about this restaurant was 5 stars! Everything on the menu is amazing, great service and decor. You have to try the French toast!!!
Great French food with awesome service. The appetizers are very rich. They have a great selection at the bar.

Bartender Eric is the absolute best since day one two years ago!  He has the best recommendations & never lets my Bottomless Rose get to the bottom.  Brunch on the weekend is one of my fav times to come in.  I am definitely a Bardot regular so will steer you in the right direction.  

BEST first!  

HUNTER WAFFLES.. waffles w/ Duck Confit is to die for delish w/ the oozing poached egg & sauce maltaise on top.  A must!  

WARM BEET & GOAT CHEESE SALAD!  Toasted hazelnuts, wild arugula & cassis vinaigrette.  Presentation & flavors are an A+ every time chef's.  I compare every beet salad to Bardot's.

The BEST LEMON MERINGUE!  Gorgeous.  All the elements are equally perfect.  My go-to dessert & I'm not a dessert person, if so it's usually chocolate.  

PÂTÉ DE CAMPAGNE .. best I've ever had.  Beautiful traditional housemade pâté w/ heritage pork, veal & pistachios w/ mustard.
CHARCUTERIE comes w/ a nice half of the pâté, Pork rillettes, saucisson sec, Bayonne ham & mustard.   Either one is perfect as an app or whole meal.  I've ordered it to-go for a lunch party at my house, which worked remarkably.  Paired w/ a nice bottle of wine & take your time enjoying.  
ADD the Pastry & Breads as a side!  (See pic) OR 
LE FROMAGE!  The cheese dish is phenomenal!  They change up, but my fav is the one I posted.  Toasted hazelnuts, Crémeux de Bourgogne, Epoisse de Berthaut, & Bleu de Causses, all cow, Secret de Compostelle (sheep) & Valencay Affinó (goat).

MILLE FEUILLE Another amazing DESSERT!  Caramelized puff pastry, vanilla créme patisserie phenomenal.  Best, but first try the Lemon Meringue!

HEARTH BAKED QUICHE ... classic lorraine, bacon, kale, creamy delish!  Large slice & filling!  

CROQUE MADAME pain de mie, Paris ham, gruyère fondue topped w/ the usual organic egg.  Over the weekend I asked if they could do a Salmon Monsieur, which turned out unbelievable!  Thank you chef's!

MAINE LOBSTER THERMIDOR over garlic mashed potatoes, mushrooms duxelles, fine herbs, smothered in sauce béarnaise.  Oh mmm!  A must!

FOIE GRAS PARFAIT thoroughly enjoy every melt-in-your-mouth moment.  Ruby port gelée on grilled country bread.  Savory & sweet for brunch or dinner!  Top 5.

CRÉME BRÛLÉE.. vanilla bean custard, turbinado croquant, all I need to say.  Mmm!

AMERICAN IN PARIS .. a large more traditional breakfast w/ a square Crispy hashbrowns, sausage, scrambled eggs & toast.  Fantastic!

LE STEAKBURGER... if you're in the mood for a tender Prime Rib Patty, soft bun, comté cheese, garlic aïoli, watercress, hand-cut fries, side of bordelaise onions & lettuce.  

SMOKED SALMON BRIOCHE chive mascarpone, traditional garnitures.  Everything to love!  

PRIME STEAK TARTARE ground-to-order, sauce verte, egg yolk & toasted baguette!  

FRENCH TOAST is not only picture worthy, like everything here, but enormous.  Brioche French toast w/ vanilla mascarpone, a crunchy nut brittle & orgeat syrup!  Definitely shareable & my whole fix for the year it's so decadent.  

KING CRAB CRÊPE... mmm the buckwheat crêpe, black Truffle mushroom, sunny side-up egg, cider beurre blanc... disappointing if you don't mix it all together w/ the crab & get the full flavors, even w/ the green apple.

ESCARGOT BARDOT wild burgundy snails, toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter in puff pastry shells.  Beautiful if you're a fan.  

LOBSTER BENEDICT W/ KALE... Can't go wrong with Lobster or the Benedict. 

CHICKEN FRENCH DIP.. gruyère cheese, mushroom bread pudding, haricot verts, vin jaune au jus.  Almost taste like Chicken Thanksgiving, but my least favorite.  Tad bit mushy & maybe less of an ingredient.  

If you like fish, I've tried these two, neither was fantastic, just ok.  I think Bardot has better dinner items.  

HERB-CRUSTED ALASKAN COD.. The English peas, sweet corn, saffron beurre blanc give it a nice lite touch.

LOUP DE MER.. roasted Mediterranean Sea bass, caramelized lemon, fennel, steamed potatoes.  

Yes, an extensive review that is a year overdue.  There's also a drink call 'And God Created Woman' that's unique along w/ other & a wonderful wine list.  Michael Mina never fails & the chef's are Food Network stars to me.

After some very disappointing meals and terrible service, Bardot redeemed my Las Vegas culinary experience. 

Service was extraordinary. Ambiance and decor was like sitting on the champs élysées in Paris. The wine list was extensive and the wine we ordered was available (a first in Vegas). The food was great. Fabulous flavours. The macaroni cheese side is oh my goodness - wow! The tartes light and flavoursome - the goat cheese Apple combo was scrummy as was my sautéed skate wing. We just wish that we had time for dessert but we had a show to dash to. All round - a great culinary scrummy experience. Very much recommended!

Overall good experience. Nothing to thrill over. Steak was great but our fries were burnt to the point you couldn't even eat them. A friend ordered truffle fries for an additional fee and you couldn't tell the difference. Portions are crazyyyyyy small. Would maybe come back but nothing to rave about.

Glad we came here for happy hour before our show.  I can see this restaurant becoming popular very soon.  Especially love the escargot (great flavor with a buttery crust).  You get three pieces for $6 (HH menu).  We also ordered from the regular menu... I'd prefer the gnocchi to be chewier but still yummy & the onion soup was not salty (move away Bouchon!).  I'll be back for sure!

Date Night!! 
I went here with my boyfriend for a date night on a Wednesday. It was our first time here & the restaurant itself is beautiful. 

The lighting & ambiance is nice, it was just very loud. We were sitting very close in between two other tables & we could hear every word they were saying, & I felt like we were shouting over them to have a conversation. 

The food was amazing! We're both lovers of French food & Bardot did not disappoint. Make sure you eat the bread with the delicious butter- I hardly ever eat bread & it's totally worth it here! 

We had the Foie Gras Parfait for a starter, He had the Heritage Chicken & I had the Scallops Meunière & every bite was absolutely wonderful! The portions I feel are very generous for French cuisine. 

The service was the only thing that was lacking. Thus only four stars (I would give 3 1/2 if I could). Our server was very inattentive. It took forever to just order our drinks. He didn't even come by after we received our entrees to see if we needed anything. Never offered/asked if we wanted another drink when our first ones were gone. Although we were full from our meal I kind of wanted to try dessert but didn't want to wait for the waiter since he was taking so long. Our bus boy was amazing though! It was super busy & he seemed like he may have been new. 

All in all I would definitely go back. I'm wanting to try their brunch ;)
Absolutely divine food. Brooke our server was wonderful. I love Bouchon but... This was even better! Stellar. So  delicious and a beautiful French atmosphere.

We had a wonderful meal with attentive service. They give you a taste of wine before they pour you a glass, which is typical, but what is not typical is the friendly attitude encouraging you to try another wine if you're not 100% satisfied with your first choice. The breads were great, the seafood tower was amazing, and the dessert options (we got an array) were all impeccable. I love the design of the place and the fact that it's not too loud.

The baguette was delicious with the salted butter.   I got the King Crab Crepe.  It was meh.   Did not seem like they used king crab.   Looked a lot like the artificial stuff.   The overall taste was off too.   My friend ordered the mussels with fries.   Those were AMAZING!  The cream sauce was perfect and the fries were so divine.   We also tried the onion soup with the beef & egg.   I would recommend just the soup.  The extra fixings weren't that great.  

The property is beautiful.   The bar is visually stunning.

I wish I could snack on Bardot's escargots every day.
Great atmosphere, Beautiful space, French fare on point, and great whiskey selection. :)

Had the buckwheat king crab crepe with apple slices and mushrooms, which was a great mix of flavors.  Followed it with the oak-smoked pork chop, which was a large portion and probably the best pork chop of my life.  It had savory, smoky flavor with just the right amount of fat, was cooked perfectly, and was complemented by the sweetness of carrots it was topped with.

Service was attentive and speedy.  Overall a top-notch meal... although the price tag matched. :-)  I wish I had room for dessert.
