I stopped by for happy hour before going to dinner elsewhere. I love that the happy hour went until 7, I feel like that's later than most. Wine & service was great. I LOVED the avocado toast thing I got (forgot what it was on the menu). But it had this house vinaigrette that really made it, I scarfed that disk so fast!

Here is the 3-1-1: 

Food: Michael Mina is mostly known for his seafood but his French style restaurant really has great flavors. For starters the Foie Gras parfait is definitely a shared appetizer as it is very rich for just one person. The foie gras is topped with a gelle that has a raspberry flavor and paired with perfectly toasted French bread; very rich but the foie gras flavor is suttle. Entrees included a roast chicken which I doubted at first but it was one of the best roasted chickens I ever had and was served with a mushroom bread pudding saute green beans. The salmon had a nice sear on the skin and was definitely pan roasted in butter as the fish was tender throughout. Accompanied with lentils that help balance the flavor. All in all both entrees were very rich as the portions were more than enough to not have room for dessert.

Service: Since it was a quiet week in vegas and our dinner time was early the number of staff was more than the number of diners so the service was great. Timing and recommendations was helpful and perfect.

Ambiance: Its vegas so the décor is classy and high end. Clean, elegant and since it was an early dining time the noise level was pleasantly quiet.

Holy butter!  French comfort food is the perfect description for this upscale French bistro from Michael Mina. Be prepared because the food is rich. 
So many delicious items on the menu, I couldn't decide what to order... guess I'll have to come back to try the things I missed!

So we ended up with-
Apps-
Seared Foie Lyonnais - rich beyond belief... foie was perfectly seared... the balance of the dish was perfectly complementary to the foie. 
King Crab Crepe- so good... buerre blanc and sunny side egg combined with the crab was a flavor explosion.  
Entrees-
Lamb Rack Frites- perfectly cooked, well seasoned... the chickpea frites were interesting in a good way.
Sole Meunière- nice and delicate... decent, but the weakest dish of the night.
Dessert-
Baba au rhum- holy crap this was good... literally a mouthful of butter, cream and rum soaked up by a spongy cake. 

Service and setting were spot on.  Food is delicious and decadent. Thumbs up.

Great wine selection. Interesting twist on many French staples including escargot in puff pastries and lobster Thermidor I had the Seabass with fennel and potatoes. Meet fennel and potatoes were severely under cooked and the fish lacked true flavor. My husband had the steak and frites which were delicious especially the Aoile that came with the fries. For dessert we had a crème brûlée and the chocolate macaron I love macaroons but this one seemed more like a brownie, too much filling and syrup on top. Overall this place was pretty basic and with an elevated price.The Decour was very nice although the ambience was fairly loud

Good was 5 star, I feel bad taking a star away but my drink was badhad Bloody Mary and tasted bad so stay away!!!!
Must try the French toast was amazing!!!
Definitely will go back.

This place is soso bad in service!! Our waitress was so bad!! Her name is Nerdeia! So we sat down she must be having a bad day or something she didn't come to service us until 20ish min then came back take our order we order 2 bottle as a waitress u are subpost to pour us our drink but we end up pouring our own drink. She really was out of game. I have never been this upset at a waitress in my life!!Will never come back as long as she works there

Uniformly terrible- super slow service, awful food. Don't waste your time and money. It took over an hour and a half to get some of our brunch food. We had to settle the bill because we ran out of time. The food was not good and cold. Just awful

Caught their happy hour, great food and really good prices.  The prime rib burger was very flavorful and perfectly prepared.  The real highlight was the dessert, a frozen Paris Brest.  Hazelnut ice cream, chocolate cremeux and salted Carmel sauce, and a bigger portion than I could finish.  The drink special was an old fashion with Elijah Craig 12 year.  Overall, a great meal.

Bardot is a good restaurant ; what makes it fall just short of being excellent is overall food quality and service. I ordered the fillet mingon steak which was amazing, melting in your mouth tender. My friends ordered the bass which was a bit overcooked and the rack of lamb which was a bit dry. The service also wasn't exceptional for a 5 star restaurant. We were celebrating our friend's 30th and ordered a cake dessert, which they didn't even comp - great restaurants usually do.
Sunday brunch was impressive. If you like French Toast or Onion Soup & are ready for the next level, this is it.
Every dish is amazing. Especiall Foie Gras, Steak Tartare and Lamb. My new favorite Vegas.

Excellent service + exceptional French food + endless Champagne what's not to like! Be sure to get the bone marrow, it was the best we've ever had anywhere! Mussels we fantastic, great butter sauce. Cheese plate and pork chops were excellent as well.

YES! what a nice change of pace is Las Vegas~
  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the feeling, the décor & our service was all excellent. So why only 4 stars? actually I would give 4.5 if YELP! gave half stars....the noise level is EXTREMELY high. Now that means people have having a good time, which is OK with me, however just be prepared. I was there with a old friend just catching up and were @ a 2 top and a couple times we did say to each other, "What?"
  The menu is diverse enough that everyone should be able to find a delish choice for appetizers, dinner & dessert. All our selections were very inviting to look at and MOST OF ALL tasted as good as they looked~ We both thought the price point was fare (again your on the Strip!)  
  The Bar area was hopping too, something was going on as many, many people were in costume through out the hotel.
  Bardot Brasserie is inside the Aria, have to walk a ways one inside the Aria, but this is Las Vegas so that's nothing new.

Went there for Sunday brunch our last day in Vegas.  Even without reservations we were seated in under 30 minutes.  Our server was great and brought out bread and butter promptly.  It would have been better if the baguette was warm.  Had the bloody mary which was a featured drink, nothing special about it.

We started with the escargots.  Honestly, was a bit disappointed as the order only had 4 escargots and previous pictures on Yelp showed 6.  They were tasty but very small.  For our main course we ordered, the croque madame, nutella sticky bun, and French toast.  The egg on the croque madame was perfect, runny and warm.  The French toast is huge.  It's definitely a dish that can be shared.  Really liked how they were able to keep the inside soft and custardy and the contrast of the almond brittle and vanilla mascarpone was perfect.  My favorite dish was the nutella sticky bun.  A little pricey for one sticky bun but well worth the calories and very memorable.  We'll definitely be back.

We ate here during a recent visit . There was some promise once I saw the menu . 
We ordered the charcuterie plate, bone marrow, the pork chop special and the beat salad.

Every dish was over salted. I am not one to usually complain about salt , in most cases it's a nice balance or welcoming. Every dish was heavily salted to the point where 3 of us couldn't finish our dishes. We brought it up after the meal because it was late and we really just wanted to leave because it was so busy and took about 45 min to get our check. When we did bring it up all that was said was sorry we will let chef know.  The manager on duty came by and offered to give us desert. Not really something we even wanted after with nothing but sodium on the palate . 

After. $350 meal I expected more.

Bardot is a gorgeous restaurant...the space is beautifully done and makes you feel like you're in a 1920's movie!  The staff is attentive and our waiter even spoke with a french accent (it was good enough that I couldn't tell if it was real or fake!)

We started off with a couple of specialty cocktails - I can't for the life of me remember their names but I think one was called a Great Woman or something along those lines.  It was a pink egg white drink and on top of the egg one they had a B on it in pink...nice touch for sure!  

We started with the escargot and seared foie gras.  Both were really rich dishes for sure!  The seared foie gras was perfectly cooked on a bed of rice and red cabbage.  As it was so rich I actually ate a little baguette with it to cut the flavor a bit.  The escargot wrapped in puff pastry was good but the garlic over powered it a bit.  

For entrees we shared the french onion soup and parisian gnocchi.  We are suckers for amazing french onion soup and this one didn't disappoint.  They have add ons like an egg or short rib but I think it is delicious on its own.  The last dish we had was the Parisian Gnocchi...and wow was that amazing.  The morels, truffles and spring vegetables were perfect among the pillowly gnocchi. We were so full that we didn't finish either dish but they were both fantastic.  

I'd definitely come back for another dinner...we were too full for dessert so I'll have to wait until next time.

By far the BEST French restaurant in Vegas! Bardot is a hidden gem inside Aria casino. Food is amazing, I was surprised to see how many vegetarian options they have. We started with their endive, walnut and blue cheese salad which was amazing. My husband had  chicken and my 10 year old devoured the filet mignon. I had the parisian gnocchi which was the best I ever had. This place has the most creative and delicious sides. Their macaroni and cheese is truly unique, picture attached. We also tried their chick pea frites with eggplant caviar, so delicious!! Wine selection is very good, they have wines from all over the world. However full you are, dessert is a must try. We had their creme brûlée and giant chocolate macaron and Mille feuille, couldn't decide which one was better. 
They have a great happy hour too.
Highly recommend!

Omg. This place is a must. Shannon served us and she was spectacular. The steak burger is off the charts. French toast, and crab crape are delicious. $25 bottomless rose... I'm a huge fan!! Such a great experience!

Pork chop was recommended as an entree (besides steak options) but it was a little dry. I wish it was more juicy and tender. 
Liked king crab crepe as appetizer.
If we had time we would have tried the chocolate macaron. Saved for next time! (and we are thinking about perhaps coming back for brunch next time)
Service could be better...

This is our second trip to Bardot Brasserie. We love it here! The bottomless rose is top notch and you can even get a to-go cup! If you love bacon... order a side. It's heavenly! Our server Kristina, was just lovely and ever so helpful. Thank you!! xo
Delicious food with subtle attention to detail. The blue cheese endive salad and gnocchi were fantastic.

We celebrated our first night in Vegas at Bardot Brasserie. The cheese plate was beautiful, the escargot was delicious, the king crab crepe was amazing and the black truffle fries were addictive. The ambiance really presents a true French vibe with marble, wood paneling and cool light fixtures. A great place for a casual and fun celebration!

Bardot Brasserie definitely captures a very busy and modern French bistro vibe! The Steak tartare was spot on and delicious. L'Oreilles de Cochon (crispy breaded pig ears & sauce béarnaise) were mildly crispy, slightly salted and tasty. My wife decided to have the Alaskan King Crab and Macaroni & Mimolette gratinée as entrées. It was a delight, as I was told. My Oak-Smoked Duroc Pork Chop, was super tender and full of flavor. Pretty smoky though, as advertised. The bartenders and wait staffs were not perfectly fluid, in the way they engage, anticipate my needs and communication. Just a bit rough around the edge. Just need slightly more training to make this restaurant top notch! But Overall a good meal...

Excellent French food experience. We started with a fruit and Beignet plate and a bottle of rose. Then I moved to the Duck confit . hollandaise sauce over a freshly made waffle. Simply delicious and I would stop by for brunch any time I am in Vegas!
Chef is the man! He welcomed my party with grand entrance. The kitchen has a great attitude and worked with my dietary restrictions. I would recommend this place as one the top eateries in town!

Ok, so I have had brunch here twice. Food was good. Service good but not friendly. I do have to complain about the bartenders. Both times went to get a drink first and the bar staff was so stuffy. This last Saturday night was the worst. The older gentleman who was at the bar around 6pm was just flat out rude. We ask to see the happy hour menu and he was reluctant to give it to us. We asked how is night was so far to try and warm him up but nothing. I know happy hour patrons may not be your favorite but they are still patrons. With everyone's stuffy attitudes we won't be back.m
I was really excited to try this restaurant but had a terrible experience. The service was awful and it ruined the entire experience. Would not recommend going especially as expensive as it is.
This place is  OK , good service, fair food, and wine selection.  I preferred American Fish  before.  lets see how long it lasts.  I heard brunch is good and will go back for that.
Ok you should never eat anywhere for bread and dessert, but the baguettes and chocolate macaron were so carb worthy.  The bartenders are very knowledgable so just ask them to make you something!

Excellent wine list, classy atmosphere and decor.  While the acoustics are a little loud the food in top notch and the service is excellent! Added props to. Rozita the server. She was great, memorized our orders and got it all right, she was attentive without being overbearing and extremely friendly. Great job guys!

I've been to Bardot for the 3rd time 2 weeks ago and I think Bardot has become my favorite lunch/brunch place at one of my favorite hotels(Aria). I feel like most of their items are great -amazing. 

Their egg Benedict is amazing and they really stand out because instead of your regular english muffin, they used croissant as the  base where where they topped it off with the egg and ingredients. If you really wanna go ballin, I would say get the lobster(but they have 4 other choices: PARIS HAM,BEEF BOURGIGNON,SMOKED SALMON, SURF AND TURF) because it's just so damn good. However, I have finally tried their hunter's waffle which is amazing and it's pretty much another version of egg benedict but instead they have it w/ duck confit. The duck is so flavorful, tender, and tasty. 
Some other recommendations would be mussels and frites, chicken french dip, french onion soup(make sure you add the périgord truffle, braised short rib & poached egg for a few extra bucks to really elevate the soup. I won't go into the mussels and frites which is self-explanatory but the chicken french dip is really good. Most of the dishes doesn't look like it comes w/ a lot but a lot of their dishes are really hearty and heavy that when you finished it, you would be full. The bread is so good, the chicken is so flavorful, the "dip" goes so well w/ it, the mushroom bread budding is lovely. The side of salad really helps with this dish considering it's so heavy.

Anyway, Bardot has become one of my favorite lunch/brunch place at a good price and very filling. I would recommend it to anybody who would ask me what to eat at vegas as a must.

Because all the compliments from Yelpers', we went there for Sunday brunch and ordered their special dishes, such as ESCARGOTS BARDOT, hunter's waffle, and lobster croissant. ESCARGOTS BARDOT is good but hunter's waffle and lobster croissant. 
Let's start with lobster croissant, this dish doesn't keep up with the price I paid,$32. You expect the croissant to be crispy and buttery and when you put lobster on the top, a good chef should consider it might get soggy and try to do something about it. However, it didn't and you even can see watery croissant because of  water from lobster. Don't even mention about hunter's waffle, it tastes exactly like lobster croissant just changed the lobster to duck confit because the sauce they used is the same. It is like playing Lego you put stuffs you need and do nothing to balance the ingredient. I am very disappointed about their dishes and for price I paid, Bouchon at The Venetian is doing better than Bardot.

Top notch restaurant. 

I came here for a friends 30th birthday. We had to pick a nice restaurant to really treat him since he chartered a private jet and paid 3,000 for our suite. So this is what we chose and it lived up to our expectations.  

Ambiance: modern take on traditional French architecture. Contrasted colors and brass everywhere. Very clean.  

Drinks. I got a mescal drink with tobasco - it was not on the menu, but was fantastic. 

Apps: I got bone marrow and escargot 

Bone marrow : like always very good with chutney on the side. 

Escargot: I didn't care for the fact that the snails were so hidden under so much stuff. But taste was good. 

Food:

Lobster : amazing!  Definitely an a plus dish. 

Sea bass : cooked perfectly. 

Mac and cheese: neat take on the typical side dish. Seared on two sides. Also my looked like a pancake.  

French onion soup: best I've ever had.

Excellent food and service. Went for Mother's Day brunch on the Saturday before. Our server was wonderful. We started with some of the items off the starter menu. The pastry basket was amazing. It was like you are getting pastry on Paris ! The other were great as well. The size and flavor of the bacon slices on the American in Paris breakfast was beyond expectations
Highly recommend .

Amazing! We had the foie gras patee, filet mignon with fries, and creme brulee. The bread with real butter was so good! For two of us not including drinks the bill was $200 plus $40 tip. Excellent service and food!!! Dressy atmosphere so wear your best.

Fabulous ambiance and service. You must try the escargot and duck wings for starter. Superb! the Lobster Thermidor was not what you would expect, all creamy and on rice, but sensational and even more succulent! Our server was the best but I can't remember his name though he was 100 percent French. Definitely a "do again".

Las Vegas, Nevada - Aria

I usually don't 5-star Vegas restaurants but this place was really excellent.

Foie gras, salmon, yellowfin tuna nicoise excellent.  Others at our table had mussels, filet, cheese plate et cetera.  Everything was great.  The gnocchi was the best I've ever had.   

Also, pricing was very reasonable for LV.  Our tab was $120, including tax & tip, for 2 glasses of wine, 2 entrees, and the Foie gras. Also great baguettes.

I'm going to start by saying a big portion of my rating is due to the atmosphere here... No, I probably shouldn't rate a place so highly based on that. But, this restaurant is truly beautiful and I felt classy as hell eating here! From the beautiful bar to the awesome waitress, it all was one pleasant picture.

For the food itself, it was good, but it didn't blow my mind. I ordered their sea bass based on a recommendation and again, good, but not sure I'd ever return specifically for that dish. I thought the lemon was a bit too overpowering. I did enjoy the cheese platter that we ordered though and their bread/butter is truly scrumptious! Their cocktails are also great. I think overall, I would definitely be back since the experience itself was lovely. I would just be sure to branch out and try something else the next time around.

This place is okay. Definitely not one of the better meals I had during my trip to Vegas. It's a little ho hum. Hubby and I ordered appetizers and smaller plates to share. Most of it is pretty unmemorable to me except the King Crab Crepe. That was the one item that was really savory and flavorful. I would highly recommend getting that if you eat here. It's not a bad place to eat by any means, and the ambiance is nice. It truly does have the brasserie feel. I just think there are lots of better places to eat.

Wonderful find! The food was creative and absolutely delicious. Service was excellent! A must try! The escargot, hunters waffle and truffle fries were dreamy! Thank you Oscar Alfaro for your recommendations, menu knowledge and wonderful experience.

I went here for brunch with 15 people and we all felt disrespected and mistreated by the waiter. He told three of us to "relax" three separate times. He personally told me to relax when I asked if he could bring me ketchup when he had a chance. The food was average, but after this experience you couldn't pay me to go back. This is my first time writing a negative review on yelp. I am not one to complain but I felt this was necessary. My friend spoke to the manager about the poor and undeserved service we had, yet we had nothing taken off our bill. In all, terrible horrible, experience.

Since I heard Michael Mina set off to refresh American Fish with a new brasserie concept, I was thrilled - it could've been a welcome addition to the scene with the likes of Bouchon Bistro and db Brasserie. So we decided we would go there for brunch.

The execution however, was less than ideal I must say.

- Onion Soup Gratinée with Périgord truffle, braised oxtail, soft poached egg -$25
- King Crab Crêpe - buckwheat crêpe, wild mushrooms, normandy beurre blanc $16
- Mussels Marinières - garlic butter, dolin vermouth, warm baguette $26

A small baguette and salted butter were served first, and the baguette was cold - not fresh out of the oven, not even warmed up. A simple way to tell if a restaurant cares about details, if at all serving a hot bread counts as details.

The Onion Soup Gratinée was good, but to enjoy the deluxe version with those ingredients like truffle, oxtail and poached egg, we had to pay double.

King Crab Crêpe was also an interesting concept. As it's aptly categorized as Hors-d'uvre, it was pretty small. The wild mushrooms were a bit too salty, but it's well done overall.

The flavor of Mussels Marinières was good, but the mussels were undercooked - almost raw. Not only that, it was cooked unevenly - one part of the shellfish was cold and another was warm. It struck me as a failure.

And they didn't bring me a bowl for empty shells. Well... how was I supposed to eat them without it?? I was so curious that I decided to see when they would realize if I put those empty shells to a bread plate and... as I almost expected, it was when I finished the plate 99% and the bread plate was about to unleash an avalanche with the mountain of empty shells.

The food was a OK, service was less than average, and payout $85 including tax and tip. Will return? I don't think so - we have better options.

Outstanding brunch. Got the fois gras parfait. Creamy, yummy and it's balance with the gelee was amazing. It came with buttered brioche bread which was a perfect balance of crunchy yet soft. Then I got the famous French onion dip with the accompaniments. I don't even like that soup but this was incredible. Because it was two heavy dishes I opted to not finish them but they were delicious! They both are very rich so I'd rather sample and enjoy than overload. Service was lovely and they give u crunchy French bread with salted butter. So yummy! Great decor. Highly recommend.
Amazing seafood, prepared to perfection.  Also had the colossal sized chocolate macaron, delicious.  Bathrooms felt like I was in a 5 diamond men's club.

Went for breakfast while staying at the Aria.  Great food! Generous portions and it was delicious!  However the service was just awful.  It took 10 minutes to get coffee, water wasn't refilled.  When it was time to leave we asked for the check.  It took another full 10 minutes to bring the check!  I had to track down the server just to get the check.  

I've never walked out on a bill in my life, but was tempted to here as the delay nearly made me late for an appointment.
Place was amazing anyone in vegas should try this place highly recommended.The service and food was incredible

Had reservations last night at 8:30 for 4. We're in from Dallas. I'm going to say it was a software problem? We arrived on time. Was asked to have a seat outside. No one stopped to offer us drinks. Although persons with trays came by. We gave up on that. We waited 45 min. A lot of employee activity at the checkin. Obviously a problem.
Finally we were seated. I looked around and barely any tables had food on them only drinks. yikes.
So possible staffing problem too. A mess.
Our waitress was fabulous and the meal was super. We ordered the lamb for 2. Awesome! Could've been for 4.
Foie gras was a miss, there was a consistency problem. Great banquettes and tasty butter.
Gnocchi was great! Macaroni was excellent! Chicken was delicious and juicy! Prepared perfectly! 
So, they came through in the end. 
I believe fixing the hostess issue quicker than 45 min. With an experienced or aware manager I would've given them a 5 star. 
$200 bottle of wine great choice...and de cantered. But the sommelier was very late on locating the bottle and seemed stressed. There were a lot of stressed employees. Need to work it out

2 wks ago I went to Bardot Brasserie on a date. I want to commend the waiters for exceptional service. Our waiter recognized we were on a date and gave us the space and time to get to know each other. My date had the french onion soup which was marvelous, and I had the king crab crepe. It was gorgeous and had great flavor, but it was served warm, not hot. By the 3rd bite, it was cold. I thought maybe that was what this dish's temp was supposed to be. then we had entrees, I had the pork chop with their wild macaroni side. The chop was also warm, not hot, and so was the macaroni. let me be clear: none of the food we were served was above room temp. I would have returned all of it but for date appearances. the chop was brined and very well seasoned. but it was cold! the dessert, apple tart tartin, was one of the best I ever had. Sadly, most of the meal was the same temp as the ice cream on top of the tartin.

Excellent green (side) salad & Loup de Mer fish, very fresh!
But the standout was my Pavlova dessert!  Absolutely perfect ratio of dry, slightly chewy meringue & berries & simple fresh whipped cream all topped with the heavenly slightly tart cassis sauce which the waiter poured on after setting it down in front of me.

One of the best restaurants on the strip!  The service was spot on and the foie gras was delicious.  Cannot wait to go back just for that alone.  So good in fact, the server said he came to work for Bardot after having it?!

Another meal, another Michael Mina restaurant. Never a disappointment.

We started with a few items to share like their escargot which is a little different from the traditional plates/skillets with circular dents to hold the snails. These were not drenched in butter/sauce and were still delicious. I should also mention that their complimentary baguettes were delicious with butter.

I decided to order the Chicken French Dip. I'm usually not a fan of french dip sandwiches, but this one stood out to me because it had mushroom bread pudding in it. One bite was like a mouthful of Thanksgiving except the turkey part. When you think about it, it makes sense: the luscious bread pudding texture with mushrooms, and the haricot verts (much like a green bean casserole) and with pieces of chicken that were moist (unlike dry turkey). I was really happy with my choice.

I also had a bite of their Hunter's waffle which is another popular choice with duck confit in it. Think of an eggs benedict but with a waffle and duck confit.

Service was fantastic. Our waitress kept stopping by to warm up my coffee and they were absolutely attentive with picking up plates and even providing us recommendations. It's kind of a hard choice between whether or not I like Bardot more than Bouchon, but if you really want more pastries, go for Bouchon. I think Bardot has a more extensive menu of rich and savory plates.

Had a great brunch here on Saturday after mistakenly coming here on Friday the day before. The gentleman at the check in was nice enough to cancel my Friday reservation for us. While we were sitting on the lovely outdoor seating area trying to figure out a plan for lunch he was kind enough to bring us 2 cups of lovey cold water in plastic cups and advised us to keep hydrated with all the hot dry air. That was such great customer service to people who weren't even customers at the time. I really appreciated the kind gesture. When we came the next day for brunch I asked what the gentleman's name was who had been in the front yesterday and described his features and as I was doing so we spotted each other and I expressed our excitement to be back for actual brunch. I came to find out that his name is Matej and he is the manager, a great manager at that. We had an excellent server, Oscar who was funny and helpful. In the middle of the meal Matej came by to check in on us and we let him know how delicious everything was. Loved everything from the yummy softened salted butter and baguette to the savory sweet Foie Gras and the French toast was the best my husband has ever had, everything we had was delicious. At the end of our meal Oscar let us know that Matej had filled him in on our little mishap from the day before and had sent out delicious complimentary desserts for the birthday boy and my husband for Father's Day. Both of the reasons why we were celebrating. Definitely recommend Bardot for the amazing food and service. I really appreciate it when a restaurant knows there are literally hundreds of good restaurants in Vegas to dine and value you as a customer.
Fantastic resturant!  Amazing atmosphere.  Great drinks but even better food .  I highly recommend for a great date night.

Bardot Brasserie is at its best!  

Lauren C or Lucky Charm ~ either way L.C. and I have good luck at our dining adventures.  Located on the second floor of Aria, it's a treasure!  When you receive impeccable service with incredible food, I'll be back for more.

Our dining excursion led us to sample several hors d'oeuvres as well as desserts.  Let's start with the hors d'oeuvres.  The Prime Steak Tartare is ground to order and served with a sauce verte, egg yolk on top with gaufrette potatoes.  The steak tartare is presented beautifully.  When you break the yolk to ooze into the tartare, it's perfect.  The Onion Soup Gratinee couldn't be better with the cave-aged gruyere covering the dish.  The winner of our starters for me is the King Crab Crepe.  Perfectly delicate with black trumpet mushrooms, sunny side egg. The normandy cider beurre blanc on the side could've been smothered on everything I ate.  I fell in love with this sauce.  

Onto the fun stuff, Dessert.  We probably went overboard but we that's our thing.  We split 3... yes 3.  The Mille Feuille, Apple tart and Cherry Clafouti.  All had an intense and rich flavor.  Each had their own unique characteristic.  What stood out was the Cherry Clafouti.  It's warm cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream on top.  The cherry pudding was more like a cherry bread pudding.  Very sweet and savory.  The pistachio ice cream complimented the dessert so perfectly.  

I wish I had our waitresses name since she was so attentive.  She was great with recommendations and accommodating to our needs.  Her service was the cherry on top to a 5 star experience.

Bardot was awesome. Did a tapas style brunch so we could try a bit of everything( as recommended by our top notch waiter Oscar). Tartar, Foie gras parfait and French toast(best I've had) were my favorites. Service was great and staff very friendly. 
   Manager Matej customer service was outstanding. Had met him the day before, we came by for brunch and were told that they only do brunch on Saturdays and Sundays. So we rescheduled for the next day and sat at the tables in front of restaurant deciding what to do for lunch. 
A moment later Matej came up and handed us waters and said going to be hot out there today,  got to keep hydrated. Next day he remembered us and thanked us for coming back and checked on us personally. Then later sent us some complementary birthday/Father's Day desserts. 
  Definitely coming back.

Terrific Service, Food & Ambiance!  Truly one of the best meals I've ever experienced in Vegas.  Our waiter "Nelson" was outstanding, he was attentive, but not overboard.  Lively atmosphere, great wines by the glass and the bartenders pride themselves on making your drink the way you like it.  Can't wait to go back.

Atmosphere:
Overall I loved the theme this place has going for it. It's kind of tucked away in the Aria. Most foot traffic wouldn't even know it was there unless they were looking for it.


Food:
Our cocktails were delicious.

The bread they serviced was not sliced. I know its a small gripe but it can make a world of difference in an upscale restaurant. It also didn't help that the bread was baked to the point where cutting / breaking it at a table just made a big mess.

We had the gnocchi and filet mignon.

The gnocchi was good but not great. I was expecting more based on reviews.

The filet mignon I ordered medium and came out well. We were short on time so I didn't bother having it corrected. The meat overall was still good for it not being cooked to my liking.


Service:
Service was outstanding. We had a reservation so we were seated quickly. Our waiter was very informative about the menu. I'm not sure if this was apart of the experience but our photos were taken by a worker. She had said she would get us a copy before we were done with dinner but we were gone before she came back.

Overall:
I definitely will give Bardot another chance when I'm in town. I would definitely recommend it. I would also recommend not rushing through dinner here as well.
We had breakfast here on our last trip and will be having twice on our next trip amazing breakfast amazing service wish they had breakfast every day

I have to say this has been my favorite Brunch in Vegas. I hate to say it, but even better than Bouchon Bistro. Michael Mina's French Brasserie located in the Aria Hotel is beautifully decorated Parisian style which transports you to a cafe in Paris. The first Brunch item was the Paris Eggs Benedict which was a variation of the traditional Eggs Benedict which is usually served on an English Muffin. Instead the eggs were nestled on top of a buttery flaky croissant. Must I say this was perfection and was Simply divine. We also ordered the French Toast which was made of Brioche and had a caramelized top. It was served with Vanilla Marscapone, candied almonds and instead of maple syrup it was served with orgeat syrup which is a sweet syrup made of almonds. Simply divine. For the side dish I had to try the macaroni gratinee.  This dish was a take on Macaroni and cheese but elevated to new heights. All of the Macaroni are perfectly aligned standing upright. How, you ask, I have no idea, but who cares the taste was amazing. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Vegas.  I might even stay at The Aria just to have easier access to Bardot Brasserie.
Phenomenal service and food. Chef Josh provides a once in a lifetime experience. Don't miss out on an incredible experience. Location is amazing. I will definitely be back!

Came here for Valentine's Day with my whole family.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and I'm giving them 4 stars based on the consensus of my group.  My boyfriend thought it was salty.  I had more of a 3 star experience - my filet mignon was not prepared as ordered and I sent it back.  I NEVER do that, but this steak was $54!!  I mean, come on!  It better be melt in your mouth orgasmic for that amount of money! And it truly was a very average filet, HOWEVER, after requesting it be redone, they did as I asked, fixed the problem and even took the item off the bill, so they more than compensated for the deficit.  I didn't mind paying for it but it just needed to be a $54 steak.  If you're gonna charge that, make it worth it.  But other than my solitary experience, like I said, the rest of my family seemed pleased, with their Salmon, Pork Chop, Chicken and less pricey steak.  Bread was yummy too.  Oh, and the ladies each got a long stem rose with dinner, for V Day.  Charming touch.  Nothing says romance like having dinner with your mother and two brothers.
Very good salad! Just giving it 4 stars because the onion soup of my husband was cold. But the place is beautiful and the servers very cordial.

This is my boyfriends favorite French restaurant! 

We have eaten here on numerous occasions and the food is always awesome! For brunch I highly recommend les moules e frites (mussels), and the Maine lobster scramble. The French toast is also good but MASSIVE so I suggest you share it with at least one other person. My boyfriend loves the fruit plate, hunters waffle, and prime rib sandwich. The quiches here are also to die for, especially the mushroom and goat cheese!

For dinner, we come here less often, but we enjoy the escargot appetizer, and the steaks are decent. They have lots of special tasting/meal menus that change on the regular! 

The reason this restaurant has 4 instead of 5 stars is the service. It is hit or miss. There are times where the service has been average, and bearable, but there have been two times where the service has been absolutely AWFUL (I won't bore you with the details). I've never had service here that I thought was outstanding. It's always either average or poor.

Overall, I'll be back because it's the best French food in Vegas! Just don't eat here if you're in a hurry!

I expected nothing less than excellent food and service and Bardot Brasserie didn't disappoint. My friend made reservations about a month before since it can get pretty busy on weekends. They have an extensive wine list and let us try a sample before we made our selection. We decided on wonderful Vouvray. Service was impeccable. Our server was attentive but not overbearing.  

For appetizers I tried the escargot which was different then how it's traditionally prepared. There are 6 that come on a wood plank served in a puff pastry topped with a pesto sauce. It was very flavorful. My date got the foie gras which was accompanied by a thick, crusty bread. Very tasty! For our main entrees we tried the lamb chops which were cooked and seasoned perfectly. We skipped on the coffee and dessert (although the creme brulee was tempting) as we were both full. Wonderful experience from start to finish!

For me, even if the food isn't an insanely good gastronomic experience, if the service is on point, then the restaurant earns a 5 star-rating. Bardot is the rare combination where the food was flavorful (and filling!) and the service was top notch. 
I ordered the Warm Beet Salad to share with a friend and a French Toast all for myself. Let me say that the French Toast can EASILY be split two ways. It's massive! The fluffy toast was served with crunchy almond brittle, vanilla mascarpone, and orgeat (almond-y) syrup. It's a well thought out dish and the perfect combination of dense, moist, and caramelization. 
The beet salad was pretty good. The vinaigrette was subtle and didn't take flavor away from the beets, goat cheese, or arugula. For an $18 salad, attention to detail was expected and accordingly presented. 
The coffee was pleasant and the servers made sure my cup was never empty. I was impressed with their speed despite a busy Sunday brunch crowd. 

To add icing on the already pleasant experience, Bardot presented each diner with a complimentary cinnamon roll in celebration of their 1 year birthday. 

Overall, the ambiance, the service, the huge French Toast portion, and the free cinnamon roll blew me away. LOVED!

A beautifully decorated room. Warm colors & festive, instantly transporting you to  Paris, France. 
My friends & I were escorted to a nice comfortable room with a big 4 top table. Thank goodness it wasn't a little table!  That part of a Paris Brasserie was left out of our experience. 
Our first course was the Pate de Champagne, Foie Gras Parfait, & Fruits de Mer. LOVED the Pate de Champagne with the port wine gelee. The perfect combo of sweet & salty. I couldn't get enough of the melt in your mouth love. The Foie Gras Parfait had a textbook European Foie Gras  texture I liked it but I do prefer the Pate creaminess. My friends who are from Europe absolutely loved it. The cornichons that acompanied the Foie Gras balanced the dish with it's salty sour flavor. And of course the Fruits de Mer was lovely in presentation as well as taste. My taste buds were soooo happy!
Our mains were Lobster Thermador & Rack of Lamb. The presentation of the Lobster Thermador was beautiful. 2 huge pieces of Lobster (shared by 2) topped with Brandy cream Bernaise. The Bernaise sauce was whipped to look like a cloud of French heaven. It was lovingly baked on the 
Lobster. I was sad that I didn't order that till my Lamb Crown Roast was put before me. 
Lamb was done perfectly. It was juicy & spiced just right. It was supposed to be for 2 people but the portion was so huge 3 could've been very satisfied with this delectable entree. I was suprised at the vegetable that  accompanied my Lamb. I thought that I hated Eggplant. The Chef & his staff proved me wrong. It was a puree of Eggplant topped with pesto sauce. It was such an amazing balance of flavors, salty & sweet. We also had mushrooms a la grecque & green beans almondine. The mushrooms were soooo delicious I really wished I didn't have to share that dish. It was heavenly & melted in my mouth. Not that they were mushy, but so perfectly cooked. Sadly the green beans were overly salted. So mush that no one ate much of it. 
The last course was our 2 desserts. Coupe de Glacee which was the sorbet of the day, Strawberry topped with merengue. You would think eh, sorbet, so pedestrian. But this presentation was amazing! It was so unusual I actually took a picture of it. I'm not one of those camera foodies, but this desert looked so good. The merengue topping looked like little clouds of heaven. Not overly sweet, perfectly crunchy & yummy. The sorbet under the merengue had little bits of strawberry whipped into it. Aria has perfected the sorbet, what else can I say. We also had the classic Creme Caramel topped with a spun sugar cookie. It was also quite delicate & great with our after dinner espressos.  
The service was exceptional. The Bardot staff was so attentive, patiently explaining our questions. I really appreciate good service which in my town is sadly lacking at most strip venues. These professionals were at the top of their craft. Cudos to them! 
I was so happy that I took my friends to this restaurant. It's a gamble to go to a restaurant in the first weeks of a grand opening. A lot can go wrong as the staff is still working out the kinks. Evidently these people are the creme de la creme of fine dining. The food & service was superb! Bravo & Bon Apetit!!

Everything was so good here. The 14oz Double Cut Ribeye was to die for. It was so tender and juicy that it melted in your mouth. The food portions were big. Everyone enjoyed their dishes: Bone Marrow Au Poivre, Seared Foie Gras Lyonnaise and Lamb Rack "Frites". The service was okay because it was a tad slow, but it wasn't a full-house night.

Great Happy Hour from 5-7pm in the bar/lounge! The bartender was very friendly. Awesome decor and ambience. $5 bartenders choice cocktail or red/white wine. A decent list of $5-$6 appetizers. I loved the tuna tartare, the pomme frites, and the escargot. You can skip the macaroni and cheese. I'll be back!

You can never go wrong with Michael Mina or Aria.  Although I had trouble deciphering the menu, the food was wonderful.  The ambience was great.  The place is beautiful. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I loved the French onion soup and would definitely return for the giant chocolate macaron.

5 stars all the way for Bardot! It's one of the best French places I've been to!

+ Escargot. 6 individual puff pastures ($18). Each one is packed with butter/garlic flavor! I'm not sure how they did this and still in awe about it because escargot is typically doused in butter and garlic but instead, the butter and garlic flavors are all embedded into the puff pastry. When you take a bite into the puff pastry he the escargot itself is actually pretty hot but the outside (the puff pastry) is warm.

+ Smoked Salmon Croissant Benedict (FTW!). I am SO GLAD I went with this because I was debating between this and the lobster option. I love salmon but was told both were equally as good, just depends on what you're craving. The smoked salmon, hollandaise and croissant are all buttery goodness! They all pair so well together and the quality of the smoked salmon is like nothing I've ever had! The croissant isn't your typical croissant, but made to compliment the fillings (i.e. Egg, kale and of course salmon in this case).

The coffee is good too! I tried a few other things but can't remember since it's been some time since my visit - BUT - the quality of food here is amazing for the price! Service was attentive and on point. They have officially become my new favorite French restaurant!

Review is for brunch.  The restaurant was pretty full at 11am Saturday, but they had open seating around a large bar.  Bartenders were great and I swear one of them looked like tennis legend John McEnroe!  

We ordered four dishes to share:

Escargot in Puff Pastry: These were incredibly good - just four bite-sized pieces unfortunately.  You would never know you're eating snails, so definitely newbie friendly.

Smoked Salmon: This dish was an assemble-yourself project. Lots of slices of smoked salmon, a small loaf of bread, pre-sliced, avocado, and cream cheese. You basically make your own sandwich.  Pretty good - salmon was fresh, not "fishy."  

Hunters Waffle: This savory dish has two perfectly poached eggs and some really good shredded duck confit - almost a play on a conventional Benedict.  

Seasonal Fruit Platter: A surprisingly good appetizer that could double as a healthy  dessert.  Buckwheat sugar-coated beignets, a cake-like side of yogurt parfait with nuts and a sweet crust, and an assortment of fresh fruit including grapes, pineapples, figs, strawberry, and passionfruit!  I liked the yogurt parfait the best - better than cheesecake!

Would definitely recommend this place for an early brunch or lunch!

Went here for dinner before seeing Zarkana. We wanted to eat light, so we didn't get a chance to really enjoy the full menu. 

My boyfriend ordered the gnocchi and I ordered the endive, walnut, and blue cheese salad and the French onion soup. 

The salad was delicious. It had the right amount of watercress and vinaigrette to complement the main ingredients.  My soup wasn't too salty, as I've noticed some French onion soups to be. I tasted my boyfriend's dish and it was light with not too much sauce. 

I also had the De Peche Mode cocktail. I forget exactly what was in it but I think it had chamomile, honey, whiskey?, peach something or other, and a sprig of thyme. It was pretty strong, I was impressed. 

Overall great experience. Loved the decor and ambiance. Staff was attentive and professional. The noise level was pretty bad though. People talking loudly over the music which you could barely hear.

Simply spectacular. 

We went with a party of eight foodies. Fortunately for me, everyone loved to share and I was able to taste a bit of everything. Each dish I tried was better than the last, from appetizers through dessert. 

The French onion soup was a special favorite, and might truly be the best version of this soup I've ever had. Even the broth was scrumptious. But the goblet it comes in is HUGE. Share this one!

The tuna tartare was a pleasant surprise! I'm not usually a fish fan, so I was delighted to find this dish so tasty. 

The duck wings with orange sauce are out of this world! Just do yourself a favor and order it, and don't forget to dunk a bite in the yummy hollandaise sauce served in a little orange half. Mmmmm!

The filet mignon was perfection. So tender, so tasty. And the fries served with it (frites) were so rich and delectable -- no doubt thanks to the beef fat they are cooked in. 

For dessert, I tried the rum cake and the creme brûlée. The rum cake was a bit strong for me, but that creme brûlée was fantastic. It hardly lasted a full minute on the table before being gulped up. 

This place is superb. Can't wait to come back and try brunch!

My husband and I were very impressed by the food and service at Michael Mina's BARDOT Brasserie! 

We made dinner reservations for our first night in Vegas and we felt like we were taken to Paris with fine ingredients, French decor, and our spectacular and charming server! 

Even though the menu isn't too extensive, we were unsure of what to order at first. Everything sounded so good. We finally decided to share the grilled duck wings a l'orange and bone marrow appetizers, beets salad, and Parisian gnocchi with a side of fois gras. 

We had to add the fois gras after reading several good reviews and my goodness, it was just fatty delicacy! My hubby loved it. The Parisian gnocchi was fluffy and pillowy soft. I thought the gnocchi and fois gras combination made that particular dish a bit on the heavy side, especially with the addition of cream. But it was a small portion size so it wasn't hard to finish. The shaved black truffles was also a nice touch to the dish. 

I loved how the beets salad had huge chunks of red and orange beets. The vinaigrette and baked Brie and goat cheeses were a nice touch. We really liked that dish. 

The bone marrow was also fatty goodness as I try to scoop up every ounce of it with the thick toast. I thought there was little bone marrow for the price and wished for more of it than bread. 

I've never had duck wings before but it was meaty (doesn't look like it in the pictures) and had a nice sweet glaze that combines well with the cream that had a hint of orange flavor. 

We thoroughly enjoyed the food and definitely ordered more than we can finish. The service was excellent and the restaurant is just beautiful that we would love to return when we're back in Vegas.

Overall, good food. They served us warm bread, which is always a good sign of a restaurant that knows food. The escargot bites were my favorite and the octopus was supple and tender. The lobster bisque on the other hand, was bitter and tangy. Don't order this. My husband's fish was handled perfectly though...

Hands down one of the best restaurants at the Aria!  The decor and ambiance are perfect for a quiet dinner.  The service is impeccable.  The sommelier knows his wine and is on the dinning room floor at all times to attend to guests.  The food is excellent.  The bone marrow, endive salad, and fillet are a must.  The steaks come with fries but you can substitute them.  I would recommend you substitute the fries for the Brussels sprouts.  They are cooked to perfection and taste so yummy.  Even if you don't like Brussels sprouts you should try them, you'll change your mind about them.  Bardot is a must when staying at the Aria!

Bardot is beautiful. The food is fantastic. Go there wearing your fat pants. The end.

Okay, so obviously reviews need a bit more detail but that's the gist of it. Bardot stands out in a city overwhelmed with French restaurants both on- and off-Strip. It's great for a business meal, a date night, a special event, or even just sitting at the bar for dessert to treat yourself. So far my visits have been limited to a networking event with passed appetizers and seafood and a group brunch, but I'll definitely be back for dinner soon.

Standouts include their cheese (duh), charcuterie, fresh oysters, escargot, and any incarnation of terrine or foie gras. I'm sure their entrees are great, but I'd go wild with multiple appetizers instead. My next visit will include the beef tartare and onion soup for sure.

You can't go wrong with their brunch options. Mussels have a great, complex broth and a massive mountain of a portion. The giant French toast is amazingly light with a great vanilla mascarpone and the world's fanciest granola bar garnish. The Hunter's Waffle with duck confit was a nice balance of sweet and savory. It took all of my self control not to run off with Cint B's Short Rib Croissant Benedict.  

Just go, tout de suite.

This was a great choice for dinner. Our server was very friendly from the first interaction which set the tone for the evening. We started with octopus as our starter which was delicious, perfectly cooked with a lively flavor. We decided on the pork chop and the flat iron steak for our entrees. The pork chop presentation was beautiful and the steak looked delicious. The meat texture and seasoning was excellent although my girlfriend said the steak bordered on too salty. One thing that stood out was how attentive the staff was. They got refills about 10 times during the meal and we were asked how everything was multiple times to ensure our satisfaction. It was a great experience.

Service was very slow but the food was pretty good. One couple next to us walked out without being served.  My husband had to wait until after I got my soup to get his beer.The onion soup was hot and gratin was perfect. My husband was disappointed in his filet - both quality and execution. The chicken roti was nicely done although I would have put the lemon sauce on the bottom.  Serving it on top took away from the crispness of the skin. The savory mushroom bread pudding DID need a sauce badly. Overall the restaurant was okay but overpriced for the value and service.

Ordered the steakburger. They gave it two tries. First, it was so over cooked that it was a hockey puck. Second try was so raw that it wasn't even staying in a patty. Neither was the medium rare that I ordered. 

Our server never checked to see if the second burger was correct and didn't seem to care when the burger remained on the plate at the end of the meal. 

Avoid this place. Not worth the price.

If I could give SIX stars I would do so.

We stopped by earlier to confirm that we wanted to spend our anniversary evening at Bardot and upon inquiring about a particular dish that we love there from past experiences, we discovered that it was served only for brunches, not dinners.   We thought that was that.  But the front hostess actually called out a server to discuss the item with us to confirm that we were speaking about the same item.  We made the reservation.

Upon arrival in the evening, we were promptly seated.   We were properly greeted and taken care of.  I ordered a rib eye steak but it came out overcooked a bit.  But at the luxary price that I paid for it, I returned it to the kitchen and asked for the lamb chops.   The manager, Mr. Anthony Carideo - general manager - came to my table and in one of the most excellent exhibitions of proper customer care, was nice, communicative, not overly drippingly fake, and admitted fault - immediately - "it was overcooked - I looked at it and it was cooked medium well" (I ordered medium).   We chatted a bit about life, and he appropriately moved on.  The chops arrived and as the rest of the food, including my wife's and our other dishes, and drinks, they were excellent - fantastic.

But wait.  The best was last.  At the conclusion of the meal, they brought to us THE SPECIAL DISH that we wanted so much that is not normally made for dinners.  It is a like a fruit/yogurty type of a tray.  We were happily surprised.  We also had our photos professionally taken there and bought the photo.

Thanks Bardot - you were the BEST part of our Vegas trip.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! First time in Vegas and this brunch has been absolutely fantastic. All the food was delicious and our server Tish was one of the BEST servers I've ever had. Tish was so friendly and gave the best recommendations of food and was sweet and prompt about everything. Our table ordered the French toast and hash browns with Gruyere (picture below), onion soup (picture below), mussels, steak burger, steak Benedict and oysters and everything was delicious. One of the best brunches I've ever been to and bottomless rose for $25 which was always refilled and we all enjoyed! If you're in Vegas you should 100% try this brunch and make sure to request Tish as your server. Matéj was the manager on the floor that day and was also so kind and came over to talk with us to ensure we enjoyed our time. Come to Vegas and come to Bardot.

French Toast heaven..imagine a largest brioche single cut of bread ever..pre-soaked in egg mixture (hours or night before) then fried by pan until every side is super crispy and fluffy.  Served with vanilla mascarpone, orgeat syrup, and almond brittle.  Everything else was good...French toast was the best..by my judgement...but judge for yourself!

We got a burnt onion soup, it happens, don't expect to get it at a place that charges 20 something dollar for it but sometimes it's the bottom of the pot, it happens. What doesn't need to happen is a CHAUVINIST SUPERVISOR WORKING IN VEGAS at the 21st century. RAYMOND came to apologize on behalf of the BARDOT Brasserie, my friend and I were sitting at the bar, I had the soup and I'm also a female, Raymond came to us introduce himself to my friend (the male) shook his hand and then waved at me, I guess to acknowledge my existence and then apologized to my friend (the male) for the soup he never ate, didn't give me a second look and left. 
I was and still am furious, by the way I'm not insecure, I am not a weak woman and I don't consider myself an active feminist but to be treated like I'm a piece of something sitting next to a male by a restaurant's CHAUVINIST SUPERVISOR after I choose to spend my money there (yes, believe it or not I pay for my share) is unacceptable.
 As for the rest, most food was ok, Steak Tartare and Foie Gras Parfait were really good and Jason's service at the bar that was impeccable, if not for that encounter with that idiot (accuse my language) I would probably agree with the 4 stars review but I did meet that supervisor and I'm still furious, they don't deserve our money especially when there are so many other options, maybe even owned by women, here's an idea for you.

Continuing our endless mission of finding cheese and charcuterie plates, we ended up at Bardot for a nice dinner. 

From the start, the service was prompt, courteous, and friendly. Our server helped us narrow down our cheese selection and the sommelier was very knowledgeable. We live in wine country and wanted to venture out from the familiar California wines of Napa and Sonoma. We were looking for something oaky, buttery, and smooth...with a twist. The sommelier guided us to a nice bottle of 2012 Louis Jadot Meursault, a Chardonnay. 

The wine was just what we were looking for.  It had a smooth buttery taste with a touch oak and a hint of mouthfeel.  

Our cheese and charcuterie plates were excellent. The cheese selections were a tad small, but they tasted great.    The charcuterie plate was sized well and in both cases, the accompaniments provided fun additional flavors. 

Our main dishes were a major let down. We had the salmon with lentils and gnocchi. The fish was cooked well, flakey with crispy skin, but was a touch heavy on the salt.  The lentils were too salty to eat. I liked the flavor profile they were going for but after two bites and a bitter face, I was done. 

The gnocchi was also too salty.  Parmesan dishes are usually salty, but this was over the edge. On the plus side, the gnocchi was very tender. The asparagus was woody and stringy. 

I debated to give this restaurant 3 or 4 stars.  The main dishes were some of the worst I've had at any of the nicer restaurants in Vegas, but the service was excellent and our appetizers were really good.  I would like to hope that my experience was an off night for the chef.  I decided on 3 because the main course should be the highlight of a meal, not the appetizer.

We showed up a couple minutes early for our 7:00pm reservation and were promptly escorted to our table. The service- Our waitress from beginning to end was attentive without being annoying. (I'm kicking myself for not remembering her name). She checked in frequently, helped correct a minor thing with one of our dishes, and had a great personality. The food- wonderful! We had the bone marrow (heaven!), beet salad, frisée salad, mussels, and half chicken. Everything was done perfectly and was flavorful and holy crap good! We had to roll on out of the restaurant and didn't get a chance to try dessert (I guess we'll have to go back). The wine by the glass selection was broad enough to easily pair with each dish. Yes, it was a pricey meal, but worth every penny!

Well done Bardot team!

My server Andrea M made my meal even better. Divine French AOC grade butter, foie gras and onion soup with a poached egg. What's not to love?

Very friendly and knowledgeable service. Excellent hand crafted cocktail. Beautiful room. Hurry up and go!

Awesome place.  Had a very helpful and friendly waiter John-Paul. He was able to personally recommend things because he has tried it himself.  I would recommend asking for him. Great experience and food. It was a little loud in the main area but I am looking forward to going back soon. Fresh warm baguette in a bag with salted butter yum.
We come to Vegas a lot. Each time we stop here because the breakfast is nothing short of outstanding. Wow. Where do I begin. Wait there's no point order everything. So good.
Incredible food and service!! I don't care for the strip but will go there for this place!!

The worst French food I ever ate in Vegas... The cheese is atrocious... The bread of the croque Madame is like wonder bread.... As French man I would not recommend this place the experience real French bistro cuisine... Over all the ambiance was real nice and the personnel was friendly but the food was subpar... It feels like they try to cut cost on quality of ingredients... Talked to the manager and he said the cheese was imported from France lmfao...

I cannot stop thinking about the amazing gnocchi. Black mushrooms. Goat cheese. Garlic cream sauce. It was absolute perfection - so much that we went two nights in a row! 

When it came to dessert, I was wondering what kind of macaroon was worth $12 and boy did I discover it.  I never thought I would question my unwavering obsession with macaroons from Bouchon, but it happened. 

All in all,  perfect mellow date spot on the strip with plenty of options to share plates (or not share since it's that good).  

Recommend:  Gnocchi.  Mussels (perfect for sharing). Chocolate Macaroon.  French press coffee.

Great classic French Bistro. Food was simple yet delicious and the atmosphere was vibrant and young. Had a frisée salad and the steak frites au poivres; two of my favorite classic bistro dishes. They did not disappoint.

A really good place for brunch! First off the place was very nice, modernly decorated, the place was packed but I did not feel crowded. Our server was so nice and efficient! He made recommendations, explained the menu to us, cleared out our dirty plates, and the rest of the staff were also very helpful, our drinks were always re-filled and never had to ask for anything. 

Food is pricier than other places but I think it is worth it for the quality of the food, the presentation, the service and the experience. My friend and I stuffed our face with appetizers and entrees and left satisfied. The short rib benedict was so good, definitely must try! The base is a croissant instead of an english muffin, it was fluffy and buttery, so good! The rib melted in my mouth, the spinach was good, everything was good! The escargot bardot was on point! Strong flavor with puffy pastry on the outside, very good appetizer!

Bonjour Bardot.  Your food better be pretty darn good because I may need to finance this meal. And did you live up to expectation? Unfortunately for my wallet but fortunately for my belly, yes!  

Sharing is caring so I got to sample several appetizers and entrees.  For starters, we tried the charcuterie platter ($27).  It was good; nothing too special.  The escargots bardot ($17 for six) were a bit disappointing because I thought the pastry shell and chartreuse butter overpowered the texture and flavor of the escargots.  The foie gras parfait was one of our favorites!  It was very smooth and delicate.  The port gelee's sweetness helped balance its earthy flavor.

For entrees, I shared the herb crusted Alaskan cod and pork chop with my sister. Both were perfectly cooked and delicious. You can tell they brine their chops.  I also tried my cousin's sea bass and immediately understood why it's one of the signature dishes. D#@$% was that fish delicious.  Too bad we didn't offer to split our entrees with her too! Lol.

Oh, if you're a wine enthusiast, you will be happy to know that they offer an impressive collection.  But, it's not uncommon to see bottles of wine being sold in the four to five digit range.  I wonder if they run your credit card before you're allowed to order a $30K bottle?  Even though we enjoyed one of their bottles with "value," there weren't many options under $200 to choose from! :)

We first found out about Bardot Brasserie through Jeannie and a former college dorm mate of mine.  Jeannie had been snatched up from Aria's Five50 to run the Brasserie.  We went the first time on the second day the Brasserie was open.  The interior truly looks like a period Parisian brasserie, from the wood used inside to the wait staff's uniforms.  We started with the oysters on the half shell (to be honest we try to always start with oysters on the half shell), and then split the crown rack of lamb.  We paired each course with a different glass of wine - the by the glass menu is extensive, and reasonably priced.

We came back a few months later, and our second visit confirmed Bardot as our absolute favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  The wait staff was beautifully attentive without hovering.  The poured wine portions were generous.  The food was magnificent yet again.  Everything was timed to perfection. Right  as we completed our cocktails, the oysters were brought out to the table, and our empty glasses were replaced with a beautifully flinty chablis.  We had a nice amount of time to eat the oysters, and talk and engage our neighbors at the next table (their daughter was adorable).  Our main course arrived shortly after the oyster remains were whisked away, accompanied by another, different glass of wine.  Again, everything perfectly cooked and absolutely scrumptious.  Jeannie graced us with her presence, and I think we really gushed with how much we enjoyed her restaurant, and how impressively she runs her kitchen.

At the end of dinner, Jeannie sent out her signature dessert - an apple tart.  Oh. My. God.  It was completely fantastic.

We will continue to return on each visit to Vegas.  There really is no better place to eat on the strip.

Perfection.  From the service to the food to the spot on recommendations for the wine and food everything was fantastic. It was one of the most relaxing and enjoyable experiences we've had in Las Vegas.

great brunch! the food was flavorful, beautiful, and unique! we ordered the yogurt parfait with fruit and buckwheat beignets ( parfait was like an ice cream, fruit was fresh, and beignets were like a buckwheat doughnut hole), french omelet with truffles, and the chicken french dip sandwich with amazing mushroom stuffing. each dish was special. and to top it off, the service was excellent! best meal i've had in vegas.

Wow, you walk inside a brasserie in Paris. Our server was french too. The food was excellent. We took advantage of the fab happy hour menu combined with some apps from the dinner menu. The drinks were amazing too. An excellent experience all around.

I've been to Vegas about 100 times over the years.  This is hands down the best brunch I've had, not only in Vegas but in my life.

The service is top notch and the French Toast tastes like something out of this world.  And the burger, the rose, eggs Benedict.

You got to be kidding me!

Good for large groups. Service went smoothly and timely. The king crab crepe was delicious. A great way to start the meal. The mussels were nice and plump in a light broth. Wasn't too fond of the gnocchi but they weren't horrible. Something about the goat cheese didn't mix well with the dish. The echire butter was worth the try.

Great experience ! Decor was similar to buchon at the Venetian. Great service by John-Paul. Excellent suggestions. 

We got the hunters waffles. Poached egg w duck I believe. Delicate and delicious.  18-19 dollars. Good to share for two. 

We also got the duck confit sandwich. Bread was so soft and the sauce it comes with makes the sandwich even better. 18-19 dollars. 

The crab crepe was extremely good. Complex in tastes and texture. Egg, mushroom , slices of apples , crab, etc. 19 dollars 

I would definitely recommend this place for a nice brunch!

If you are coming here for a good steak
Avoid it at all costs.
The steak was super dry and crusty even though I asked for medium rare.
It was overly salted as well. We also ordered asparagus and it wasn't cooked through. 

Vic stewards and the Eiffel Tower have the best steaks for the same 65$ 
Eiffel towers steak is the best

Located in the Aria, this upscale restaurant has some really great food, a gorgeous ambiance, and really slow service. 

This is a pricy option for a late dinner in the Aria area without having to eat at the Aria cafe (slightly less slow) downstairs. However, despite the slow service we received on the Thursday night before EDC, the food and dranks really wow'd us. My fiance started the evening with a drink I've only been able to jot down as the "Blood and Sand Scotch drink". It was orangey and smooth and finished in a few minutes. 

The beef tartare was a delicious starter. The chips that came with it were super yummy and I was a bit sad we didn't ask for more chips. No matter. I had the pork chop for dinner which was smokey and thick and a lot of meat to put in my mouth. The horseradish mashed potatoes that came with my dish was buttery and creamy and soooo good. My fiance had the flat iron steak which also had a smokiness to it and was nice and tender. 

For a not very busy part of the night, it was difficult flagging down a server for water and drank refills, so I think the wait staff could put in a little more effort in being attentive. However, the servers (especially the one who recommended dranks) were very friendly when they were able to stop by. Definitely on the pricy side, so I'm not sure when I'll come back. Maybe when I win the jackpot on the Willy Wonka slot machine.
Perfect. Jesus (our server)  and Kelly (The Sommelier) were fantastic! Food Quality was spot on, service was seamless, cannot say enough good things.

Four stars from my husband. Dined here with the Lip Smacking Food Tour. Sampled foods that were both familiar and unfamiliar. Food presented well, portions were large. Husband would like to come back for more tastings.

We ordered duck confit, escargot, onion soup, pork chop and steak. The food was good but to me a bit over seasoned and salty overall.  But the service was great.  I was eating pork chop which was slightly over cooked and the server brought a new one even before I tell them so! What a detailed oriented service.

Finally!  A celebrity chef restaurant that was impressive!

I'll get right to it...we ordered the cheese plate and octopus to start...we let the server pick out the three different types of cheese and were very happy with her selection. The octopus was tender as was applied by chorizo and beans...super yummy!  For our entrees we ordered the Branzino and the scallops.  I'm not sure I could pick a favorite because they were both delicious.  For our sides we ordered the mushrooms (yummy!!!') and the Brussels sprouts.  I was not too impressed with the sprouts because they had a lot of vinegar by the mushrooms...craveable.

I will be i Vegas again in a week and even though it's pricey (but so are all of the good Vegas restaurants) I will probably be going back for those scallops and mushrooms!

Beautiful decor. Outstanding escargot and charcuterie.  The food here is incredible.  This is a must go to for brunch.  Wait staff is exceptionally well trained and professional.  David our waiter was extremely well versed in wine and gave me quite an education on the fine points of burgundy.  Some free tastings to guide me through the region were a big help.
David, thank you, we will be back because of your tremendous service and passion for what you do.
Greg A
Coventryville, PA

We come here for brunch every time we're in Vegas and it never disappoints! Bottomless sparkling rose and absolutely delicious food will keep us coming back. Make sure to get the smoke salmon plate - one of the best!

Wow! One of the best meals and experience I have had in Vegas. First, I loved the decor inside and the staff was awesome.

Next, the cocktails we got were tremendous... Seems some bars around Vegas have a hard time making good whiskey drinks. They are perfect here.

Our Escargot was good, not the best I have had but still good. The Pork Chop I got was delicious and cooked to perfection. Even the salad my wife got was above and beyond.

I ended the meal with just a simple French press coffee which was much better than I expected.

I will come back!

This is as FRENCH as it gets! The service, the food, simply amazing. The duck and froie gra appetizers were elegant. The pork chop was cooked to perfection. If anyone tells you that pink is not right in pork. Then you are WRONG! Slight pink is perfect on a pork ! it was tender and juicy. The fish was amazing. I would recommend this little spot on a date night. No date..That's fine too! Small groups will enjoy it as much!

This place will not disappoint.  Many chef inspired dishes, and appetizers on the menu.

I had the grass fed Neu York strip.  It was cooked to perfection.  I choose the peppercorn sauce, and it was a nice addition, but not needed.

I went with the Mac and Cheese, that is a large portion, but really could be eaten by a single person.  I have no idea how they get every macaroni to stand on edge!  It's a neat presentation, and tastes fantastic.

Insider tip: sub the potato purée for the fries.  The fries are good, but you can get good fries anywhere.

We had brunch here last Sunday. The ambiance is lovely and the servers are very nice. Unfortunately, the food was disappointing in a few instances. I ordered an Irish coffee which arrived cold. They took it back and heated it and it took way too long, and arrived barely luke warm. Hubby ordered the Huntsman Waffle with the duck confit and poached eggs, asked for the eggs poached hard, they came extremely soft so he sent them back. The rest of our group went ahead and ate, and it took a long time for my husband's meal to come out. No apology, no concession on the bill. Service was pretty slow also. However, the Nutella sticky bun is awesome, as was the smoked salmon starter.

The restaurant has a nice feel of a modern European cafe environment. Everything was gustatory. 
Must order..
Prime Steak Tartare, charcuterie board, food grass parfait, escargots Bardot, bone marrow pouvre, Parisian gnocchi, loud de mar Au fenouil, and lastly chocolate cake.

It is not often I dish out five star reviews, but in this case it was so easy! My mind was blown with every little detail of this restaurant. My fiancé's mother made a reservation on OpenTable the night before so we could get in for brunch as soon they opened. It was the Saturday morning before Mother's Day so even before the doors opened it got busy & crowded so we were very grateful we had a reservation. They took us right away because they saw us waiting there the longest. Respectful! We were led through the beautiful restaurant to a back table right near the kitchen. The place was absolutely beautiful decorated with fresh, blooming flowers and Parisian inspired decor. It brings you right to France . Las Vegas dining has always been my favorite because of how in depth the theming and decorating always creates such an atmosphere that is transcending and gives you not just a meal, but an experience. We haven't even talked Food yet! The brunch menu was to die for. I could've ordered anything and I would've been delicious. We decided to order a large French press for the table. It took a little while but it was so delicious. They also gave you two baguettes per table with delicious hand made, whipped butter to accompany. 
My fiancé & I split the "American in Paris" breakfast, how appropriate! My fiancé's mother got the egg white & kale quiche which was delicious. We also ordered the assorted pastry basket as an appetizer with our coffee to nibble on. Everything was fresh, delicious, and served with such presentation. The service was wonderful, the manager occasionally checked in on us to make sure we were doing well. There was an accordion player making his way through the tables telling jokes and playing Parisian music. Overall, this experience is not one to be missed!
The happy hour was amazing and the atmosphere is so impressive! The bartender did a great job with the drinks. Decided to try things that I had never had before and was very impressed.
Happy hour here was fabulous, as was the bartender's special.

Great experience having brunch here! The ambiance is impeccable, with classy decor, some dude playing accordion, and very attentive waiting staff with French accents. 

Food itself was great too. We ordered a pastry basket just to realize they actually also give out free fresh baked baguettes, but the croissants and danishes were so tasty we don't regret having double the amount of carbs than we intended. 

For the starter I had a French onion soup, which was somehow both sweeter and saltier than I would have liked. Considering I also find most onion soups in Paris salty perhaps this is just the way it's supposed to be?

For the entree I ordered mussels and frites, which comes with a large bowl of mussels and fries with mayo (and some ketch up... guess you didn't stick to your guns to being European).

One thing to note that perhaps also speaks to their authenticity - the portions are also pretty small. My bowl of mussels was sizable, but the hunter's waffle my friend ordered was tiny (more like two 1/4 waffles with some toppings).

What a perfect place to start a Vegas weekend. Great atmosphere, superb service, top notch drinks and really good food - and the prices were good considering the excellent food. Definitely recommended to anyone staying in or around the ARIA.
Amazing atmosphere at bar and in the dining room! Great menu selection and the cocktails were extraordinary. Definitely recommend this restaurant for Aria!
