Our bartender was friendly and the food came in good time frame.  We left full and little tipsy before 7pm and the bar was pretty full with the restaurant starting to get busy on this Saturday night.

Based on the Happy Hour, I definitely want to come down and give the regular menu a try.

February is a big month for us. We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday, our anniversary plus wedding, and valentine's day. On our very first date, my husband took me to a French restaurant. We re-created that first date by coming here. We had reservations for 630 and was seated promptly in a nice booth that was actually for a party of four. I really liked this extra touch. Our waitress Kim was really good and personable. She checked in with us multiple times but not excessively. 

Came with a complimentary bread and butter. 

10 OZ FLAT IRON, STRAUSS GRASS-FED - you get to pick your sauce. The steak was cooked to perfection and the fries that came with it was amazing! 

PARISIAN GNOCCHI - I got this and was very pleased. I got a gnocchi dish on our first date too. This is way better. It was very pleasing to the eyes and the gnocchi was the best we've had. Doesn't look like a lot of food but you will be full. 

BRUSSELS SPROUTS - sides. A good amount that can be shared up to three people. 

We also got a wine and a cocktail (STRAWBERRY BLANC). The strawberry blanc was really good and refreshing. 

Overall, it was a great experience EXCEPT how there is some lady who takes photos of you and tries to get you to spend $70 bucks on three printed photos. I understand we are in Vegas and in the Aria but this is a nice place. I don't want to be coerced into buying photos like I am in an amusement park. Hence 4 stars instead of 5.

I had my birthday dinner here this past Friday! The service first off was great, our server was friendly and helpful with explaining. We ordered the beef tartare, duck wings, onion soup and oysters as starters. They gave us fresh bread and butter, that was even delicious! The onion soup is AMAZING! We added short ribs and a poached egg in the soup and it is seriously a game changer. I've never enjoyed a soup so much, its definitely something you can share as well.

My gf and I ordered the rack of lambs and shared it, when they brought it out the actually split the dish into two plates and it was more than enough! That mac and cheese is sooooooo good, definitely split it with some folks at the table because its rich.
I am so glad we came here and we left super full. Warning since the food is french it is a bit on the heavier side, but super tasty! I would definitely come back just for that onion soup. YUM!

Amazing food!  Amazing service.  Staff was very knowledgable.  I tried so much food.  It was by far one one of the best restaurants in town.  This was a great addition to Aria.    For only being open a couple days it seemed as the staff had been there for years.  Great job!

Tucked away on the promenade of the Aria, Bardot is a great restaurant from Michael Mina that gives you a semi-formal dining experience with a space that gives that vintage vibe.  Square bar up front has both bar seating and some tables for those looking for a drink and something quick.

We had amazing service from Matthew and really enjoyed the recommendations.  We started with a loaf of bread with amazing butter from Normandy (beurre d'échiré A.O.C.) and the shrimp cocktail (U10s) that were nicely seasoned.  This was followed up with the Parisian Gnocchi (tete de moine cheese, morel mushrooms, black truffle shavings and roasted garlic velouté) and the King Crab Crêpe (buckwheat flour crepe, open faced with trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg and a brittany cider beurre blanc).  

We did get a couple of toasted marshmallows to finish off the meal.  Perfect way to end this trip to Vegas and head back home.

I was sad to see Michael Mina's American Fish close, but was more than assuaged after eating at Bardot. 

The restaurant is beautiful--completely redone to go with the French brasserie theme with plenty of painted wood paneling, brass, Mercury glass, and detailing. All those hard surfaces result in a super noisy restaurant, but it's pretty to look at!

Bardot is open for brunch 10:00-2:00 on the weekends only, and dinner every day at 5:00. They offer happy hour with food and drink specials each night til 7:00 in the bar. 

Loved the smoke and mirrors cocktail, with the sweet balanced out by the smoke. 

My favorite thing, which was ordered as an afterthought, was the beet salad. A beautiful presentation, and it's even tastier than it looks. Lightly grilled goat cheese, hazelnut oil...mmmm. 

Pretty restaurant, pretty food, pretty people...must be Vegas!

Was here in Mid July with my cousin on vacation, late night and we decided to stop for a bite.  After wandering down the menu, we decided on the steak and frites.  I wanted the au poivre sauce.  They were nice enough to spit the entree between us.  She also ordered the French onion soup.  Oh my WORD is all I can say about the food - Sacre Bleu!!!!  When I say délicieux- I mean DEE-LISH-SHUS!  wow, oh, WOW!!!!  The soup was spot on.  Absolutely mouth watering and exactly what you'd want from French onion soup.  Not too salty, the croutons were perfect and the cheese was just the right texture.  The steak - oh, heavens..... cooked to make you want it as a blanket so you can tuck yourself into it with the frites as little pillows you can munch on in your happy dreams.  (too much? maybe but it was just that good).  The atmosphere was very nice as well, medium lighting so you could be there with platonic friends or on a romantic date and they have great staff who are very helpful.  We had a great time, I would absolutely go back when I am in Vegas again.

We only sat at the bar twice but oh my, the shrimp cocktail!!! This is no ordinary shrimp-would love to know where they source it.  Succulent.  Gorgeous.  Delicious.  Sealed, slow cooked in a water bath - did I say huge & succulent??? Best we've ever had in our lives, served in ice with a beautiful remoulade sauce and a fab cocktail sauce.  Drinks were great, service perfect, atmosphere beautiful, and beer salad awesome.  The goat cheese, wowza.

The food was good but the service was bad. We had an 11:15 reservation and were told we could have a table that was actually someone's "regular" (standing) table if we thought we'd be done by noon... if not we'd have to wait 20 minute. Since one of us had a plane to catch we took the table and said we'd be done in time, and please let the server know so my friend could make her plane. We sat at 11:15 and didn't even get a menu till 11:30, nor did anyone offer any coffee or other beverage. Finally were served at 11:45 and had to rush to eat as well as flag down wait staff to bring coffee- they also never once came by to ask if we needed anything. For the price, the service was poor and this is a recurring theme at Aria. Eternal waits for breakfast, for drinks at the pool. I assume they're understaffed, but for what is supposed to be one of the better hotels they have a long way to go.

Had brunch this past weekend. They know what they are doing. We loved their cocktails (order the lemon drop), good bloody mary and a friend enjoyed the bottomless brunch rose. Love the baguettes and butter they start the meal with, I had Maine Lobster Benedict which was delicious. Husband had and loved the traditional burger, friend ordered a big bowl of delicious mussels and French Onion soup and truffle fries. All of it was amazing. Would definitely go again.

We had Valentine's Day dinner, at the bar. The atmosphere transforms you to a small bistro in France. The staff was very, very busy, but was still very attentive to guests at their tables and the bar. 

I started with the French Onion Soup. It was some of the best I have ever had! It was in a large crock with lots of melted cheese on top. They serve warm baguette in paper bags with soft butter. Yummy! My husband started with the late and he said it too was very good. 

The entrees were let downs for both of us. I had the sea bass. It was slightly over cooked and left it dry. He ordered the lamb frites and was disappointed when the plate only had 4 thick fries. When he asked how long it would take to order a side of fries he was told 15-20 minutes. He passed. He did say that the lamb was prepared well. When the manager saw the bartender remove my plate he immediately came over and asked why I didn't finish it. His concern was greatly appreciated. Although it wasn't necessary he did send us desert on him. 

Overall I give them a little slack since it was Valentine's Day and they were completely booked. The staff clearly was busting their butts to make it a memorable evening for everyone. Thank you! Bee would try them again.

This has become my "go to" spot in Vegas. I usually stay at Aria or Vdara, which makes this restaurant really convenient, and really delicious. I've tried a lot of their menu items, and whats below is only what I can remember. They're also really easy to get a table last minute, which is great when you suck at planning, but still want a good meal. 

The Excellent: 
The wait staff is really friendly and accomodating. I always ask for ice in my water, which they don't do by default, but none the less they make sure to keep my glass full of ice. One of their staff members even turned me onto a place names San Sebastian in spain, and I visited there based purely on his recommendation, and I've been back twice since! Can't think him enough for that. Unfortunately I only saw him once, and when I asked for him on a return visit, they said he didn't work there any more. 
No Dress code - I hate dress codes. 
Beef Tartar - Oh man this is good stuff. Flavored well, and really delicious. They serve it with potato chips which is perfect. 
Bone Marrow - oh man. I've had very few things in life that were this delicious. 
Onion Soup - Get this. Seriously. You don't have a choice. I often get this as my entree, with the added beef, truffles, and egg on top. 
Foie Gras Parfait - delicious stuff. Really rich though, so a little is enough. 
Lamb Shanks - Oh man these unbelievably good. Perfectly cooked. 
Crab Legs - They're good, and normally they'd be in the "good" column, but they peel the legs back for you, so they're super easy to eat, which puts them in the excellent column in my book. 
Oysters - Delicious and fresh every time. 
Scallops - Unbelievably tender, and flavorful. Amazing. 
Beet Salad - Nice and refreshing salad, since everything else here is pretty heavy and bold. 
The orange friend chicken - Delicious, and the butter sauce they serve with it is amazing. 

The good: 
The Mac and cheese - I usually order it, and I'm usually a little bit disapointed because EVERYTHING else is so good.. but this mac and cheese, while still good, is not as excellent as it could be. It's a little dry, and needs more cheese sauce. Surprisingly, it might be better reheated the next day. 
Gnocchi - It was good, but not great. Kind of "rubbery", and needed more sauce. 
Truffle Fries - They're really good, but I don't really get much "truffle" flavor from them. 
Creme Brulet - Good, but not anything I haven't had anywhere else. 
Snails - I found a picture of these on my phone, but I don't remember them, so they must not have been too spectacular, but I don't remember them being bad either. 



The Bad: 
The only bad thing I'd have to say about them is that I tried to get a last minute reservation for 20, and they were only able to accomodate us with a limited menu. hard to blame them, but I hate limited menus... Maybe it's not fair to put this in the "bad" column, but I have to have something :)

Like most American restaurants claiming to be French this or that, you basically just hope the bread is good.  The bread was good, as was everything else.

Started with the cheese plate, all three selections recommend by the waitress were unique, complex and delicious.  We ordered cocktails, which were fresh and strong.  The black truffle fries could use a little more black truffle than the light dusting they get, but it's a good amount for a side order.

For entrees we shared the pork chop and the gnocchi.  While the pork chop, vegetables and mashed potatoes were cooked perfectly, the mustard topping sauce was a bit boring but good.  The gnocchi was the best I've had; the black trumpet mushrooms give the dish a smokey, meaty flavor.

For dessert we had the strawberry pavlova, which was a perfect light finish.  The lavender gelato and strawberries provide plenty of flavor without being too overwhelming.  (Note that the meringue in a pavlova is crispy.)

I put a lot of time into looking for a place to have a good meal on my most recent trip to Las Vegas, and Bardot did not disappoint. So many other places I looked into were overpriced and didn't seem worth it. This is not the case at Bardot. Although it is pricey, you get what you pay for. The food was fantastic (I had the Parisian gnocchi au pistou, blistered green beans, macaroni gratinee, and pavlova) and the service was excellent. The restaurant itself is beautiful. I also appreciated that there was good lighting. Restaurants are often too dark and I want to be able to see the beautiful food in front of me! Bardot is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a good meal in Las Vegas.

Great burger. Happy hour snacks were cheap and delicious. The bone marrow for five dollars was excellent. A few drink specials during happy hour.  The restaurant was pretty empty however they had only been open 10 days.  The service was very good and actually better than expected considering they had just opened.

Fun restaurant but the food was okay. seating was too jam packed and for the price I expect to be wowed but as a local I have high expectations. It's a solid 3 Star. 

I had the beet and goat cheese salad to start which was very good but nothing I haven't had before. The sea bass as my main course. I was pretty disappointed it was oily and bland. I wanted to order the cod but they were out.
And for dessert I had the espresso Creme brulee which was excellent. 
My husband had the lobster bisque which was good and then a steak which was not special in anyway and also shared the dessert with me. 

The drinks were probably my favorite part i got the "and God made woman" but since i went for the food and was not wowed i give it a solid 3 Star. Probably won't be back.

Kind of hard to find but once you do you will not regret this amazing French location. Service is amazing, food is exquisite, the decor is divine, the photographer Britney was friendly. The service was consistent and efficient, they made my anniversary very special. The prices for the food is worth it because not only do they have big plates but it follows with big portions. The bread and butter is life changing and overall a great place for good old fashion French cuisine!

King crab crepe was generally good but the black stuff in the crepe wasn't properly cleaned so all I tasted was dirt. Service was lacking - It took about 20 minutes before someone popped up to ask if I needed any water.

This place got class, sass, and plenty of ass walking around. I absolutely loved this place. If I could live in the back booth I would. Upon entering you feel transported to France. Everything is beautiful. I found myself staring too much and people thought I was a creeper but I didn't care.

Everything is amazing here. Tenor steak tartare is a must. I repeat must!!!!! So buttery, flavorful, and orgasmic! Their escargot is also bomb.com. Not rubber at all or chewy. Their iced frappe is stellar beyond stellar.  Their beet salad was heaven. Absolute heaven. I could have eaten 12 plates. And their steak is sublime. I wanted to lick the plate.

My highlight was my beautiful chocolate macaroon. My giant macaron. Which was all for me and I didn't want to share. I like my macaroons the way I like my men. Dark, rich, velvety, and black. Lord have mercy. 

You must come here and enjoy your life and make sure you do the bottomless rose too. Xoxo.

The best Mac and cheese I've had EVER!!! And the steak was good too. But the Mac and cheese is the reason I'll be going back for. The service can be quite slow. They really REALLY take their time with the food. Waited almost an hour just to get the appetizers and they forgot about our Mac and cheese! So we got the Mac and cheese when we were almost done with our meal but once I had a bite of that Mac, mmmmmm mmmmmm Mmmmm Mmmm mmmmm~ we forgot all about the wait. It was that good!!!!! Go try the Mac and cheese. Delicious!! 
We also had the oysters, foie gras parfait, French onion soup, and my friends had the chicken, the gnocchi and filet mignon and they were all delicious.

The Chef's Tasting Menu is only bested by the fabulous service at this beautiful brasserie. Even with a full house, service was attentive, non-intrusive and polished. The location is another wonderful benefit. BARDOT is centrally located but not hammered with noisy and/or annoying foot traffic. The setting is right out of a romantic movie set in the City of Lights.

The Mina Group is well known for hiring the well and solid, ongoing training. This is evidenced by a staff that actually look and feel like they enjoy what they do. The management are what you can expect from such a strong brand(s) - excellent, personable and superb at anticipating needs and wants.

Each dish, as with the hand-crafted cocktails, was thoughtful, sensational and flavorful. BARDOT ranks among my favorite places in Las Vegas. Your expectations will be exceeded and you will have a fun time to boot!

Absolutely amazing. I think this meal was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. I had the French toast of course and it was out of this world. I told my boyfriend I didn't think I had ever been so happy in my life. They have a great selection of French and American breakfast lunch and dinner options. All kinds of coffee and champagne or cocktails. The ambiance is perfect, I thought about moving in. It's such a cute place and everyone is super nice and friendly. My boyfriend had the quiche which was rich but excellent. Will definitely come back whenever in Vegas!

My husband and I wanted to have a light healthy meal and we were really happy with the choices at Bardot Brasserie. He had the Salmon over Lentils. We also ordered chickpea fries and beet salad.

The funny thing was when we sat down our waiter greeted us with a "French" accent...my husband is English but also speaks French and turned to me and said that he doesn't really speak French...:)

We ordered a glass of wine and were really shocked at how small a pour it was..it was below the mid-line of glass and my husband mentioned it to the waiter when he went by him.

The waiter did come back to our table and filled up his wine glass, so we really appreciated the gesture..One thing to point out is that he LOST his French accent and became an American...

The food was great.

A charming place!  From the moment you walk up to it, the facade with the cafe tables outside instantly create a lovely environment.  My husband and I sat at the bar and had great conversation with the bartender Joe.

We originally went just for some cocktails and to scope out the place:
- And God Created Woman - a subtle drink with a very fancy "B" embedded into the foam.  Almost too pretty to drink.  This one was pretty, but not very much flavor to it.
- Le Detroit - again, they make these drinks look like art!  This one has flowers and an ice sphere that almost looks like it glows thanks to the green chartreuse.  The chartreuse is pretty strong on the palate, so if you don't like that liquor, I'd skip this one.
- Notre Dame - by far my favorite.  It had a little bit of everything I like: gin, citrus flavor, and champagne.  It was like a kicked up French 75.
- Man About Town - similar to a Negroni, but not as much spice.

Well, once the liquor started settling in, we got hungry, naturally:
- Charcuterie - this dish is $25 and you do not get a lot of meat.  My husband is obsessed with charcuterie, so we've had it at many a restaurant, and the price is comparable to other restaurants, but the amount of meat is not.  It was delicious pate, prosciutto, salumi, and rillette...but a very small amount.
- French Onion Soup - Oh man, this comes out covered in bubbly cheese and is a bit salty, but in a good way.
- Mac and Cheese Gratinee - it's like a sculpted square of mac and cheese in this yummy, delicate sauce.  I liked it.
- Chocolate Macaron - if you like chocolate, this will be your jam.
- Strawberry Coupe Glacee - it was basically strawberry ice cream with crunchy, melt in your mouth meringue bits.  Pretty tasty.

What was really cool, though, was that Michael Mina himself came out to talk to some people at the bar and asked us how the food and drinks were.  Very cool getting to meet the man in charge of a restaurant empire!

I would definitely come again.  The bar was delightful, but the restaurant itself would make for a fabulous birthday/anniversary/special event dinner.

If you are on the fence about visiting here you shouldn't be:) ..it's the Best!
One of my favorite restaurants in town! We were greeted with a warm and joyful reception, and taken care of by an amazing server, Kim, who was knowledgeable, fun and very attentive! It was very nice when Mattaij stopped by the table to make sure we were enjoying our selves. The macaroni & mimolette gratinée aka Mac & chz is a must! Beyond the delicious menu, the super talented chef serves amazing specials leaving guests with an immaculate and memorable dining experience.

Awful don't waist your hard earned dollars on rude bad service!  And then they won't admit it snd give you something else to eat.  Left Hungry. Ugh over rated!!  Read other reviews they are not goodies I'm French and it's more show than substance!! If you think this is a 5 you don't know much about food !!!!

This was one of the best dining experiences EVER! The food was fantastic, portions grande, service excellent but not stuffy...made for an intimate, romantic evening. As devout epicureans, we didn't know what to expect from fine French dining in Vegas, but the menu was too inviting to skip. Sooooo glad we chose to spend our anniversary here! The bartender was a master at his craft snd made spot-on food recommendations. Jesus from Chile not only took good care of us, but helped make our evening one we will not forget.

Need I say more - 5 stars - well deserved. The service: impeccable. The food - dear lord, I may invent a new word: mouthgasmic. 
I was lucky enough to be here during Restaurant Week and there was no disappointment with the tasting menu. 
I am in Las Vegas for work and ate alone, trying the fixed menu of the Bardot Salad, Pork chop and chocolate macaron. My mouth is in heaven. 
Perfection. Every. Last. Bite. 
I will be back Bardot. I hope you are here.

This is our favorite French restaurant in Las Vegas. Starting the meal with a glass of their excellent rose is a must. Nice  selection of cheeses: Valencay Affine OMG! Love Bardo's roasted beets and goat cheese salad and onion soup. You cans add truffle, braised oxtail and poached egg to your soup for a very special treat. My husband is a big fan of Bardo's steaks and lamb rack frites. Great atmosphere and service even during holidays when Las Vegas strip restaurants a lot of times are overrun and can't deliver.

I really wanted to like this place since it is a Michael Mina restaurant. However I was pretty disappointed. The only thing good about this place was the Foie Gras Parfait. The Cod and the Gnocchi were disappointing. Foie Gras was so good I would go back just to eat that. I had $100 Aria resort credit that I needed to use and got to use it for this place. I would check your bill if you are charging to your room. My credit didn't apply to this restaurant for some reason. I had to call Aria to get it adjusted.

I think next time I would try the steak and fries. Those looked amazing as it was being brought to other tables. The service was also extremely slow at the bar area. Waited 50 minutes for our main entrees to arrive. That's ridiculous. The other tables that got there later got their food ahead so they probably forgot about us. No apologies either from the waitress.

I have visited Bardot for brunch and happy hour.  The charcuterie board and prime steak tartare are perfect for a happy hour snack, and Bardot features a fun cocktail menu.  I had the french toast for brunch with the bottomless rose and it was a great combo for the price.  I highly recommend Bardot for brunch and happy hour, and I plan to return soon to try a full dinner.

We went her for brunch on a Saturday.  It is a beautiful restaurant that really make you feel like you are in France.  Service was very good.  

We started with some mimosas which were top notch--just the right blend.  They brought out a little baguette with butter that was really good.

I was thinking about getting the eggs benedict--but was not sure about putting it on croissant--so instead I ordered the cheese omelet.  It was cooked well, but really light on the cheese and not that flavorful.

It came with a side of salad, which was kind of odd, but tasted good.  

I really did not like the hash browns.  It was kind of a fried block of potato--a little like a giant french fry.  I think some might like it that way, but not me or my friend.

My friend ordered something called the American plate with two eggs.  She ordered them over easy--but they were really likely cooked.

Fortunately, I ordered a side of bacon that was excellent--I would definitely order that again.

Nice restaurant in a great hotel!  The atmosphere is fun the service is great but I felt the menu was a little light.  Could have used a few more choices and more complex options for the price.  I would go back and give it another shot as I hear they change the menu quite a bit there.  Did not have the french flare I was looking for, but good quality food none the less.
Phenomenal service and phenomenal food. Worth the high price tag. Get the duck wings a l'orange and the halibut! Definitely recommend for a romantic evening.

When in Vegas, we foie gras. 

It's become a bit of a tradition for the boyfriend and I to seek out the buttery, savory delicacy when we're in town and last night was no exception. A Yelp search for foie gras turned up a newcomer since our last trip in Michael Mina's BARDOT. With overwhelmingly high marks we decided to reserve via Open Table.

An after-thought caused Brandon to follow up with a phone call to request a booth and mention that we were celebrating a special occasion (my birthday is in a week).

We arrived and were seated right away at a two-top table centrally located in the dining room, which was most certainly not the more private booth that we'd requested. If you like hearing every word from your neighboring diners this is the place for you! I mean, so loud at times that he had to lean over the table and ask me to repeat myself. If you're expecting a romantic bistro, this isn't it.

Wine drinkers, take heed. Their menu is exorbitantly priced. I generally drink Chardonnay, but their cheapest glass was $17. I opted to order the $38 half bottle of white Bordeaux, knowing I'd likely have two glasses over the course of our meal.

The seared foie gras appetizer over lentils and shallots was stunning. We both agreed that we could have polished off about five more, but at $29 we refrained. Melt-in-your-mouth delicious and a nice portion to share (between two!)

I'd wanted to try their French Onion soup, but ringing in at $17 (I believe), I just couldn't justify the addition. 

For our entree, Brandon and I decided to share the Surf and Turf combo of 14oz ribeye and king crab. $88 + $29 for the crab. Expecting a true "surf and turf" I was surprised when our respective plates came out, ribeye divided with crab meat topping each half. A $117 entree and you cut our steak in half and top each one with about 4 ounces of crab meat? Where I come from that's called a steak served Oscar style. Even in Vegas I wouldn't expect that to cost more than $100 and...You. Cut. My. $88. Steak. *sad face*

All said, the steak was seasoned well and cooked as requested and the crab was delicious though scant. The accompanying French fries weren't anything very special, however the garlic aioli served alongside was fantastic and elevated the side.

Service seemed slow but Jesus was pleasant and kept my wine glass filled throughout the meal.

I just expected more for what we ended up paying. And not a mention of our special occassion was made. *sigh* 

Bardot, I wanted you to romance me in a classic, swooning French kind-of way.

Instead I left feeling like a tourist who'd been pick pocketed while admiring the Eiffel Tower. 

That foie, though...*drool*

My daughter and I went to brunch today and were overwhelmed with the excellent service and excellent food!!!! Our server John Paul was outstanding!!!!! We will surely recommend this restaurant to all our friends!!!! Wonderful atmosphere and amazing food!!!!

LOVE this place!!! Went here for the second time...this time for my sister's bday.  I will admit, I am a food snob.  And this place did not disappoint.  We had a reservation at 7:15--(had a concert at 9).  We were immediately seated.  We ordered escargot, oysters, french onion soup, lamb, and 2 bottles of wine.  Everything was great.  The escargot was in a puff pastry--so yummy.  Oysters were fresh and delicious.  The french onion soup---I have come to find that not everyone can get it right.  This place however, did it very well.  Furthermore, their sommelier came to our table and talked with us for a while and then even gave suggestions and tastings of wine with some of our items!!!! It was sooo neat, and he clearly knew what he was doing, because each wine with the food enhanced everything.  Service was impeccable.  We were stuffed by the end, but not like sick stuffed, just the right amount.  I will be back for sure.

Menu has changed sooooooo much from when they first opened. If you were here when they first opened, then you will for sure be disappointed. Three stars because the  Escargot is still on point and for the fact that it is the only thing that has remained the same.

Simply fantastic! Service was wonderful from the moment we walked in. The atmosphere and decor was elegant and you forget that you're inside a huge resort. Then there is the FOOD! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu, and the menu cocktails were amazing. It's places like this inside Aria that make it the best resort in Vegas.

As someone with zero skill or luck when it comes to gambling, It's great knowing you don't have to roll the dice to find exquisite dining in Las Vegas. For no particular reason I hadn't been back to Vegas in nearly two years. While maybe not the newest, my wife and I had been hearing consistently great things about BARDOT Brasserie so we made a point of getting reservations for her B-day dinner.

Located within Aria, we went with a small group of friends and met up at the restaurant right around our reservation time. It took a few minutes before we got seated, but once inside the first thing one notices is how the place is dimly lit and full or tile, dark wood and brass. Deservingly a brasserie.

While on the pricier side, there are certainly pricier still in Vegas. As one would expect the menu is decidedly French. No need to try and reinvent the wheel here as the majority of menu options are relatively timeless.

While wine would definitely be on the table for dinner, we started things off with cocktails. Preferring alcohol-forward, I ordered the Smoke & Mirrors while my wife got the Snake In The Grass.  Both were excellent. Looking to try a little of everything we also ordered the charcuterie board, which came packed with pate, rillettes and other cured meats.

Main course had to be steak - 8oz Angus Filet Mignon, medium rare. A friend of ours ordered the same thing, medium. As with most fine dining experiences we had some time before the meals came out. Everything looked great and we dug right in. While the meat was what one would expect from a proper filet mignon, for a roughly $50 item, it didn't seem medium rare as we would have liked. 

About halfway through the meal we look over at our friend who'd ordered hers medium and noticed it was far pinker than our own. At that point we realized they had given us the wrong plates. I brought this up with the waiter next time they came by. While our friend who had ordered the medium learned then and there that she preferred medium rare, our server asked as flat out if we'd like another one. I actually felt bad, but yes, the medium wasn't doing the trick and we obliged. 

The new steak came out soon enough, and was indeed, perfectly medium rare. It cut like butter and melted in my mouth. I also then understood why this place gets such high marks to begin with. The food was great. And while they may have slipped up an expensive order, they also fixed it with poise and speed. That's how it's done.

Bardot has been a favorite of mine for many years now.  Ever since my first experience in 2015, I kept returning every time I visited Las Vegas.  It's located in the Aria Casino, upstairs by the Buffet and it is great for both Brunch and Dinner.  

My first experience was dinner and they have one of the best Beef Bourguignon I have ever had.  It is a bit salty, probably from all the reduction it goes through, but pair it with their bread which is served warm with soft creamy butter.  If you don't get the bread after you order, politely ask your waiter for warm bread and butter, trust me, you do not want to miss out on the bread and butter. 

I tried their brunch the other day and I was so impressed and I just wish I could eat here everyday to try everything on their menu....one day. haha.  

Dinner Recommendations: 
- ESCARGOTS BARDOT
- ONION SOUP GRATINÉE - if you decide to get the soup....MUST MUST MUST add périgord truffle, braised oxtail & soft poached egg.  Best "appetizer" dish but more like an entree with all the additions.  I get so full off of this so best to share with someone.  
- HERITAGE CHICKEN RÔTI - Very tender chicken and flavorful.  
- BLACK TRUFFLE FRENCH FRIES - Truffle and fries...do I need to say more? 
- MACARONI & MIMOLETTE GRATINÉE - More for the presentation, delicious but standard. 
- Beef Bourguignon - The best on their menu IMO.  As for extra bread when you order this! 

Dessert
- CHOCOLATE MACARON - Their signature dessert, super chocolaty for those chocoholics and definitely will satisfy your chocolate cravings.  Large so will need to share.  

Brunch
- NUTELLA STICKY BUN - Delicious, warm and comes in a metal pot.  Wish there was more nutella on top. 
- HUNTER'S WAFFLE - HOLY MOLY!  DELICIOUS!  Duck confit on top of a waffle topped with a poached egg and yummy sauce.  If you like duck, you will enjoy this dish.  
- CROISSANT BENEDICTS with MAINE LOBSTER - Fresh lobster, delicious, and a perfect combo to share with your friend who ordered the Hunter's Waffle.  
- TRUFFLE FRIES, GARLI AÏOLI 

Service: 5/5..  Great and attentive.  Knowledgable waiters with great recommendations.  Hostess sat us quickly. 

Ambience: 5/5 - Clean and 1800-1900 Parisian style interior.  

Parking: 3/5 - you have to pay for parking now at the Aria which sucks, but if you gamble and have the M Resort card, I think parking is complimentary.  Other than that, first hour is free, next hour is $7.  =(  

Michael Mina, I am impressed and I cannot wait to try your other restaurants cause I know I will be getting a quality meal with great service.

We came for brunch our first day in Vegas. The restaurant is tucked away inside the second story inside the Aria hotel and is beautiful inside. Lots of rose centerpieces, soft lighting and gorgeous bar with gold shelves holding their liquor including an impressive selection of chartreuse. We showed up for our 1:30p reservation 10 minutes late as we had a difficult time finding it and the hostess let us know the kitchen would close in 5 minutes so we had to order quickly. We were seated and right away I knew I wanted a Benedict. I tried the short rib Benedict served on croissants and a cappuccino. The cappuccino was wonderful, also came with a hefty $6 price tag. In the Benedict I loved the texture and flavor of the short rib, and would've liked a bit more hollandaise sauce and fresher croissants as they tasted a bit stale. The butter that accomplished the complimentary bread was to die for, the bread was nothing special. I'm glad I ate here though not a place I would return to with so many options in Vegas.

Inviting and tasty, Bardot brasserie was our most enjoyable meal on our recent trip to Las Vegas. We dined here on a Sunday night so the restaurant was about half empty, but from the moment we stepped up to the hostess stand the service was nothing but exceptional. My wife and I both ordered cocktails, my wife had the moulin rouge and I had the Le pêche mode. Both were fragrant and quite tasty. The food was generally good but I felt that some of the dishes were lacking that certain je ne sais quoi for me to give this restaurant 5 stars. For starters we decided on the escargot, king crab crêpe and the bone marrow. The bone marrow was rich and smoky, and the escargot was good, but not memorable. However, the king crab crêpe was exceptional. The crêpe was delicate and light and the filling was seasoned to perfection. For our entreé we shared the loup de mer which was quite delicious as well. Overall an enjoyable dining experience!

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful dinner last month at Bardot the day after Valentine's for our 5th Anniversary. Not only is the location beautiful, but the food is also not so bad, you can never go wrong at a French Brasserie!
Our reservation was at 8pm, we arrived early and noticed they had Happy Hour from 5-7pm so we sat in the bar and lounge area and enjoyed some small bites and a drink. We enjoyed the Oysters, Tuna TarTare, Steak TarTare, Skate Wing, Bone Marrow, and my favorite small dish was the Duck Wings A' L'Orange, yum!
The hostess was very sweet and took us to our table early and the table was absolutely gorgeous set up with rose pedals. This was such a perfect way to start an anniversary dinner. When this restaurant used to be American Fish we surprisingly had the same server as we did this time at Bardot. It was very nice to see that Michael Mina kept on some of the staff from the previous restaurant. Our server's name is Jamison, he was fantastic; this visit as well as the last visit. He was very kind and knowledgable he gave us a great list of suggestions for our meal:

French Onion Soup Gratinee--make sure to add the truffle, OXTAIL, and soft poached egg.
Salad Course: Frisee salad with bacon and poached egg.
Entrees: I had the Ora King Salmon with lentils and a smoked tomato vinaigrette.
My boyfriend had the Pork Chop that came with a horseradish potato, very strong on the horseradish..
Sides: Green Beans and Macaroni Gratinee (normally I would not order any macaroni dish out at dinner, but I'm glad we got it, because the presentation is so creative, each noodle sits straight up and came as a square block, really impressive. 
Dessert: There is ALWAYS room for dessert! My boyfriend's mother is french and one of his favorite past times is when his mom would prepare her famous Apple Tarte Tatin from scratch.....so of course we tried it. Very tasty and the individual serving size is a great way to present this dessert. Also, we ordered the Coupe Glacee {{fancy words}} which was ice cream and sorbets. Our night ended with a beautiful pink rose handed to me, they were a special take home for Valentine's weekend!

The only thing that really bothered us during our meal was that we were sitting at a booth closer to the kitchen and the chef kept tapping on his bell for the food runners to come back. It was fantastic that the kitchen staff was not loud and we couldn't hear any silverware or plates touching each other, but the bell was reallyyy annoying! How about tapping the bell once? Or perhaps just hiring one or two more runners so the guests do not have to hear the bell and see the chef laughing after hitting it 12 times in a row!
Other than that, great spot, love the remodeling, and ask for Jamison, you will be in good hands!

Bardot could exist nicely in Paris.  The interior is totally authentic and reminded me of the times I have spent in Paris. The food matches the ambiance and the service was impeccable.  We both had the salmon and it was superb. I don't know how they got the skin perfectly grilled but it was.  I started with the goat cheese beet salad and it also was very good with the baked goat cheese being outstanding. 

I used to eat in the same space when it was American Fish which was very beautiful and served great food.  It is amazing how in Las Vegas a place as nice as American Fish can be replaced with another outstanding restaurant.

Our party of 9 had dinner here for my cousin's bachelorette party. Overall the atmosphere was welcoming but it was really dark in the dining so that it was difficult to see our dishes.

Our table shared a variety of appetizers:

- Foie Gras Parfait
- Charcuterie Board (housemade pate, pork rillette, ham)
- Bardot Escargot -hazelnuts, chartreuse butter 

I expected a lot from the escargots because our server touted them to high heaven. But they were just ok. Charcuterie Board was solid--loved the rillette. But I was ALL ABOUT THE FOIE GRAS PARFAIT! So wonderfully smooth and somehow rich and light at the same time. The port gelee added the perfect acidity to it.

For entrees, seester and I split:

-Oak Smoked Duroc Pork Chop with Crispy Lardons
-Alaskan Cod with a Saffron Beurre Blanc

The pork was very juicy and the lardons were decadent. The horseradish was fantastic with it. The cod was light, flaky and I loved the corn. 

But beware....if you love wine--bring your $$$$$$  The cheapest bottle was around $150 and I kid you not, we saw a bottle that was listed for $38K---no joke!

Overall, I really enjoyed the dinner but it was VERY pricey especially if you order booze.

Top notch classy place in Aria.

I was here on a weekday for lunch with my husband, as work brought him to Vegas for the week. We had our 13 month old with us, and I instantly was nervous because walking in it was clear that the restaurant is posh and probably not keen on having babies in the dining room.

Luckily, it was pretty empty, and doubly lucky, my son was an angel and didn't throw any food! Our server was super professional and nice, and gave us lots of good recommendations on food and wine pairings. Hubby's coworker was dying to try escargot, and he said they were good, but he was disappointed that they weren't prepared classically. 

French onion soup- I LOVE me a good onion soup covered in that melty cheesy goodness. This soup was good, but not too memorable. 

Lobster bisque- Hubby ordered this, and he's not really a soup guy, or a rich thick food guy either, so I was surprised he ordered it. I thought it was good, it had a strong lobster flavor to it which was nice since usually you can't taste it.

World's best butter- the guy we were with ordered this, as he's never had French food before and wanted to go all out. You spread it on the bread, then sprinkle some sea salt on top. It was pretty tasty, I have to say, but their regular bread and butter was just fine to me too.

Chicken cordon bleu- Delicious! I've never had this dish before but I've always wanted to try it, and it was really yummy. Prepared perfectly, it had a nice crunch but the chicken inside was still juicy and moist. My baby loved it!

Steak frites- the two guys ordered this. The steak was great, prepared nicely, and their fries were delicious.

Overall, we had a very lovely, pleasant lunch here. Yes it's pricey, but the food was really good and I'd say worth the price. The restaurant space is gorgeous, and our service was top notch!

Great French food. Solid cocktails. Stay away from the smokey old fashioned it's ok and I LOVE old fashioneds of all kinds. Their happy hour is one of the best in vegas. Salmon tartare mmmmmm.  And their bartender know their drinks! Worth a visit and a great atmosphere!!!! Hard to find in the aria but worth the hunt!
Very good. Party of six. Classic French bistro food with a couple twists. Cheese, pastries are delicious. Escargots are very good. Entrees were good, but not amazing.

Came here for Mother's Day brunch. Would recommend this place, as it had a pretty extensive and unique French menu compared to some other places. 

AMBIENCE = Great! Beautiful brasserie.

SERVICE = Great, generally attentive.

FOOD REVIEW:

COMPLIMENTARY BAGUETTE & SALTED BUTTER
They give you a baguette loaf for 2 people. Salted butter is nicely whipped and creamy.

ESCARGOTS BARDOT: toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter, puff pastry shells
--- Pretty good; wish there was a bit more garlic butter flavor though... but it wasn't greasy at all.

HAND CUT TRUFFLE FRIES (no photo)
--- Could hardly taste the truffle... wasn't worth the price.

KING CRAB CRÊPE: buckwheat crêpe, black trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg, normandy cider beurre blanc
--- It was ok. I'm not sure I'm a fan of the taste, but my mom really enjoyed it. 

BARDOT STEAK & EGGS: prime rib eye, two fried eggs, hash browns, sauce verte 
--- I didn't try it but the steak seemed pretty good. Tried a bit of the hash brown and I didn't like it. Tasted like dry cardboard with some herbs.

HUNTER'S WAFFLE: glazed duck confit, poached eggs, sauce maltaise
--- I didn't get to try this, but looks decent.

FRENCH TOAST: brioche french toast, vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, orgeat syrup
--- Wow, epic french toast! Really well done! Even though the toast was really thick, it had a nice bread pudding consistency to it (i.e. not dry at all, not too bready) and when you take a bite with the mascarpone and almond syrup... WOW... Amazing combination! Strongly recommend it and highlight of the meal. 

DOUBLE-CUT BACON (no photo)
--- Didn't try this but brothers were impressed with it. Compared this to smokey brisket.

SMOKED SALMON CROISSANT BENEDICTS: two poached eggs, sautéed kale, béarnaise
--- Looked amazing, but smoked salmon was way too salty. Wish there was a bit more kale to offset the saltiness. But overall I enjoyed this and love that it's on a croissant pastry.

MILLE FEUILLE: caramelized puff pastry, vanilla crème patisserie
--- Mmmm... so good!!! The puff pastry was so crispy and flakey. Really delicious. Highly recommend it.

We were able to make same day reservation for party of 14. Great ambience, good service & the food was surprisingly good. We were actually celebrating a birthday & a bit disappointed that they don't give a free desserts for celebrants. Nice place to eat if celebrating a special occasion.

Meh.  I've experienced much better is a good way to describe the meal we had here.  We came here for brunch and with no reservation, we sat at the bar, which is fine.  That's what we do a lot of times anyway, but the only seats open were on a corner.  We grabbed them to make sure we had seats and then waited for about 10 minutes before anyone greeted us.  Mind you, the bartenders (yes, multiple bartenders) took care of the parties to our right and to our left, but did not acknowledged us until after they had taken care of both of those parties.  So finally, we got a couple of waters.  We weren't sure what we wanted yet so we took a few minutes to look at the menu - and moved down a few seats when a couple left.  Much more room which was nice!  A couple of bartenders asked us several different times if we wanted bar drinks, and when we kept saying no, they seemed to be irritated.  Maybe having a bad day?  Maybe upset that we were taking up bar seats but not ordering alcoholic drinks?  I'm not really sure.  We definitely drink but were just not in the mood.

I ended up ordering the French Omelette and my husband ordered the Bardot Breakfast Sandwich.  The dishes came out about 15 or so minutes later which wasn't bad.  They were not like any other French omelette or egg dishes either of us have ever had, though - the eggs were...well done.  Not like done well, I mean cooked well done.  Like very firm.  My omelette was so firm it held it's shape like a Japanese egg omelette would, and it also did not have any fine herbs or Gruyere in it that I could see, and had no seasoning at all.  I added salt & pepper which helped, but it still just tasted like plain egg.  My husband's egg sandwich had these little rectangles of the same, firmly cooked eggs, and they were almost like a styrofoam consistency.  I was expecting softer eggs, like almost runny.  That's how we've had any sort of French eggs before, and really any eggs for that matter.  We really should have sent it all back, but then what?  Have to deal with a crabby bartender and wait another 15 or so minutes for something else that might not be good either?  We just ate what we could, paid and left.  It wasn't inedible but it definitely wasn't worth the price and wasn't a good experience. It's a shame because I love French food, and the place had a great atmosphere.  Maybe the people in the place were just having an off day?  Who knows, but I'm in no hurry to return.

Came here Saturday 2/27 at 5:00 pm for a happy hour menu that doesn't exist anymore. Ordered drinks and Duck Wings À L'Orange. Returned 2/28 for brunch which was absolutely fabulous. We ordered La Boulangerie, Hunter's Waffle, Mussels & Frites, and finished with crème brûlée.  

The wait staff was quick and attentive, constantly refilling waters and coffees.

I would definitely return for brunch! 

Every meal is served with a fresh warm baguette and homemade butter which I could have eaten 3 loafs of. 

Duck Wings À L'Orange: sweet, sticky, and savory. Not something I'd order again. 

La Boulangerie: Croissant was a disappointment, but the other 3 breads were very yummy! 

Hunter's Waffle: Lot's of savory duck, perfect poached egg, rich maltaise sauce. The waffle could have been a lot crispier, and I think had it been I would have been in love with this dish had the waffle not been soggy.

Mussels & Frites: These were the largest mussels I have ever seen or eaten, and every single one was huge. The french fries were typical and served with ketchup and a truffle aioli. 

Crème Brûlée: Everything you could expect and want from a creme brulee, perfectly and traditionally prepared.

If this is how Royalty dines sign me up! It was the perfect self indulgence birthday dinner anyone could ever ask for. What else can I say that hasn't been said already???

Just fatten me up like a turkey and feed me bottomless duck wings à l'orange and foie gras parfait please! 

No but really, if you haven't tried their food definitely check this place out. Everything we tasted from their dinner menu was amazing! 
Will definitely be back to try their brunch menu.

We went for my birthday and were very disappointed. I can say this was mediocre at best. 
The ambience is very loud. We were seated at a table that I could not even hear my husband. We asked to move and were accommodated which we appreciated.
I agree with other postings that it is very expensive for the quality. I do not mind paying if the food and ambience are superior but this restaurant falls short. First, the price for a glass of wine was ridiculous - $20 a glass. Our server didn't even pour our wine until after our appetizer was served. My husband ordered the oysters and said he felt sorry eating the baby oysters. We had to ask where they were from because they were so small ($21 for 6 babies). I ordered the burrata salad with peaches - 4 very small slices of peaches, a small tasteless piece of burrata with some julienned vegetables that were non descriptive ($21).
My entre was the lobster bisque which was very good but my husband's steak ($67) was very salty and inconsistent (some parts good, some not edible). Yes, Las Vegas is expensive but spend your money somewhere else.
We wanted a great brunch location so we googled top rated restaurants, Bardot was the top and they did not disappoint. Delicious meal and cappuccino.

I loved this place! Came here last minute to have dinner and they had reservations available and seated us pretty quickly. Very friendly staff in the front. I liked her vibe. She was very nice. We got seated in a nice place. It's a bit dim. Very beautiful inside. I ordered the scallops and omg. Best scallops I've probably ever had in my life. Also ordered Brussels Sprouts as a side, mashed potatoes and something else I forgot. But everything was delicious. If you're not sure of which wine to get, they allow you to taste some before you order. I will definitely be back here when I'm in Vegas and staying at the Aria. Thank you!!!

I truly wish I could give half stars sometimes. This restaurant really did come in between a 3 and a 4 for me. I went here during a work conference trip with some coworkers when we were trying to escape yet another vendor dinner. The decor is absolutely beautiful and definitely makes you feel like you are in the Aria. It's very French classic. That part of it I will say, was a five star. 

For food, I started with the onion soup (as did all three of my coworkers) and it was phenomenal! It was the biggest bowl of onion soup I have ever had in my life and quite possibly the tastiest. There was a ton of bread, a ton of onions, and a ton of cheese - it was everything French onion soup should be. Quite honestly, you can eat this as your meal, it was that much food. Because I had this rich soup, I decided to do a lighter dinner and had the mussels. The mussels were definitely prepared well, they had no grit or sand and they were all steamed open - for me, the miss here was simply the flavor. I also tried my coworkers gnocchi which was heavenly but a very heavy dish as well. I mean for crying out loud this is French food so richness, I guess is something that should be expected.

The service was lackluster and our server was not knowledgeable which for a restaurant of this caliber was extremely disappointing and definitely tainted the experience.

All things considered, this was a very nice restaurant and I would certainly go back to have some french onion soup if nothing else.

Bardot Brasserie could be my new favorite restaurant in LV. Seriously.

First of all, the decor is beautiful. And the service was impeccable. Our waiter was very helpful in making selections and even knew how to mix in some humor as he checked in on us periodically. Perfect.

As for the food, we had the following:

Onion soup - gobs of Gruyere cheese and flavorful broth. yummy.

King crab crepe - one of my favorite things of the night. so simple yet sophisticated and delicious!

Seared foie gras lyonnaise - decadent. foie gras lovers' dream.

Bone Marrow - was hoping for a little more from this dish but pretty standard. still deelish.

Bone in Dry Aged ribeye - O.M.G. This steak sliced open like buttah. Meat was so tender and flavorful that I already knew that no steak in Hawaii could compare.

I can't wait to go back and try more!

We went for dinner after a show and had a nice meal. We took a dozen oysters which were well presented and tasty. The rack of lamb was just ok with dried polenta. The mussels were well seasoned. Overall service was efficient and courteous. There are better French places in Vegas to enjoy.

another great michael mina spot.

really amazing french menu, everything was spectacular! 

favorite dish: the mac and cheese!!! 

desserts are so so.
photographer came around and took photos of us, which was nice touch

This was my 2nd time to Bardot. My husband and I are locals and we rarely like to visit the strip except for special occasions. Just walking into Aria is fun and finding Bardot is like a hidden treasure. Show up early and sip a cocktail at the awesome bar! 

We got to sit at a booth and peek into the awesome kitchen. The server was adorable and she explained the menu and even answered my questions. We eat out often and are pretty adventurous and will try mostly anything. 

Let's start with warm french bread that is toasty on the exterior and soft on the inside with house butter.... house butter?  oh man that butter could be eaten buy the spoonful! I had to control myself. 

My highlights...
We had the Steak tartare - it was sooo good and fresh. 
Escargot - Beautifully presented wrapped in a fluffy pastry puff. 
Duck wings... one word...delicious. 

Roasted beet and goat cheese salad-  Whenever I see a beet salad on a menu, I have to order it, I love beet salad. This was perfectly dressed and the goat cheese was to die for. 

Ribeye Steak - Worth every frickin' penny. I always get worried that a chef is going to ruin a good steak that I pay good money for... but in this case it was a wast of time to worry... juicy, perfect and soooo much flavor!! Making my mouth water as I type this. The mashed potatoes were my favorite. I love mashed potatoes and I didn't realize how bad mine suck until I tried these. 

Mac & Cheese-My husband had the Mac and Cheese. Holy cow!! How do they do this? I really wanted to take a photo, but we made a deal to keep our phones off at dinner.  AND... It tased better than it looked and trust me it looks amazing!! I feel bad for the guy that has to prep that plate! Im sure you can find a photo of it somewhere. It probably has its own Instagram account. If not for any other reason... Go to Bardot and get your MAC& CHEESE on!!! FOR REAL

I was full... but hubby always wants dessert.
The Chocolate Macaron was .... Oh so macaron! Melt in your mouth worth every calorie, paired well with the hot and strong coffee. 

We have lots of amazing places to eat here in LV, and its always fun to try something new but I won't passing up the chance to 
return to Bardot. The server was telling us about brunch. We have family coming to town for the holidays and we are definitely doing the brunch next!!! We cant wait!

No disappointments here! Begin with warm baguette, then a classic selection of cheeses to start. The menu is a classic French brasserie with outstanding onion soup gratinee, a frisée salad with lardons was perfect and not overly dressed. My Parisian gnocchi with pea pistou is lightly pan fried and the loup de mer of sea bass was light and perfectly cooked. The macaroni and cheese is awesome and not to be missed. We passed on dessert but the selections were appealing and looked good. Nice classic and new cocktail selections and a wines are well thought out with the sommelier asking if he can assist. A surprise was the photographer, Brittney, who is so nice and did a great job of the photos we purchased. Great job Michael Mina.
Wonderful restaurant with fabulous food!  Everything was delicious!  Great service.

This is a relatively new restaurant in Aria. The setting is romantic and quiet. Service is excellent.

I ordered the warm beet and goat cheese salad, foie gras parfait and 1/2 dozen oysters. The foie gras with the port gelee is to die for, super creamy and tasty,

The oyster is pretty small and don't think it is any special.

The warm beet salad is excellent.

I highly recommend this place for brunch!!

Take. Me. Back.

I have little to no faith in Mina restaurants but this place blew me away. I come to Vegas enough to constantly struggling to try a new place vs visiting an old spot. Finally stayed away from grabbing brunch at Bouchon and ended up here. Located on the second floor, escalator near the taxi drop off. If you're coming from the casino floor, head over to the chocolate decor wall and you'll see the escalator.

The decor of this place is great. I feel like I'm in some 1950 building. Service was great, I forgot his name, but the server we had was very patient with us. He gave a good amount of suggestions, just that we didn't have the stomach to try everything. Ended up ordering the escargots bardot, short rib croissant benedict, and a bellini. Bellini was good, but I just felt like one that day, it's not a MUST HAVE. But the other two.... if you're able to take the disgusting thought of having to engulf a snail down your throat, order it. If you're not afraid of a heavy brunch dish, order that short rib croissant benedict. What this place has done right is the pastry. Both the bardot and the benedict had a good flakey crisp. If I didn't have to share the bardot, that would have been better. Unfortunately I came with 2 others and it was our first time, so sharing is caring. Blah blah blah. I was deciding between the short rib croissant benedict and the hunter's waffle (duck confit waffle, basically a more bougie version of chicken and waffles, I'm bougie so I considered it). I'm too much of a croissant fan so the benedict won me over. Not that it was a bad dish, it was just too heavy for my preference. I loved it, but I didn't want to be THAT full. Hunter's waffle would have left me in the same state. Flavors had been very rich, lots of juice coming from the short rib. Paired with the yolk, there goes the crispy and flakey croissant... 

But yes. Make me go back there, because I can't say no.

What a surprise find! 

They had a summer tasting menu for $65, and it is so worth it! The entree alone by itself would have been $49. 

The set menu comes with 4 courses, and all of them are on the regular priced menu. I chose the summer melon (cheese was the highlight!), scallops (tender, but also heard great things about the duck wings), seabass (maybe my least favorite, but still very good), and the strawberry pavlova for dessert. Portions were hearty, but lots of attention to delivery. 

We also separately ordered the foie gras parfait, the seared foie gras and the bone marrow to try. So decadent. All were delicious, but my favorite of the three would be the foie gras parfait, light and airy, a refreshing change to the usually dense foie gras pate. 

Overall, great experience, great food, great ambience, great price, strongly recommend.

I have been to Bardot a number of times.  Recently, 6 of us gathered here for dinner with Chef Josh Smith demonstrating once again why this is the best French food in Las Vegas and beyond.

Standouts were the Beef Wellington--a masterpiece of rare beef surrounded by mushroom duxelles and a flaky pasty, the endive and bleu cheese salad (refreshing and plated in a very pleasing fashion), the scallops, and the duck breast.  I have left out some of the other items but the whole meal was outstanding.  

Desserts are a must.  The espresso crème brûlée was so different and having the Baked Alaska once again is a show both for your eyes and your taste buds.

Service is always excellent.  Walking away having eaten too much but feeling very good, I was thinking about when next to return.

Kudos to Chef Smith and his staff!

Fantastic french brasserie ambiance! Our party of 8 just had dinner here for the first time and were generally pleased. Highlights were the cheese plate, beet salad, and seared foie gras. We ordered "the world's best butter" for fun ( it came pre-packaged with a side of sea salt)and while it was impressively rich and creamy, my bro advised farm fresh butter in rural Portugal is still the best he's had. Moule frites were solid, but I was too stuffed from the starters to thoroughly enjoy them. Everyone who ordered the lamb said it was phenomenal so I'll have to come back for it.

It's been a week and a half since I was at Bardot for my best friend's bachelorette (formal) dinner, and I'm still thinking about the amazing food and great service! 

We started off with a bottle of Perrier-Jouet, and ordered a beet salad and cheese plate for the table... a-mazing. The beets were super fresh, well dressed with great oil, and served along an amazing cheese. The cheese plate was to die for--our waiter made some expert selections, and I find myself googling where I can get them locally! 

Dinner was excellent. From the chicken my best friend had (not too moist, but not dry at all..almost sous vide perfection) to the beautiful and generous cut of prime rib I had. Each paired well with the selections from the Somm from the great wine list. Sides were hearty and delicious. 

I wish we would have had time (or stomach space) for dessert, as I'm sure it would have been amazing. 

Truly appreciated the excellent service we received at Bardot as well. I was in the service industry for a while, so I pay attention to the little things--the Sommelier's presentation was perfect, the waiter was an expert with the menu, and the pace of the meal was great. The waiter didn't even flinch when I asked (before the meal, away from the table) about splitting the check 4 ways--extremely accommodating and professional.

I can't say enough great things about this experience. I felt like I was truly in a starred restaurant. Excellent.

Bardot is a beautiful restaurant and feel really french. Tried the crab crepe, escargot, oignon soup and everything was good. I think my favorite was the oignon soup. For the entree, we all tried the rack of lamb and everybody loved jt. For dessert, baba au rhum and apple tart tartin. I did really like the apple tart tatin and was a little bit disappointed by the baba au rhum. The service was great. We actually got a french server named clementine who really took good care of us

This was an amazing dinner!! I loved everything about it. Service was great, the restaurant is beautiful, the drinks were yummy, and my food just exquisite. 
The recommended drink with the signature "B" is called "And God created woman" it's gin based and has a flowery delicate taste. It was a well made drink, all of the components blended so well...I was in love! It's a good time to tell you I am not a gin drinker but even I recommend it.
Next was our meals. I don't have a single bad thing to say. Everything was just so damn good. Our warm asparagus salad was a perfect starter. It was so simple but tasted like it was a complicated dish. Asparagus, prosciutto, egg, hollandaise, and black truffle. Delicious. 
Next was my pork chop. It was melt-in-my-mouth delicious and it was Huge! It was so smokey and so tender. Yum yum! The mustard sauce on the side was a perfect companion to it too . Not overly mustardy. I'm not a big fan of mustard usually but I liked it! 
I'd say this dinner was a great one. Loved everything about and I would recommend having dinner here.., check it out!

If I could give a rating of zero I would. I had the lobster bisque and got food poisoning. A $100 diner  turned into a $275 doctor visit & $300 flight change and hotel room extension. After 24hrs I'm still not well and experiencing excruciating pains in my stomach, bowel movements, and threw up so violently that blood was coming up. I'd never recommend anyone to go eat here.

Amazing event the room is great and the food was stellar. I am looking forward to joining Mina's team for full dinner service soon. I can say that Bardot is going to be one of these great restaurants that many locals will drive down to the strip for. 

Great job on the remodel and congrats to the Mina team.

Given the option of a buffet or Bardot, always go with Bardot!  Always!  This was absolutely one of the better choices made on a recent trip to Vegas, unlike the one where I kept forgetting to collect my winnings and walk away from the table.  Hate when that happens.  

The service for brunch was so comforting, especially when you are recovering from a late night.  We were so hungry and started to order more than we should, so our oh so polite and professional server made a recommendation on how to serve our meal that worked out perfectly.  We started with the king crab crepe.  The crepe was so light and tasty.  I secretly wished I didn't have to share that one because I could have finished it in a minute.  My hunny ordered the filet mignon and eggs and I had the smoked salmon croissant benedict, which I absolutely loved being served on a croissant rather than a english muffin.  The texture and taste was good, though it was a bit salty which I just figure is due to the smoked salmon.  The filet mignon was cooked perfectly medium.  I have to say, even the salted butter and bread was spot on for our meal.  

For our finale, we had the nutella sticky bun for dessert, because why not.  Our server recommended this as a dessert rather than a starter and I'm so glad she did.  At first I thought there was no way we could eat it after all we just ate.  But the sticky bun was much lighter than I expected and even with the heavy nutella, it wasn't as sweet as it looked.  It was the perfect amount of sugar to end our lovely meal.

I will absolutely add this as one of my go to places next time I'm in Vegas baby!  Can't wait to try it again!

BARDOT Brasserie Review - From the moment we first stepped into Michael Mina's BARDOT Brasserie, a cute French bistro tucked into a corner next door to Jean George Steak House on the second-floor Promenade level of the Aria Hotel, we knew we were going to become regulars.  Was it the beautiful bar? Or the French accordionist serenading the guests? The crusty french bread? Actually, I think it was the "Everlasting Champagne" that accompanied an amazing menu.  Who doesn't find themselves three sheets to the wind in Vegas at noon at least once in their lives?

Decor
The entire restaurant is fashioned in a classic but modern French bistro setting. Rustic treatments, artwork, and gold splash the walls tastefully and not overbearingly so. The bar itself is such a showpiece I had to include a picture of it to show the grandeur of the bar. The seating was surprisingly comfortable and after half a dozen visits over the past year, we haven't felt any seat/table was 'bad'.

Food
After several visits to Bardot, and having had many of the menu items, we have yet to find a dish we didn't like, much less love.  Something as simple as a Smoked Salmon Plate is executed so well, that it sets a whole new standard. Here are some of our favorites, albeit not an all-inclusive list:

Foie Gras Parfait
Recently I've discovered a newfound love of Foie Gras, and this parfait was a surprise to me. I usually love a grilled Foie Gras alone or atop a steak. Although Foie Gras parfaits are a classic preparation, I had never really tried, until Bardot. The flavor of the Foie Gras mellowed the sweetness of the port gelee so that spreading atop crusty grilled sliced bread felt so natural.

Smoked Salmon
Bardot executes smoked salmon better- just better. Not only are the ingredients fresh and of high quality, but more importantly, the seasoning and flavors are so well balanced that it just tastes better. There's no other way that I can really describe it any better. The smoked salmon plate is loaded with smoked salmon, sliced brioche, chive mascarpone, cherry tomatoes, avocado, and traditional garnishes. Sipping champagne while noshing on these gems make the day so great!

Roasted Beet and Goat Cheese Salad
The beet and goat cheese salad has made me love beets again. After I first had this salad, I immediately added beets to my grocery list. I already love goat cheese, but the caña de cabra cheese in this salad was like goat brie or bucheron. The creaminess of the cheese and bite of the beets were all carefully balanced with the wild arugula, hazelnuts, and mild vinaigrette. I've also added hazelnuts to my grocery list to throw on my salads!

There are too many other great dishes that can be had at BARDOT that I haven't listed here. Go and try them - whether it be brunch or dinner, you won't go wrong here.

Service

An additional highlight of Bardot is their consistently high level and quality of service. We have been there on weekdays, weekends, brunch, dinner, holidays, and off days. Every visit has been met with just the right amount of attentiveness while maintaining excellent service.

Finally crossed off Bardot and I wish I visited sooner..

Service: Exceeded expectations for $$$ restaurant.  Our server was friendly, knowledgeable and worked with a professional sense of urgency.  The kitchen kept the high end dishes coming on time throughout the evening.

Brasserie cuisine: The "World's best butter" with the sea salt was tasty and I kept carb loading because of it.  The Maine Lobster Bisque was a little off for me (little too much brandy or dry sherry?) but had this amazing type of cracker paired with it that I've never seen before. (see pic).  The cheese plate was solid and the charcuterie/meat board was awesome, that prosciutto!  I tried some of my friend's moules frites/mussels and it was tasty, perfect amount of garlic butter.  I went with the Rack of Lamb and it was delicious.  Prepped and cooked perfectly, and something I'd order again.  Every time I see truffle fries, it's an auto order and Bardot's was great.

Ambiance:  Beautiful inside and out, the brasserie lighting and decor makes for a wonderful dining experience.  The Dark wood tables and burgundy leather chairs are comfortable. The rectangular bar by the entrance is designed beautifully, almost chandelier like.

Bardot Brasserie just made my list of great restaurants for a first date. 
The delicious cuisine is as pretty as the lovely restaurant which enhances your dining experience.  Everything looks good, tastes good and I'm looking forward to the next visit to try more dishes. That's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy..! =)

We went there for Valentine's dinner.  I love the fois gras parfait mousse the best.  The escargot was not how I'd imagine, since they were wrapped in puff pastry.  Avoid escargot.  My spouse loved the Rib-eye steak, and said the temperature was precise, there was the great aroma and the flavor was rich and packed with goodness.
The Mille Feille dessert was very good. Our waitor was very attentive.  I would recommend this restaurant just to try when you are in the mood for French food.

We had reservations well in advance - it was my birthday- and were given the absolute worst table in the entire restaurant, despite numerous communications I'd had with the hotel staff. Service was okay. Food was very good. But to be seated at the bar entrance/exit when numerous tables in the actual dining room were empty...we were ignored quite a bit-note that restaurant was never even close to full while we were there. I was not disappointed in the food; the treatment is another story.

Had a pre-fixe menu for brunch and added the bottomless rose. The food was amazing...but I think we ordered too much. My favorite was the Bardot steak and eggs, truffle omelette, charcuterie board and Nutella sticky bun....oh yes and the bottomless Rose!

Best breakfast in vegas!  Just delicious!  It helped that we could get a reservation and not wait in a long buffet line at the peak of our hunger.  But what else can beat bellinis, well prepared steak and eggs and a surf and turf Benedict?  Well, maybe adding the french toast next time.  The table next to us devoured it, and it was huge!

Amazing decor and food. We went for brunch and the $25 bottomless rose was actually delicious and not just a cheap wine (normally $15/glass). The Nutella sticky bun was to die for and the french toast was the best I have ever had! It is HUGE!! Probably 2-3 people could share it. The prosciutto Benedict was very good but a little bit too salty for my taste. The best part of our time was our server Tish! She was amazing and I would recommend asking to be in her section if you go!

This hidden restaurant is a great place for breakfast. Great service here; they were very kind and accommodating. The food was good; I had the Eggs Benedict with short ribs. The egg was cooked perfectly. Will visit at another time for lunch or dinner.

frikkin amazing. Chef Michael Mina- yes. 

if you want to feel like a baller and have some romantical time with your girlfriends (ha! because we single!)... this is a beautiful resto inside the Aria hotel. i loved my experience here. the beautiful bar with brass and marble bar counters really caught my attention. 

Rose' all day'er. they had a great lunch menu with a happy hour of unlimited rose' for $15. we got our Drake on. the server bringing us the cheese plates and our platters really made the whole meal memorable. dramatic in the presentation of every entree... we giggled and oo'd/ahh'd- along with major photo ops in between. 

the Mussels Marinieres with garlic butter was fantastic. soft and chewy- the luxurious dripping of butter down my lips and dipping the crusty baguette to sop up the goods... mmm mm! the a Boulangerie plate was superb and Cheese Plate... when the server lifted the glass dome, i knew i was in for a good ol' time. 

they have specialty cocktails on rotation and seasonal ones as well. i tried the French Mule and it was delicious!

One of my friends made reservations at 6 pm for 11 persons to celebrate 2 of our friends' birthday on Saturday: 3/6/2016. Located in Aria hotel and near the buffet, this place, foods, and customer service were great. The food was cooked to perfection and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the pork chops and it melts in your mouth. I had sampled a little bit of my friends food. It was great. It was too hard to choice which one is the best. I was too full to finish my pork chops but had to because some of my friends and I had to go to a show right after. I didn't want to carry any left over food around and leave it in the car to spoil. I would recommend.

I LOVE Bardot Brasserie :)

I have literally been 5 times in the past 6 months, and really enjoy it even more, every time I go. The service is on point, the food quality is FANTASTIC, and I have not ever had anything but great times when dining there. In my experience, it's one of the more understated Michael Mina restaurants, but it is most definitely one of my favorites. I have frequented many others in Las Vegas and San Francisco and this is easily top 5 on my list. 

Additionally, Bardot has a really elegant bar overflowing with tempting libations. All of your classic favorites are available, and a few that may be new for you to check out -  My recent favorite has been the MAN ABOUT TOWN: it's Rittenhouse rye, rooibos infused campari, and carpano antica sweet vermouth.. it's so elegant and satisfying. If that's not your thing, they have a mean wine list, ready to pair with your dining experience. 

On the dinner menu - Like so many others have said, I cannot get away from the FOIE GRAS PARFAIT. It's so good, so decadent, so 'just right'. It is literally one of my favorite things on any menu in Las Vegas. So simple and delicious. It makes me happy every time I get a chance to enjoy it. I have also sampled their selection of very fresh OYSTERS, the crispy and elegant ESCARGOTS BARDOT, their KING CRAB CRÊPE, and their excellent WARM BEETS & CARAMELIZED GOAT CHEESE salad. Most recently, the classic style PÂTÉ de CAMPAGNE made it's way to our table, and was absolutely perfect. I am a fan for sure. 

On one particular visit, my whole meal consisted of just starters and dessert and it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had in Las Vegas!

For the main course, the LAMB RACK "FRITES" is probably my favorite dish. It's designed to be shared for two and is a really beautiful and classic presentation of rack of lamb. As well, I have loved the OAK-SMOKED DUROC PORK CHOP, but one of my all-time favorites is a well prepared LOUP DE MER.
