Also known as a Mediterranean sea bass, Bardot prepares theirs grilled, with caramelized lemon, fennel, and steamed potatoes. Too right!  In every case.. every meal..  perfect. 

Needless to say, if you ever have the opportunity to give Bardot Brasserie a chance.. please do. I haven't even touched on their amazing desserts and after dinner embellishments. This is a place to be savored and enjoyed. Check it out.

Happy Eating!

This place is just way too overpriced in my opinion. Came here for some bottomless rosè, to find out there was only one option of rosè so the waitress told us that she would give us a sample of it and not charge us to decided If it was doable or not. Along with that I purchased an Nutella sticky bun that was no where near worth $17. Once we had decided that we didn't want the bottomless rose because it was too dry to us, the waitress still charged me for the sample ..... I thought that was a con and I wouldn't recommend this place unless you're there for show and not the food or service.

So far I am pretty disappointed with the service. First, our server seemed miffed that neither my husband or I drank alcohol. We should never feel judged from abstaining. Secondly, I'm not that hungry and was thinking of having an appetizer as my entree. My server repeatedly stated it was appetizer size. When I informed him I wasn't that hungry, he seemed annoyed! What is that?!? There are so many places we could go eat and I wanted to have a nice evening out. So far his attitude has really dampened my evening. Upon choosing the appetizer he pressed "and what after?!" I repeated that I wasn't that hungry and the plate sounded good and he seemed upset. Which makes me feel upset. We'll see how the food goes but what little appetite I had is now gone. :( No one should ever feel pressured to order. Whether a $50 meal or a $5000, service and care should be consistent across the board.

This is me and my wife's favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Every time we travel to Las Vegas, we HAVE to eat at Bardot! 

The ambiance is incredible. It feels like we are eating in a 1920's French resturant. 

You can't order anything wrong off the menu. Every time we eat here, we always try something different and have never regretted our meal. Their selection of cocktails is perfect.  

The staff is VERY helpful and attentive. We were celebrating our engagement and they really went 100% to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. 

We can't wait to go back and celebrate something special. Thanks again, Bardot!

I have been here a few times since the restaurant opened for both dinner and at the bar. I am just in love with everything from the ambiance to the food! The room is absolutely stunning and it makes me feel like i'm in Paris again. I would recommend the Foie Gras Parfait and Duck L'Orange for the appetizers and of course the French Onion soup which is amazing. For the main course the chicken is great as well as the croque madame - which is a classic! I am also looking forward to trying the Brunch on weekends soon.

We came to Las Vegas to visit our son and his partner. Our plans on where to eat a Thanksgiving dinner had been overlooked.   We went on the internet and Bardot in the Aria by Michael Mina was recommended. We called and got a reservation for 3PM which was perfect for us and happened to be opening time for the restaurant.  I was a bit skeptical before we arrived because I wanted something more classic Thanksgiving dinner than a chef's wild creation.  We got just enough of both to make it perfect. The food was simply delicious.  Every bite was superb.  It was a fixed price menu and I had no issues with any of the choices.  My wife started with the Lobster salad and I had the chestnut soup. We both liked our selections. The turkey dinner was absolutely delicious.  For dessert I had the apple tart with vanilla ice cream which was super and the perfect ending to this wonderful dinner.

The service was equivalent to the amazing food.  Our waiter, Oscar, was there when needed but not pushy. He made our meal all the more enjoyable.  The wine steward suggested a Pomerol within my budget which turned out to be excellent.  We decided to have another bottle of wine and Oscar suggested one from the haut medoc area which was also good. 

If you are in Las Vegas, I would strongly recommend Bardot to anyone wanting to enjoy a fine meal and excellent service at reasonable prices. We will be back!

5am. Cant sleep. Might as well drop a constructive review!

By far, my favorite was:

FOIE GRAS PARFAIT w/ ruby port gelée, grilled country bread- I want to return just for this (we ordered both this & the SEARED FOIE GRAS). If you are not fond of foie gras w strong liver taste, this is the smoothest foie gras paired perfectly w sweet jam-like gelee, spread on a toasty country bread. If anything, their bread will make everything taste better. One of the best ive ever had. 

ONION SOUP GRATINÉE w/ cave-aged gruyère -
Whatever happens in the cave stays in the c...heese??  I like restaurants that champion in their basics. You cant (or you shouldnt) go wrong w french onion soup in a french restaurant. *drool drool*  big enough to share for two.

I also had BONE MARROW AU POIVRE, but too greasy for my taste.. Maybe the onion jam will make it bearable.
-------------------------------------

Honestly, was kinda full from appetizers and their killer country bread (beware!) but must finish review.

For Entrees/ Sides, we had:

BOUILLABAISSE MARSEILLAISE

SPINACH/ CHEESE SOUFFLE (daily special) - dont really know what this is supposed to taste like - it was like a bland pudding.. I was envisioning something like a spinach-cheese dip in taste, but not even close. You had me at.... souffle.... My soul is crying..

20 oz. dry-aged bone-in ribeye w bearnaise sauce
8 oz. filet mignon

Hmm, I guess you can't go wrong with steak.. But I think I liked the ribeye better. Honestly I need to return to rate the entrees again.. Good night.

Splendid! My boyfriend and I came here back in September on sort of a last minute dinner decision, after we napped a bit too late (as one does in Vegas after a Saturday by the pool). We booked the last reservation of the evening at Bardot, somewhere around 10pm. 

Hidden in the beautiful Aria, Bardot is a little Parisian delight! We were seated cordially at a candlelit table in the emptying bistro. The decor was adorable, the bar incredibly beautiful, and the service impeccable!

We started with wine, and found the perfect glasses per the expertise of our waiter. We decided on what I imagine to have been a seasonal appetizer at the time-- burrata with fresh stone fruit and seasonal squash. Positively scrumptious! Very refreshing, light, and an incredible blend of flavors.

We moved on to dinner, and ordered the 14oz ribeye to share and the blistered green beans to pair. Our steak and frites came out split  in advance, a very sweet gesture by the chef as well as our servers! We surely appreciated not having to awkwardly slice and section off a steak, which would surely crowd the table. We had eaten at multiple steakhouses in Vegas on our trip, and it was certain to both of us that Bardot's ribeye was the most flavorful cut with beautiful marbling. They served us the freshest, most raw horseradish per our request-- a rarity to get it so perfectly raw! The green beans with lemon and almonds were a wonderful touch to our meal that was splendid to begin with.

After dinner, the professional photographer (I believe her name was Brittany?) came along to offer us portraits, to which we happily obliged. She was an absolute sweetheart with a creative eye. We left Bardot satiated with a delightful meal with wonderful service as well as beautiful portraits we will surely cherish to remember the evening!

Although nothing there reminded me of Brigitte Bardot, the décor was French like many Vegas brasseries. Unlike those other brasseries, the food was better here. We only came for the daily happy hour from 5-7P, but were very impressed by this recently opened Michael Mina restaurant.

The escargot en crout was so good, we ordered another plate of the tasty bites. The mild and soft snail was deliciously encased in a puff pastry shell rather than just topped with dough. The hazelnut "salt" and Chartreuse butter condiments and chives and mushroom garnishes were nice complements, but most were hard to eat WITH the escargot because they didn't attach to the pastry crust. To make it easier to eat, maybe a hazelnut and mushroom cream would be fun to dip into and adhere to the pastry.

They were out of skate wings, so we tried the salmon tartare instead. It was a smart combination of both fresh and smoked salmon that avoided the unpleasant tackiness when only fresh is used. I also liked the subtle use of capers and the thickly spreadable consistency of the chive mascarpone. Another smart choice was the sliced brioche which was friendlier to bite than a shattering crostini toast.

The "HNYB Sour" was a solid Cognac-based cocktail with a head of egg white and a float of Beaujolais.

Poorly positioned in the low foot traffic area of Aria's Promenade Level, it's located on the level above the casino next to the Zarkana theater.

Came here last night for the first dinner of my brother in law's 40th birthday celebrations. 

Beautiful interior, polite and efficient service - fking horrible food. 

My flat iron steak was THE saltiest piece of meat I've ever had in my life. I only ate half because I was starving. My wife tried a piece and could not believe I had eaten so much. 

My sister in law didn't finish her rib eye for similar reasons and she's an Argentinian carnivore. 

The steak tartare was probably the only decent dish. 

If you feel like spending $300-400 on a completely subprime experience around your red meats, this is the place for you!

Our blonde server was nice and comped us a couple of desserts upon feedback of the main meal, but it really doesn't make up for paying $49-70 for disappointing steak dishes. I could have gone to SW or Prime for that pricing.

Prime beef at it's best. Delicious king crab crepes with an inventive twist. Service good. Drinks good. If you are a blue cheese olive fan, order! Delicious.  A Las Vegas treasure ! Ask for Oscar Alfaro exceptional service, extensive knowledge of the menu and gave great recommendations! Take the time to enjoy this exceptional restaurant !

Best dinner my girlfriend and I had! The bone marrow, Le Fromage, and the King crab crepe are to die for! My mouth gets watery every time I think about it! Our server Oscar took care of us very well. It was my girlfriends birthday and Oscar poured us a complimentary sparkling champagne.

Sexy bar, great food, awesome service. Have dined here before but decided to sit at the bar recently for drinks and a couple of small bites. Can't go wrong with the steak tartare and the cheese plate. Do yourself a favor and have an old fashioned. Trust me.

Everything was spectacular!  The service, the meal, the atmosphere.   We got to sit looking into the kitchen and I was captivated.  The twins and I had foie gras, escargot, crab crepe and duck wings for starters (recommended by Gerti G. the GM). We ordered the duck breast and the kings crab legs as entrees and both were amazing and cooked to perfection.  My favorite was the duck breastfeeding that my son ordered. We got it medium rare and it was very tender and juicy.  Then on to dessert.   We had to try the favorite...chocolate macaroon, which could have been shared by all 3 of us.  We also had the baked Alaska...highly recommend as they flambé the meringue at your table.  And finally had the crepe brûlée with beignets.  Magnificently done!!

I have not left a review in years.
--
Reliable French Restaurant.
The service from Mr Nelson was great.
His service was good as it gets. ( like we were in his home )

Peace
armen

I had such high expectations.  But I should have known once they sat us at a crummy table and I observed they had two large functions going on on both sides of restaurant (one of which was right near our table) it was going to be a rough one.  Our waiter was so preoccupied prepping the large room across from our table by mere  8 ft that we were a distraction and/or a nuisance. Here are your menus.  Here's your wine list. I'll be back in 15 minutes.  We finally ordered our drinks and they didn't show up for 16 minutes after that.  They were made but the waiter was too busy with preparing for big group to give a damn.  By this time I was starving so I had to wave him down just to order their bread with special French butter ($5).  After that I just observed him setting places in the big room.  10 minutes later I got the attention of another waiter to get us the included bread and house butter (which was better than the $5 dollar one).  We finally ordered.  The food was excellent.  I had the sole and my husband had the scallops.  Perfectly prepared.  We flagged our waiter down as soon as we could for check because the conference group had arrived in the big room with their badges around their necks and drinks in hand.  We could not hear ourselves think.  Why did they sit us their when I reserved through Open Table and marked it was our first visit their?  They knew what group was coming in!  As we waited and waited to get our waiter's attention because he was so busy opening up wine bottles and pouring glasses for people in the big room, I observed the same hostess trying to give another three top the crappy table location next to us.  They were smart enough to observe and see the cluster f that was occurring and asked for one of the booths that were completely empty.  They were denied!  I guess there was a group who reserved those booths already?  So they got slotted almost back into the bar area at a table.  Are you kidding me?  Why on earth they even opened to the public that evening is beyond me.  I see restaurants in Vegas all the time posting "closed for a private function".  Ok you want to be open to the public while hosting two big groups?  Then prepare for them with staff accordingly!  Restaurant management 101.  Oh, btw, completely overpriced.  Even the best steak places in Vegas do NOT charge $69 for an 8oz filet!  If you have prices like that please match with stellar service.  Wasn't even asked if we wanted another round of drinks.  Such a bummer.  Great chefs, poorly trained management.

This place is so nice I had the greatest meal ever. The duck wings are to die for. The service is impeccable and the care that they give us guest is top notch can't wait to return. Please take their recommendations on the food and drinks. They made me feel special.

This place is one of the many restaurants located inside the Aria hotel on the Vegas strip and it is one of the nicer/fancier places to eat dinner on the strip.  Getting a reservation at this place wasn't too hard, looked it up at 7:30 and we were able to get a reservation for 8:45 and we got there right at our reservation time and were seated promptly.

My friend ordered the pork chops and I had the 1/2 chicken which came with a side of mushroom bread pudding and my friend's pork chops came with a side of mashed potatoes.  I also ordered a side of black truffle fries.  The service was amazing and I could not possibly have any complaints about that. 

The portion sizes were also just right in that we weren't left still hungry after finishing our meal nor did we have so much food on our plates that we couldn't finish it.

The food however was only alright.  Based on what we ordered, it seemed to be hit or miss.  The chicken was okay but seemed to be slightly on the saltier side, enough so that I would occasionally have to switch from drinking wine to drinking water just to wash out the salt from my mouth.  The mushroom bread pudding on the other hand was really good and I did not regret having it come as a side with my main dish.  For my friend however, his mashed potatoes weren't too great for him.  He complained that they had a strong taste and that it was so much so that he couldn't even get around to finishing the potatoes.  He had no complaints about the pork chops though.

The black truffle fries were something I highly recommend on this menu though.  They were perfectly cooked, had just the right amount of flavor and unlike my friend's mashed potatoes they were in no way overbearing to eat or taste.

All in all, this place has great service and good portion sizes, a fair sized wine menu, and a decent regular menu.  I would just recommend you ask them to go easy on the salt for the 1/2 chicken and stay away from anything that comes with mashed potatoes as a side.

Michael Mina does not disappoint--food had great flavor, presentation was great, and decor & ambiance were on point. Went for lunch on Sunday and was immediately impressed  by the interior of the restaurant when I walked in (esp the gold alcohol rack above the bar).
However, service was not on the same level. The restaurant wasn't very busy, but our waitress was slow and not very personable (i.e. menus weren't given to us until 5 mins after we sat down, sister ordered an Arnold Palmer which wasn't brought to the table for 15 mins, seemed irritated that we asked if she could move closer to my sister who was ordering for the table).

MUST HAVES
- French toast: a thick brick of brioche--super moist and custardy; the mascarpone and syrup was an delicious combination that added just the right amount of sweetness to the dish 
- crab crepe: packed some really good flavor; the combination of the egg, crab meat, mushrooms and the apples = perfection
- salmon benedict: perfectly poached eggs, smoked salmon was not too salty, and the bernaise sauce was the perfect consistency

OKAY TO HAVE 
- Onion soup: just your average French onion soup--price tag is pretty steep for what it is but the portion is fairly large
- escargot borgot: an interesting twist on escargot--inside a puff pastry shell w/ butter and hazelnuts. I did like it but it was cold by the time it came out to our table, which bummed me out
- hunter's waffle: waffle and egg was perfectly done and the meat was tender. 

DONT NEED TO HAVE
- croque madame: nothing special--just ur average prep of a croque madame (bread, ham, cheese, egg). This was the greasiest and heaviest out of everything we got. If u want a croque Madame that'll blow ur mind, try the one at hatfields in LA. ;)

Just to be clear, the 2-star rating is associated to two separate visits to Bardot. The first time I dined at this restaurant was a 4 only due to long wait to order our first drinks. However, today, I would say it's more like a 1 star-rating. Although our waitress was very nice, she was nowhere to be found. We ordered our appetizer fairly quickly but waited about 30-40 minutes for it to come out. Our order for our entrees were taken after about 30 minutes of looking around for our waitress. We seemed to not be the only ones in search of her. Since we were already frustrated about the wait, my boyfriend cancelled the rest of our order and we left. The manager ended up comping our coffee and appetizer which was nice, but I would have rather paid for a nice meal and a good experience. My boyfriend tipped the waitress $20 anyway, so she made out either way! 

I love the Hunter's waffle and the foie gras parfait, but I think it'll be a while before I decide to return to Bardot.

The duck breast was tender and lean.  The portion size was more than plentiful.  The bone marrow was oh so tasteful and needed more bread to finish its buttery goodness.  My coworkers were all pleased with their orders: pork chop, filet mignon, gnocchi, lobster bisque, and the onion soup.  We all struggled to finish our entrees, too good to leave them unfinished.  I will be back to try the other items like the duck wings a l'orange and the rack of lamb.

Ok, so, WOW. Let's start this off our whole family was late on Mothers Day weekend brunch and they were still so lovely. Then as we are waiting, a photographer came around and took a complimentary family photo and printed as many copies we desired! Whaaaat? Then. Ok. The food. Oh holy. THE MOST AMAZING BRUNCH EVER. We all ordered a lot of food and tried everyone's food and EVERYTHING was beyond amazing! To the point where we all kept saying we couldn't try anything more. Yet still kept tasting, and finishing, everyone's dishes. Oh yes! And $20 bottomless rose! So the food- the best ever: carpaccio, onion soup (since it's a French restaurant don't need qualify), beet salad, quiche, burger, fries, croque monsieur, bacon, and so much more I can't think of. Oh wait! The complimentary pastries - oh yessssss.  Beyond delicious. And on top of all the deliciousness (and major shoutout to those in the kitchen), our server, Oscar, was so fantastic.  So helpful and gracious with all of us! And did I mention we had two toddlers?! Yes. That was it. I was generously treated by my bro and sis so can't speak on the cost, but I can tell you I am a local and even when I have to pay will definitely be back it was that fantastic of an experience!

We absolutely Love  this place!!!!!  We where here for Brunch. The food was great coffee was delicious.  Oscar was our server and he was so on point!  He was funny, attentive and eager to taking care of us. The manager was a delight!  He welcomed us right away and made us feel so comfortable!  I enjoyed the experience and the the food!  This is a must for anyone who cares to be pampered.

A MUST eat. Only got to step in so far for an appetizer of duck wing and a fine crafted glass of whiskey (was able to see him make it) that had lemon and an herb that I can't quite remember, but oh was it all I needed at the time. Perfect taste, perfect service. The atmosphere left me relaxed and only wanting to eat more if I could. Unfortunately, that will have to wait till next time. I will be back for you Bardot and as hungry as ever. Make your sure to save a glass of chilled whiskey for me! ;)

My wife and I came in for the happy hour as we are staying at the Aria and this place did not disappoint. First of all, Michael Mina should write a book or teach a class on how to set up a happy hour menu. People tend to go to HH for value, but this place is great in putting together a selection that would make you come back for a proper meal. Great service, awesome location and outstanding food!

Lillian, makes it happen, behind the bar!  A lot of great cocktails and wonderful wine. Great food:  flat iron steak cooked to perfection, every plate hot and delicious.  Friendly atmosphere.  Definitely will come back!

This place is definitely fancy and romantic, but I give 3 stars to the food, it was just not worth it at all and tasted it just like any other normal restaurants in town, we even asked the server for his recommendation on the menu and he said everything is great which was not true at all!!! Definitely not worth the price and didn't even taste delicious! We were so disappointed since we always enjoy trying new places. Great customer service though

The happy hour is the cities best kept secret! Run don't walk! 
I had the cod frites and a burger! It was honestly the best burger I've had in the city and the value overall was amazing!

I needed a drink... And a little something to munch on. Thank goodness Bardot is open late! 

I had never really considered myself a whiskey person, but the Charlemagne was quite tasty. It also has Chambord, tempus fugit kina, pineapple, & lemon. Watch out, as it can be quite addictive!

And wow, that Parisian Gnocchi! The gnocchi were perfectly crisp on the outside and pillowy soft inside. Add in sauteed black trumpet mushrooms, creamy chevre, celery root (which I'm normally not crazy about, but was done quite well here), and tasty roasted garlic cream, and I was in "gnocchi nirvana".

I had a wonderful bar side experience at Bardot last week. Perhaps next time, I'll grab a booth and taste what else this latest Michael Mina hotspot has to offer.

Yes, Yes and YES!! We tried all the starters there 
Nothing but perfect. A bit pricy but worth any dime.

Do yourself a favor and don't go with a standard burger there and try some more brave plates... 

5/5 !!!!!

We were looking for some breakfast options, and decided to go with Bardot since it had such good reviews and was just downstairs in our hotel (Aria). We went in sometime around 1045 and were able to get a table without waiting. This is a French Cafe and serves a blend of American and French options. 

Our server was pretty quick getting to us initially, but became pretty slow for the remainder of our meal. I had the American In Paris and my girlfriend ordered an Omelette. Our food was also slow getting to us, taking a bit longer than I would have expected for what we ordered. Once it did arrive, everything was very good. The Hash/Potato Cake served to us both was easily the best item we tried. Everything else was more or less what I could have cooked at home. We both had Orange Juice, which must have been fresh-squeezed, because it was probably the best I have ever had (it was like $9 a glass though, FYI). The French Toast they were serving to nearby tables looked really good!

All in all, you can get a pretty good meal here. The restaurant was really clean and has a cool theme and decor. The portions are large and everything is good, just don't bother if you are in a rush and be prepared to spend more than you would expect for Breakfast/Brunch.
Amazing experience 5*. French onion soup with all the add-ons wasn't cheap at $23 but more than worth it! Bone marrow and Giant shrimp were on point! Would def come again on the next trip to Vegas!

I am very selective about my 5-Star ratings and am exceptionally happy to add one more to this short list.

I went to Bardot while staying at the Aria hotel/resort.  I honestly didn't think much of the typical fancy places in Vegas, which is maybe why Bardot was such a revelation.  Most of the fancy places are all decor and no real substance.  Bardot was the rare exception.  If I go back to Vegas, I'll be sure to dine there every night.

Bardot has your typical French decor: Beautiful tiled floor, lots of brass at the bar, and elegant seating.  

Along with that decor comes a great bar and great bartenders.  These folks are genuinely happy to see you.  The customer service here is second to none.  Bartenders are experienced and knowledgable on all beers and spirits.  I tried a few beers before deciding that Hors D'age was going to be the one.  I highly recommend it, especially considering that you can only get it at Mina restaurants (or so I was told).

The food?  Delicious!  If you go for brunch, challenge yourself to finish the french toast.  It's like nothing you've ever had before.  Close to half a loaf, this delicious piece of heaven comes with a fantastic almond syrup thing that enhances the experience.

You've read enough of my rattling, go and try it.  You will not be disappointed.

Really darn good. I'd go back just for the macaroni and cheese. 

A group of friends had dinner here before an event - each of us oohing and awwing over our bites. 

The frisée salad with egg and bacon got rave reviews and the Bardot salad with Dijon vinaigrette and radishes was light and refreshing. 

Order a side of Mac and cheese! Noodles were oddly stacked on end (I feel bad for whoever has that job in kitchen prep) but the gruyere cheese was creamy on one side and and the noodles had a salty, crispy crust on the other. I ate most of it before my dining companions could try it. 

The burger was really good. Mine was cooked well without being dry. Seared crispy on the outside with cheese and tart onions, watercress and garlic aioli. The fries were perfectly cooked and salted.

The herb gnocchi were great with a cream sauce. The skate got rave reviews too. 

I'd certainly recommend this restaurant. We had some service issues with the bill getting rung up incorrectly but I'd give them another chance for sure.

What a pretty place. Fits Aria perfectly. Take the escalators upstairs, by the buffet. Party of 7 last night. Great hostess was quick to get us situated. Our servers were attentive and always filling our water glasses. Never rushed us even when we stayed an extra hour after our dinner was done. Filled our coffee cups twice. Didn't have an attitude when we each paid with credit cards. Food was beautifully presented. We ordered tons of appetizers and the 20 ounce steak to share. Two dozen oysters, foie gras served on a bed of lentils, King crab crepe, bone marrow, escargot on puff pastry(YUM), tuna tartare with quail egg, duck wings, side order of green beans and French onion soup. Super good. Dessert: cherry clafouti and Mille feuille

So decided to come here to have brunch on my last day in Las Vegas and was satisfied with the food and service got pretty lucky came in like 1130am right before two large parties came in at 1215 so got my food and drinks quick the tables next to me were waiting for 20 to 30 minutes for service.This was my second time here and brunch has not disappointed never been here for dinner or lunch maybe next time would check it out my bill came out to a little over 100 but was worth it got bottomless sparkling wine with the Hunters Waffles and the Le Steakburger the meat in this burger was very juice and tasty and the taste on the duck confit was also very good this is a must try dishes and place for brunch nice place and atmosphere

Definitely one of the better brunches I've experienced in Vegas. So far I've done Caesars palace buffet and one at Wynn and if someone made me chose between those again I'd goose this one! The pictures don't do the French toast justice IT'S HUGE. enjoyed the French omelette. It is simple the Brie is in there somewhere but can def taste it. Comes with hash brown in a square form that has a herb in it that I can't pinpoint. All the food is delightfully different.

The decorum is beautiful but not so much that you feel uncomfortable inside. Comfortable elegance with class--nothing like feeling like you're in a stuffy library that you can't talk.The staff are so inviting and helpful with your selections. We loved the Foie Gras parfait with grilled country bread! They even brought more bread. It's the type of appetizer that would make you act naughty, like licking your fingers. The escargot bardot took awhile to come out but, I did wish that I could taste the escargot more than the pastry. However, it was warm and delicate. The Skate wing was good. But, the main star was the Oak fired pork chop! The smoke on the pork chip was amazing. We can't wait to go back and try their other selections.
Not impressed...  The food was tasteless, service was mediocre, the ambiance needs something to spice it up.  I will pick other restaurants and not return to this one.

This place is amazing! Great service, atmosphere, and the food and drinks are seriously incredible. I sat at the bar with a friend around dinner time and we ordered a few cocktails and mostly a bunch of different appetizers. Everything was delicious. It's a great vibe and you can go casual or fancy. I went twice while in Vegas and that's saying a lot!

My most favorite dishes in the world: steak tartare, foie gras, escargot. All cooked to perfection! My fiancé had a rib eye and it tasted like a filet, that's how tender it was! Fast service also. Our server was Latisha H. she was very nice and efficient :)

The food is pretty good here. The sea bass is very tender and the decor is great in the main dining hall.  It is conveniently located across from The Buffet in Aria.

The small oysters are very fresh and I just cant get enough of that (should have ordered more).

Will come back next time.

I've been in this industry a long, long time and this is one of the top experiences that I've ever had. Yes the food was phenomenal, the burger was maybe the best in my life, the Best Butter truly lived up to the name, and the Bourguignon was unreal, but these didn't take the experience to the next level. What got me to 5+ stars was Oscar. Hands down one of the best servers that I've ever had. He reminded me of all my favorite people that I've worked with in my career all rolled into one. Friendly, knowledgeable, hilarious, I will be coming back on a regular basis just to see him. Thank you Oscar, see you again soon.

UPDATE: Nice half-ass "apology" by the staff. Your customer service is even saltier than your food.

Excellent service, okay food, but not worth the price. Spent $400 ($300 plus tip) since we were there on a special occasion (our 10th anniversary), but everything was so salty I barely had any room for the food because I was downing a cup of water between every bite. Every bite was like a straight sip from a salt shaker: the bread with the fancy butter that cost extra on top of the free bread and butter, the seafood tower, the lamb chops, and the steak with foie gras. It was so depressing because I was so full from water I couldn't finish my half of the foie gras (we shared everything). The giant macaron dessert was fun. I was concerned that it was kind of gimmicky but it was a decent macaron, with crisp, delicate outsides and perfect feet.

Should have stayed in LA and gone to the Arroyo Chop House in Pasadena where they make me a perfectly seasoned blue rare steak every time, and we eat like kings for $150. Too bad Fusion closed down; their steak with foie gras was orgasmic.

Delicious dinner! The space is gorgeous, like a regular French bistro sexified and given the nightclub treatment.
Service was attentive and good.
The steak tartare is incredible! Get it!
The foi grois w fruit was good, very smooth.
The duck wings were meh.
The bread is very delicious, hard not to fill up on it.
The pork chop was so tasty, the veggies complimented it very well.
The steak is also top drawer.
I liked the cocktails and thought the apple one went very well w the porkchop.

The entire meal, from salads through entrees were incredibly salty, although all items were well presented. The apps and entrees were either heavily salted or tasteless. Nice restaurant decor wise, decent service, great sounding menu, but almost inedible due to the heavy hand. The exception was the escargot which was actually quite good, but otherwise even the salads were salty. I had the house smoked pork chop, which was almost inedible when you combine the smokiness with the saltiness, and finish with a mustard sauce. My wife's salmon was well prepared but salty as well, while the beluga lentils underneath were tasteless.

Let's be clear, there are a LOT of good/excellent restaurants in Las Vegas.  I travel here more than enough to know this. I would say that the food at Bardot is no exception to that rule.  Unfortunately the service is so bad that you can't rank it any higher than a 1.  I mean I have spent time in France, I am French for crying out loud and I can't recall a time where you were supposed to be whisked away to France only to find out that the Tour Guide or in this case the hostess would be better fit working on a corner somewhere rather than guiding you on your journey. I mean I get it, I made a reservation I show you the confirmation of the reservation and somehow in your mind because it shows something different in YOUR system I am a liar.  Also when there are open tables everywhere and you still feel the need to place my party of 4 in a high traffic area, you FAIL.  

Beyond her incompetence we have the idea of the "appetizer".  In my book the appetizer is supposed to come out first. Hmm..apparently it is different in France (Hint: It isn't different).  They decided here at Bardot to just bring EVERYTHING at once. So that of course while you are eating one thing the other items get cold. FAIL.  If it is there policy to bring everything at once they should at least explain that?!  Oh and of course they forgot a side of frites which was to be included (not ordered separately) for a friend but it only took a half hour to get it to him.  Another glorious fail. All in all this Terrible service give this restaurant a 1 in my book and if I were you I would search for other options in this city. There are plenty of them....f

A decadent experience and meal from start to finish. When my friend suggested this as our next food adventure I was excited. This has been my list to try for awhile.

Located inside of Aria the restaurant was easy to find. Follow the signs from the casino to the restaurant area. The walk from the parking garage wasn't too bad. Bardot is in the same area as Herringbone, The Buffet, and Carbone. The inside of the restaurant feels like a French bistro and has a nice ambiance. 

Enjoying a leisurely meal we started with two appetizers and a soup. Everything sounded so great on the appetizer menu or hors d'oeuvres as it is labeled on the menu. The French bread brought out to begin was perfectly crunchy and tasty. This was a great way to enjoy the butter sauce with the crepe which we did shamelessly. 

The French Onion soup was amazing with a nice amount of bread in the soup and a broth with amazing onion flavor. The layer of cheese on top was thick and the cheese just kept coming with each bite. A decadent soup for sure. The King Crab Crepe was a flavor explosion at first bite. I could not believe how much flavor was in something seemingly so simple. Everything was fresh and the crepe was perfectly prepared. We enjoyed this dish without the sauce served on the side by mistake and still found it incredible. The Steak Tartare was fresh and flavorful. The potatoes to enjoy the tartare on were prepared like a chip were incredibly delicate and delicious.

Sweets are a necessary guilty pleasure and we were getting full so we decided to skip to dessert. Narrowing to three choices wasn't easy, but we selected Cherry Clafouti, Mille Feuille, and an Apple Tart. All three were amazing, but Cherry Clafouti was my favorite. It was a unique dessert that was like a cross between bread pudding and custard. The delicious tart cherries adding plenty of flavor and the pistachio ice cream on top was so delicious. 

The service was attentive and polite. Our waitress checked in on us frequently and accommodated our requests. Since the table was small the staff paid special attention to clearing plates frequently which I appreciated. 

I'm already looking forward to returning to Bardot for another lovely evening. This is a great spot for a nice night with a friend or a date night. The food was outstanding and one of my more notable meals lately!

If you are staying at the Aria, Bardot has a great happy hour daily 5-7pm.  Wine, cocktail, beer specials and some great snacks.  Get the POUTINE, salmon tartar and any of the tartines.  It's rare to find any deals in the Aria, so this happy hour was a reasonable priced surprise. 

Sit at the bar for a more casual experience and the bartender takes care of you.  More of a mature crowd.

Had Mother's Day brunch and everything was excellent! We had foie gras, hunter's waffle, pan bagnat, eggs, bacon and fruit. And apple tarte tatin for dessert. Servers were very attentive. Our coffee cups were never empty! As part of their Mother's Day treat, they were giving moms glass bowls with fresh flowers made on site and free photos. We loved it that the regular menu was offered in addition to their pre fixed Mother's Day menu.
One comment on the pan bagnat: it would be better if it was a Niçoise salad instead of a sandwich.
Would definitely go back.

Very yummy for brunch & bottomless rosé. The Nutella sticky buns was to die for, the escargot was decadent & the short rib eggs Benedict was good but a little too heavy. Service was great except for one bad egg who was "too busy" to take a photo of us #rude still gave it 5 stars though

My experience started out rough because of the service. My server was abrupt and impatient. I'm not sure if he heard me complain, but I noticed some improvement when he came back.  I thought he was racist because I noticed how charming he was with the Caucasians at the next table.

It's interesting that his recommendation changed from person to person. My friends who got there earlier asked for recommendations and he told them to get a set of items. Then when I asked, he told me another set of items.  

I was at a French brasserie, so I had felt like I had to get the escargot. Not escargot in butter, but this puffed pastry escargot. Next he mentioned the lobster roll was unlike any other and I can't find it anywhere. He also recommended the Hunter's waffle. I wanted one croissant for $3 and he told me I might as well get the "bread basket" for $10. 

I ordered pastis and the server had no idea what I was talking about. I told him, that this is a French restaurant and you must have Ricard at the bar. He checked and they brought me a glass of pastis on the rocks for $15. At that price, I should have instead ordered the $20 bottomless brunch rosé.

Everything I ordered was excellent. My favorite was the bread basket, which is more of heaven in a basket. My first attack was the canelé. I wasn't going to share that with anyone. I inhaled it. Next was the croissant which was crisp just like I've had in France. Then there was a kouign-amann and raisin pastry which I shared with my table. 

This is a Michael Mina restaurant which I've had on my list of places to eat at Vegas and I'm glad I was able to check it out during this trip. Chef Joshua Smith is the chef de cuisine and is taking French classics to another level of refinement. 

The management needs to better train the staff. I didn't feel the service level matched the restaurant quality. It did improve towards the end of my meal, but was not at all memorable. 

The food outshined the service. 3 stars service. 5 stars for the elevated take on French classics.

About the chef - http://www.michaelmina.net/restaurants/las-vegas/bardot-brasserie/our-chef

Chef Joshua Smith on Munchies - http://munchies.vice.com/videos/chefs-night-out-bardot-brasserie

I haven't been back to BARDOT since their grand opening last February. One of my girlfriends and I wanted to dine out somewhere nice a few weeks ago and decided on BARDOT. 

The architecture of the restaurant is just as gorgeous as I remembered it to be. Both upscale and elegant... Hard not to admire.

We were greeted at the host stand immediately after walking towards the restaurant. We confirmed our reservation and were escorted to a spacious booth near the back end of the restaurant, close by the open kitchen area.

We had Kim as our server who was delightful! She was very knowledgable about the menu and so personable too. She offered some great recommendations, the sea bass being one, which my friend and I decided to split as our main entree.

I would have loved to try their seared foie gras or escargot but my friend isn't the most adventurous eater and wasn't budging. We agreed to start off with the charcuterie board and share a salad. For our entree I (luckily) talked my friend into the sea bass with the help of Kim's recommendation and reassurance.

Everything. Was. So. Delicious. Even the fresh bread they first brought out with us with butter was baked to perfection! 

- Charcuterie board 
My goodness, what a variety. Came with toasted bread and a number of unique cheese and meats. Pickles, diced candied peaches, pear slices, and toasted nuts were also flavorful sides that came with the charcuterie. I'm a huge fan of meats and cheeses and was impressed with BARDOT's choices

- Endive salad 
We had this salad salad before at BARDOT's opening but remembered loving it. Endives, field greens, spinach, green apple slices, walnuts, and bleu cheese tossed in a delicious light vinaigrette. The perfect salad to share as an app

- Sea Bass
The server knew my friend and I were sharing the sea bass so they pre-portioned them separately for us. The sea bass was paired with a small assortment of grilled veggies. Cooked JUST right, the fish was flaky and very tender! My friend isn't the biggest fan of fish but she cleared her entire plate! 

For drinks we had a bottle of sparkling wine and also tried these lemon/ginger cocktails. You can never go wrong with sparkling wine and the cocktails were strong yet tasty. 

Our overall dining experience was excellent. The phenomenal service and cuisine we first experienced a year ago has not changed one bit. There's such quality in Michael Mina's restaurants and BARDOT is one of the finest. I look forward to coming back - hopefully soon to try their famous brunch!
Great spot for brunch delicious French dishes I would highly recommend a visit with friends

What a great find this place was.  We got there late and decided to eat at the bar.  Our two bartender's were awesome.  I asked them to recommend two appetizers - so they suggested the King Crab Crepe and the Foie Gras Parfait.  Excellent choices.  My favorite was the Crepe- it was so different.  The egg makes this dish shine.

They also suggested the Le Classique Steakburger.  This is only available at the bar.  Beef patty was all prime rib deliciousness.  It was so good, I could of ate another one.  The fries are fried in beef fat.  These fries were so awesome.  Every single French fry was crispy.

Next time I am back in Vegas I will come back.

This place is very sexy, very French.  

Dinner food was pretty good.  I only tried some smaller plates.  King crab crepe was delicious.  Onion soup was comme ci, comme ca.  Frisee salad was overdressed and the bacon (lardons) were hard.

Brunch food was meh - the beef bourguignon croissant benedict was terrible - ou est le boeuf?

Service was apathetic, Parisian even?  Prices were high.

Best restaurant in Las Vegas!! We stayed at the Aria Hotel, so the restaurant was at a very convenient location, but even if not staying on site, I would be definitely there every single day!
Feels like I was in a small restaurant/cafe in Paris, wonderful and friendly staff!!! AMAZING wine selection, and the BEST burger in town! Must try the escargot appetizer!

An amazing dining experience from start to finish! As soon as we stepped through the doors of Bardot we felt transported back to Paris... And not the historical aged Paris of today, but a fresh, clean and newly built Paris of the 1920s. The shiny brass of the beautiful bar, the marble floor and the dark wood with gold accents of the dining room is stunning! 

We were celebrating our anniversary and we had a show to go to (our dinner reservation was 5pm and we had to leave for our show at 6:45pm) so timing was very important to us. Nelson and Angel were both very accommodating, making our evening extra special AND getting us to the show on time without feeling rushed. 

And every bite of food was unbelievably delicious! We started with the tarte flambee, then the escargot Bardot, duck wings a l'orange and Parisian gnocchi with black trumpet mushrooms, goat cheese and garlic emulsion (we honestly didn't NEED to order so much food - there were simply too many great options to choose from and we didn't want to miss out on anything!). For entrees we enjoyed the pork chop with bacon lardons and whole grain mustard, as well as the steak burger. Both were great, but the pork chop was the star of the show! The sides of macaroni gratinee and French fries were pure decadence. We finished dinner with the chocolate macaron - chocolate on top of chocolate on top of chocolate. Pure bliss and culinary perfection! Thank you Bardot!

What a great new place!!! The restaurant is just gorgeous, I felt like I really was in France!!! Service was outstanding, very attentive and detail-oriented. Food - pure heaven! The escargot are served in puff pastries and its just sooooo delicious, my salmon was also just cooked to perfection. This is my new favorite French restaurant and we will definitely be back!!!

i went to dinner with a group of friend we all ordered different menu items.
The coup de mer was amazing the skin was nice and crisp!
Everything was perfect. The food was served hot. And the service was spot on.

When you're in Vegas, BARDOT is where you have to go for brunch. On this visit I started off with fresh squeezed orange juice and the pastry basket which includes a variety of 4 very fresh and very flavorful pastry. There are a number of starters and if you like escargot, theirs is carefully wrapped in puff pastry and cannot be beat. Others in my party started with a Bloody Mary and they claim it's their favorite anywhere - it's made with fresh squeezed tomato juice. There were a number of entrees ordered at our table but I went with the Prosciutto Benedict (one of 4 varieties.) BARDOT serves their Benedict's on croissants which is a pleasant deviation from tradition. The eggs were perfectly poached and the bearnaise was well balanced. 

You should also know that the portions are generous which provides a hearty start to a full day on the town!

Aria has so many tempting restaurants, and Bardot Brasserie came in on top of my list of must-tries.

No reservations? No problem. Bardot has a wonderfully large lounge with over 20 bar stools & a dozen two-seater tables, all serving the full dinner menu. The dining room looks beautiful as well, so I would recommend reserving a table for larger parties or for a more intimate night out.

The duck à l'orange is fantastic! So rich, tender, and fall off the bone delicious. It's maltaise sauce is beautifully presented in a hollowed mini orange, & it's so creamy with an amazing yet subtle flavor. The onion soup gratinée is everything I wanted it to be - soft caramelized onions and baguette in a rich brown broth, all topped with a generous amount of gruyere. Perfect!

Bardot's bar became really busy past 10p and looked like the perfect place to hang out before heading to a club.

Went to BARDOT via a recommendation last night - food was fantastic and so was the service. However (and very unfortunate),  I developed mild food poisoning. 

It breaks my heart that such a good night ended so terribly.  I am hopeful that my experience is not common, but I would caution against eating there for a few days just to be safe.
Again fantastic service.  Great wines. The Anjou was brilliant. The marsanny amazing.   Lillian was top notch!!!   The beet and goat cheese.  Yummy!!!!    Again thank you!!!!!
Outstanding decor, our server was extremely knowledgeable. And the food was absolutely perfect. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Las Vegas. If you go ask to sit with Jamison

BARDOT has become my favorite place to eat in Vegas. The service is great and the food is second to none! I the bartenders here never fail to deliver on what in my opinion is the best old fashioned. 
 In this occasion I was undecided between a couple entrees so my bartender Gino recommended the Pork Chop and it was amazing! The sear in the pork chop was perfect and kept the inside moist. Pomme pure also on point with a hint of horseradish and together with the Chop is a medley of flavors that can't be beat.

Delicious French cuisine with the freshest ingredients, large portion sizes, great service, fair prices and the decor/ambiance absolutely beautiful. Ordered fresh-squeezed OJ, French press, fresh fruit bowl with a variety of fruits and ham croissant Benedict. Definitely coming back

A friend told me to make a stop in for the steak burger, so I said goodbye to Holsteins and hello to Bardot.
And I was not disappointed.
This thing was delicious. Its a great quality meat, and when topped with all the goodies it is a top 5 burger anywhere.
Pair it with a nice wine and you are in business at a very reasonable, by Vegas standard, price.

Great place. The food is amazing. Been here several times and have never been disappointed.

Beautiful interior and authentic Belgian and French foods on the menu. Cooked to perfection.

Will most definitely visit again! Would recommend to anyone!

Chef Michael Mina says "Every detail of Bardot Brasserie was designed to transport guests to a cafe along the Champs-Élysées in the 1920's" and it does just that. If you are looking for a superb dining experience in Vegas, definitely stop by Bardot!  This is the kind of place when they talk about the best Chefs in the world having the best restaurants in Las Vegas this is one of those restaurants! The atmosphere is very elegant French style, with high ceilings and a stunning European Cafe. When you walk in, the look of the bar and restaurant itself is truly something to behold.

Came here for Brunch and the service was top notch- our server was extremely informative, sweet and on top of everything. We started our meal with the complementary Baguette in a paper bag (how French!) and sea salted butter- I am a big fan of bread and this is among some of the best I've ever had. By recommendation we ordered the Brioche French Toast with vanilla mascarpone, almond brittle, and orgeat syrup. I am not kidding when I say this is one of the best breakfasts I've ever had! I don't even like French Toast all that much but this dish is a LIFE-CHANGER! We shared it between two people and couldn't finish so I'd say order one for the table or share between 3-4 unless you want some leftovers for when you come home at 4AM from the Club! 

Favorites:
Brioche French Toast

The advertisement for BARDOT playing on Aria sign off Las Vegas strip drew me in, congrats. 

Concierge  at Aria made a reservation for me. I arrived promptly at my reservation time and was seated in the bar area. I received a glass of water and menu. Then I sat there for over ten minutes looking over the menu, I had decided that I was going to have the lobster. 

Another few minutes passed, still no sign of a server, just a stream of staff walking past me. I looked again at the menu, got up and walked out. 

I really wanted to eat here, but couldn't allow myself to spend this kind of money to wait 10-15 mins just for a server to get to my table. Management should be closely watching the activity of their restaurant, you let money walk out the door.

Sad, cold concept for conventioneers. Probably okay if you can expense it, but I'm not interested in paying markups like this for middle shelf grocery store wine.  Inexperienced service at the bar. Also, worst tarte flambé I've ever been served. I'm sure that there are better options deeper down the menu, but we didn't stick around to find out.

Thank you BARDOT for such an amazing dining experience. You definitely helped make my birthday a memorable one!

I had been wanting to come here for a while, and my bf actually made reservations for us to eat here on my birthday. Everyone was extremely friendly and even wished me a happy birthday. We both had And God Created Woman, which I believe is named after the 50's French film. It was delicious. Just slightly sweet with citrus flavors that went well with the gin. Our server described it perfectly especially with the foam on top. We decided to start off our dinner with a cheese plate and oysters. The oysters were delicious and refreshing and the cheese plate, absolute perfection. We got the Blue cheese, goat cheese and the monks cheese. All of which were delicious!

We then ordered the caramelized goat cheese and beet salad, as well as the French onion soup. My bf wasn't too fond of the beet salad for the specific reason that he isn't too fond of beets (he ordered the salad), I thought it was delicious. I on the other hand bought the onion soup was good, but I felt like the cheese didn't melt properly. 

For our main entrees, my bf got the pork chop, and I the gnocchi. The pork chop was supposedly fantastic, as he described it as really smoky bacon and enjoyed every bite. The gnocchi is not going to be what you expect. It is a very creamy dish with the triple creme wedges, butter soft, and very large gnocchi's. I personally thought it was a little too hearty for me, but it was still delicious

Dessert was finished nicely as my bf surprised me with a macaron with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate. The portions here are quite large for a French restaurant, and you definitely feel like you got the most of your meal. The staff is very friendly, I would recommend coming here at least once if you are able to

After a few trips abroad I learned that if I want to be nearly 100% sure that I will like my breakfast, the french cuisine is a way to go. And it works every time, this visit being no different. 

Bardot Brasserie is a spacious, elegant restaurant located inside the Aria Hotel. They attracted me with their great brunch menu consisting of appetizing light starters, nice cheese selection and vast choice of breakfast dishes. And wines :). After carefull consideration, my fiance and I decided to share a desk of cheese as a kind of starter. They serve it with fresh bread and house mustard, seasonal jam and candied nuts on the side. The whole selection was very good and the mix of flavours suited us very well. Next, we ordered famous Hunter's waffles and french toast with mascarpone and almonds. The former was good, but not as exceptional as we thought it would, but the later, mmm... tasted heavenly. Not too sweet, crunchy but soft, just enough almond. And it was really big, definitely too much for one small person. The service was very professional and friendly, our waiter gave us some great advice. 

It's a shame we visited that place on our last day, as if I had known it earlier I would gladly eat there more than once.

Ambience. Thumbs Up.

Cocktails and Wine. Double Thumbs Up.

Food? Overpriced Mediocrity. 

I had Ribeye and Escargot. While the escargot was forgettable, I'm a steak man. 

American Diner Steak? Excellent. Just make sure to throw an egg on it to add some taste.

Pocket Burning Steak? Double Excellent. I love the monthly piece that lets me indulge in my carnivorous pleasures. 

This was a pocket burning diner steak. $65, hacksaw rough, slightly overcooked, and literally 1/3 fat. Not in between or around the edges fat, but literally an entire piece of the cut. Screw that mess.

I consider French food to be the pinnacle of gastronomic bliss. Quality of ingredients, preparation expertise, presentation, and service ~when on point~ allow one to understand why the French deserve lofty attitudes regarding their cuisine. Our dinner meal was sublime and the service (in true French style) was leisurely and attentive. I feel there's a "give and take" between a diner and the establishment, and that not every restaurant appreciates that nuance. It's a courtship of sorts. Bardot Brasserie and Chef Joshua Smith....I am smitten.

Lovely brunch with great service.

Other reviewers are right, this place is LOUD.  The food was nicely presented and tasted good.   Although I wasn't a fan of the Salmon and lentils because the lentils had a very meaty taste that did not mesh well with the fish.  I had the unlimited rose wine for $20 - they aren't stingy and I left quite tipsy.

Amazing food. 

We went her for an early dinner last Friday based simply because it was the first result on OpenTable when I was in a pinch to pick a place while on the phone. Boy did we get lucky. Bardot is great.

The bread and salted butter are to die for. I could have these for every meal and die happy (and 400 pounds).

To start i enjoyed the beef tartare which was killer. the potato chips that they provide to put the tartare on were the perfect complement to the nicely seasoned combination of quail egg and beef. Definitely amongst the best raw beef dishes I've ever had, if not the best -- and I love raw beef.

I followed this up with the Loup-de-mare which was fantastic. The fennel combined with the fish made for a perfectly balanced flavor profile and texture with each bite. I loved this so much I finished it in about 5 minutes...well before anyone else finished their meals....I just couldn't control myself.

I highly recommend Bardot and can't wait to come back and try more of the menu...now if Michael Mina would just open a restaurant in Los Angeles proper - Dana Point and Glendale aren't Los Angeles, if they were they wouldn't be in other cities.

I was so excited to try this restaurant with my family! The atmosphere is great. The hostess was very friendly. 

The service was lacking. I don't know if our server had too many tables - or what the deal was. We hardly ever saw him. We had to ask him to stop so we could order more champagne, a few times. 

The food was fantastic though. That really made up for it! I would definitely go back for the food, it was great. 

We ended up ordering dessert and after 25 minutes we hadn't received it so we had to ask him to box it up. Not the best way to end a meal, but it was fabulous. 

I would definitely go back and give them another shot.

It took me forever to find this place, but I was happy when I finally did. In addition to the complimentary bread, I happened to get bread with both courses. As the French are known for their bread, no objections here!

I started with the Foie Gras Parfait. I found there to be too much ruby port gelee, which drowned out some of the delicious foie gras, but you can scrape some off and put it to the side. The Mussels Marinieres were fantastic with a generous portion of mussels and a delectable butter/vermouth/tarragon broth.

The best brunch in Las Vegas.  

That sounds like hyperbole, since Vegas is a city overrun with brunch spots at all price points and levels of quality.  But Michael Mina's Bardot Brasserie is the real deal.  It forgoes behemoth pancakes and bottom-shelf mimosas for top-quality French gastronomy, and the payoff is amazing.

Another plus: Bardot Brasserie is one of the few brunch spots that accepts reservations, which we were lucky to have when I joined 2 friends here for a 10am Sunday brunch.  The place was totally packed.  The hostess then whisked us past gorgeous displays of breads and pastries to a beautiful table near the back, which was an excellent vantagepoint to soak in the classy decor.

We started off with a round of cappuccinos, followed by "la boulangerie" -- an assortment of breads and pastries, along with baguettes and butter.  Absolutely everything was fresh, warm, and packed with flavor.  I would've been happy camper calling it a day after that, but we were hungry, so we kept ordering.

For the mains, we shared a plate of "pâté de campagne" of pork, veal and pistachio, served with pickled vegetables, more crusty baguette, and spicy mustard.  The next course was the hunter's waffle with duck confit, poached eggs, and maltaise sauce.  Both of these were outstanding, but the hunter's waffle was truly exceptional -- an elevated and elegant twist on eggs benedict.  Somewhere in the middle of the mains, we had a bottle of "Patrick Bottex Bugey Cerdon" rosé, which was a delicate and smooth bubbly that paired excellently with the duck.  (Speaking of which -- service was outstanding.  Our server knew the menu inside and out, and exactly what bottle to pair with what dish.)

To round out the meal, we tasted three different desserts -- chocolate macaron, apple tarte tatin, and orange jelly candy.  All of these were pure heaven, but special props go to that chocolate macaron.   Now I know why it's one of the signature dishes of the house.  The chocolate cookie combined with the dark chocolate mousse is just pure decadence.

I can't say enough good things about Bardot Brasserie.  I hope this place keeps Vegas classy -- and my belly full -- for a long time to come.

I had no idea what I was in for when I made my plans to hit up BARDOT Brasserie for a solo dinner.  I only knew that they were pretty new and that they have a happy hour menu with some terrific sounding selections.  I had absolutely no idea of their pedigree!  That being their association with James Beard Award-winning chef Michael Mina.

Finding this place was step one.  Fortunately I had read that it was in the neighborhood of the Zarkana theater, which turned out to be up a flight of escalators from the casino floor.  But instead of heading towards the theater, I found it to my right when heading towards the buffet, as direct neighbor to the Jean Georges Steakhouse.

I liked the little tables set for two bordering the exterior wall of the restaurant, but I headed in to the bar area to enjoy a meal made up of selections from their Happy Hour menu, available daily from 5-7pm at the bar and lounge area.  These are smaller offerings of some of their regularly priced and portioned appetizers, which is great for a single diner who wants to try a bunch of things.

Tip - eat the Escargots $6 toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse butter, puff pastry shells while they're hot.  They are less a wonderment once cooled.

The Duck Wings A L'Orange $4 Wood grilled duck wings, seasoned citrus, sauce maltaise were meaty and tender and arrived 3 pieces to an order, as did the escargot.

The Bone Marrow $5 Roasted bone marrow, red wine onion jam, grilled country bread was perfectly portioned for one.

So if snails don't weird you out, definitely get the escargot, but I'd order any of these again.

Let's start with the good, the food, drinks and ambiance are great. Tucked away with the other restaurants in on the second floor of Aria, they've done a great job turning a closed area into a lively restaurant.

The bad... I'm not sure if the kitchen was backed up or lost our ticket multiple times but service, specifically attention to detail was very lacking until we addressed it with the manager.

Arrived at 9 and menus were not distributed until 10 minutes after we were seated. Drinks were ordered immediately but did not arrive until 9:25. Food was delayed until even later, 10:05 and it was only then that our server asked how we were doing.

It would be one thing if the place was packed, I'm in Vegas enough between trade shows, fight nights, and weekend getaways to understand when things get impacted but on a non-major event weekend the delay and lack of communication during the slow roll out was beyond frustrating.

The gf and I appreciated the team's effort to make it right after we addressed it but you dine at Michael Mina establishments to *not* have to think about the quality of service from the moment you walk in.

At the end of the day, mistakes happen, order tickets get misplaced, and bartenders get busy. Judging from the other diners who've been here our experience might have been the exception not the rule, but it doesn't change the fact that as a patron I went from 'This is a place I'd love to bring clients' to 'can I speak with the manager' in 65 minutes.

2.5 stars.

Brunch review. Michael Mina.

4 - ESCARGOTS BARDOT (burgundy snails, puff pastry, toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter)
4 - MAINE LOBSTER BISQUE (classically prepared with brandy, roasted tomato, tarragon & puff pastry)
3 - HUNTER'S WAFFLE (glazed duck confit, poached eggs, sauce maltaise)
5 - SHORT RIB BOURGIGNON (Croissant Benedicts, two poached eggs, sautéed spinach, béarnaise)

Overall, "I'm a fan."

I love French brunch and this place rose to my expectations, which is saying a lot! Great dining experience from start to finish. We had the crab benedict (outstanding and probably better to get one for yourself because you won't want to share!), the mussels (exactly what you would expect), and the smoked salmon benedict (love that it's in a croissant pastry but salmon was a little too salty for my taste, will try another next time instead). The house bread was also the yummy, chewy kind with room-temp. butter. Oh, and don't skip the cocktails-- the melon cocktail we had was out of this world.

The only negative for us was the fact that everything. took. forever. I was getting so impatient by the end. I think we waited 5 minutes just to get the check. Our server was lovely but I don't know if she had a lot of tables or she was just slow, but my goodness! 

Will definitely come back!

Went to Bardot for breakfast yesterday on our last day in Vegas. We were looking forward to a relaxing great meal a little outside the casino craziness. Bardot could not have been MORE DISAPPOINTING. First typical Vegas lackluster service, which is almost expected but it only got worse. 
Food took forever. 
Quiche Lorriane is served almost cold
The chef must never have read the recipe for "classic quiche Lorraine" because both had spinach and one didn't have any meat. 
The only redemption was the manager took the quiche off the bill after we complained - but he never apologized nor did he even stop by to see how the replacement meal was... The replacement which was just the original meal reheated - took 20 minutes to reheat. 

There is a reason this place is in the back corner of a mall. YOU ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO FIND IT. A DEFINITE SKIP IN LAS VEGAS.

We have been to many of the French restaurants in Las Vegas and being from the Bay Area, we are familiar with MIchael Minna and his high expectations when it comes to the dining experience. We came here last evening to enjoy a great dinner and were deeply disappointed and left dissatisfied. The service was awful plain and simple. Our party of four waited over an hour and 15 minutes from the time our appetizer and bread came until our entrees showed up Luke warm. Guess what... I understand that it's a busy Saturday night, but this terrible waiter..... never checked in on us, offered us another drink, more bread, ANYTHING! When he finally remembered us........he brought  luke warm dishes out that were meh. HE WAS SO RUDE. A little charm could has saved the night.

Do not come here for a fine dining experience, you'll be sorry.

Two people ordered sparkling water and two of us asked for regular water... $18!?!  And we were NOT told that regular water would be $9 charge. Never heard of such a thing. Food was good though...especially the decadent French toast loaf which we shared four ways as a "dessert" after our brunch, it reminded me of angel food cake with crispy edges and almond syrup. Decor was pretty. Waiter was stereotypically French... He never smiled and was quite arrogant with us.
Outstanding service and ambiance. Food was well served, but didn't have the uff to be expected from a good restaurant. Onion soup was slightly too sweet for a pricey restaurant.

If you're looking for a date spot in Vegas, Bardot could easily fit that.

You walk in, cuteness pops at you. It's a Michael Mina restaurant, which I didn't know who he was until I came here, but he made this restaurant be very classy. The decor is very inviting, sort of older, but still modern.

The hunters waffles and the French toast. Okay, so the hunters waffles were very much new to me. Now I've had the poached egg dish many times, but not like this. I haven't had duck with it. It really was different I think. The duck would've been better if it was shredded a bit more I think, but it was very good. The french toast was MASSIVE. A gigantic brick of french toast that had a nice, somewhat bitter flavor, that leaves you so stuffed, you'll regret attempting to finish it in one sitting. One thing I would've liked was instead of the almond syrup, if we had been given regular syrup. The almond syrup sounds more appealing, but I think it made it a bit too bitter.

Bardot was a fantastic experience that I plan on revisiting the next time I'm in Vegas.

Sea bass is cooked beautifully, very flaky and buttery. Pairs well with a crisp white wine and served with fingerling potatoes and onions. Hope you don't need to kiss someone immediately post meal. Bread offered but didn't try it. My neighbor ordered the chicken, which was served with green beans- he loved the chicken and his side of frites. Brass bar is beautiful with a good atmosphere. Make a reservation if able for main dining room. 

Came for late HH tonight and am SO thankful I did!! I ordered the burger, and it is literally the best burger I've ever had. Do it!!!!!!!!!

Let's just say the reviews are definitely mixed and quality depends on the time you dine... First, we booked the reservation after checking in at the ARIA, great hotel; terrible dining experience. We had a 10pm reservation and felt rushed to order and unimpressed with the menu. French... Not ! The floors are tiled so sound carries- very loud to the point we had to repeat ourselves to the waiter and could barely hear each other to hold a basic conversation. Sad... It was my boyfriend's birthday who's an executive chef and knows his cuisines. This place wasn't as french as we thought. Had to add salt to our meals and didn't even acknowledge his birthday.. 

Another fine dining restaurant on strip who provided a sample dessert with a gift from the chef. 

Complained to the hotel rewards counter who sympathize for the terrible experience and offered a 50 dollar comp.. Thanks Aria-
Oscar took amazing care of us for brunch - our second time back and not disappointed!  A must stop when you are in Vegas - Thanks Oscar!

Restaurant Week 2016: $50 Prix Fixe Menu
- Escargots Bardot: Wild Burgundy snails, toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse garlic butter, puff pastry shells. 
- Oak-Smoked Duroc Pork Chop: Bacon lardons, horseradish potato puree, grain mustard beurre blanc
- Creme Brulee: Vanilla Bean custard, turbinado croquant

Restaurant Week 2016: $80 Prix Fixe Menu
- King Crab Crepe: Buckwheat crepe, black trumpet mushrooms, sunny-side egg, Normandy cider beurre blanc
- Maine Lobster Thermidor: Asparagus, fines herbes, mushroom duxelles, sauce bernaise
- Chocolate Macaron: French chocolate cookie, Vahlrona chocolate mousse

Everything was delicious. The $80 menu was a lot stronger compared to the $50 menu (or at least our selections) as all three items from the second menu were my favorites of the evening. The King Crab Crepe and Lobster Thermidor were outstanding dishes! If you haven't had this preparation of lobster, you must try it here. It is absolutely delicious. I love many lobster dishes, but this one is on top of the list. Plus, the Chocolate Macaron caught me by surprise. I wasn't really expecting much of it, but the macaron itself had a great consistency and the mousse was lovely. I didn't want it to end!

Though we thoroughly enjoyed our food, service was blah. When we sat down, our server forgot to come to our table (he admitted this), so we waited for quite some time without beverages or menus (even worse for a restaurant with many, many people walking around, including managers). Our server was nice, but he wasn't available very often. He would show up immediately after our food would arrive - basically, when we didn't need anything, but rarely showed otherwise. It was even troublesome to receive water refills. He had a couple tables directly next to us and would literally forget to stop by when checking on them. After we finally got the check, I couldn't flag down a single person to pick up my payment. I was seriously holding up the book with my card sticking out and still, it took several minutes to get anyone's attention. Our overall experience wasn't terrible, but it did leave a bad taste in our mouth and I definitely expect more from a Michael Mina restaurant.

I do wish to try their brunch and am willing to give their service another shot!
Just a wonderful experience. Standard brasserie menu, but everything was executed perfectly. Even let us create our own dessert - grilled ! Had to thank the chef personally.

My bf is French and ever since I started dating him, we've been eating at a lot of authentic French restaurants haha.  We both really enjoyed Bardot. The atmosphere was nice and we had impeccable service from our French waitress Clementine.  I ordered the King crab crepe as an appetizer after reading all the yelp reviews, but for me, it was just ok.   I much preferred the rack of lamb and macaroni.  The meat was so lamb meat was so tender and flavorful.  The macaroni and cheese was the best I've ever had!  For dessert, we ordered the apple tart tartin which was really good as well.

Oh my MERP! So delicious! Had the Maine Lobster which was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. Also, the ribeye steak frites are superb! French onion soup was delicious and the dessert was also great. No bad things to say about this place! Service was friendly and attentive. Meal was well worth the money spent.
Great, attentive service and probably the best burger I ever had. My new favorite place in Vegas for brunch.

Epic fail.   We had reservations for 745 and we weren't seated til about 820.  We had plenty of time to study the menu and ordered immediately.   Here it is, 910 and we still don't have our food.   We ended up leaving.   Incompetence everywhere.

Food may appear better than it tastes, at least for me.  After seeing so many delectable photos on Yelp along with the high ratings, I decided that Bardot would be the restaurant of choice to use my dining credit as part of my stay at Aria.  My family and I had brunch here and it was only marginal.  Had better at Mon Ami Gabi.  Food also took too long to come to table which is unacceptable when the restaurant is not even half full at 10am.

I loved Bardot when I went on Valentine's Day. I don't know if I can give an honest review though without mentioning that I may have gotten really terrible food poisoning from here that night. It started a few hours after I ate here, and my husband met someone in the casino whose wife got food poisoning from BarMasa the same night. There might've been something just going around Aria. That's why I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 4.

Aside from possible food poisoning, the food was fantastic. We shared onion soup, escargots, steak tartare, and the charcuterie board. The steak tartare entree was so good, we actually ordered an extra appetizer sized one. We also shared the chocolate macaron dessert, which was great but a little too rich. The only thing I ate that my husband didn't was complimentary macarons at the end of the meal. The other negative was service. We went on Valentine's Day, so we expected rushed service, but we were there early with few other diners and still felt like we barely saw or heard from our waiter.

I recently dined here for Brunch on Saturday and it's safe to say that I enjoy Michael Mina restaurants. 

You will find this location on their second level next of Aria. Look for the Zarkana Theater and Buffet to help you locate it. Super cute bistro with brown walls and tons of windows. They have a bar area that displays various liquor bottles and next two that a table that shows some of their various baked pastries. 

We started with that pastry basket. It had 4 kinds of bread I loved the two sweeter ones. I can't remember the names for the life of me haha 

The steak tartare was the bomb. I could order one on my own. Probably one of my favorite dishes of the meal with taste and presentation. We also had the King Crab Crepe. If you like crab and mushrooms then this is up your alley. Also very yummy.

For the entree we had steak frites and salmon Benedict.... Talk about already full when these came. I had the hardest time deciding which main entree to get and these two were good. I think I would talk more about it if the starters didn't already blow me away. 

Aaaanddd of course we had to have dessert. The chocolate macaron was so good but we could not finish it haha. Definitely good for at least 3-4 unless you want diabetes for one. 

So yes to this place for that nice brunch. You will not be disappointed.

This place ROCKS!
