For appetizers, I was planning on getting the foie gras parfait based on the reviews, but the server explained that this was more of a mousse, and if I was looking for a real piece of foie gras, to get the seared foie gras lyonnaise. OMG, it was amazing. The lentils and the caramelized shallots were a perfect complement. We also got the tuna tartare, it was okay. 

For dinner, I ordered the rack of lamb, medium rare. These were served over creamy polenta. It was amazing. The lamb chops were thick and juicy and cooked perfectly. Some of the best lamb chops I've had. Unfortunately, there really was no room for dessert. 

This place is pricy, but the product that the provide is well worth it. An outstanding experience. I highly recommend it.

This is a cool place. We came in for brunch. It was probably the yummiest brunch I've had in Vegas. I ordered the French Toast. Wow! It was huge. It was a loaf of brioche bread with candied almonds and almond syrup on the side. The crust was crunchy and caramelized. The inside was warm and so soft.  The almond syrup was a perfect complement to the french toast.  My wife had the Hunter's Waffle, although it seemed more like Eggs Benedict.  It had duck confit, poached eggs, and veggie hash.  It was amazing.  It was flavorful, and the eggs were poached perfectly.  The duck confit was yummy, and not greasy.

The food deserves 5-stars!  But I had to deduct a star because the service.  The people were nice, but we were left on our own a lot.  I had ordered coffee, and no one ever checked to see if I needed a refill.  We also emptied our water, and actually flagged down what appeared to be a manager checking up on the room.  So if we needed anything, or a refill, we needed to flag someone down.

It's a new place, so I'm sure the service will get better.  I'll be back for the food.

What can I say, impeccable service from a great service staff(Thank you Esteve) wonderful food and an lovely ambience. Just an overall great experience. It is pricey and I enjoyed it throughly. Don't forget desert. With their French press coffee a total delight!

Wish I could give more than 5 stars. The filet and fries were the best I've ever had. The service was excellent and the wine menu was amazing. The atmosphere was nice, very warm environment. I will definitely be returning.

We went for brunch today. The ambiance of this restaurant is just beautiful and as Parisian as it can get. The menu is vast and allows for lovely choices, all of which are prepared under the influence of French cuisine. I ordered the salmon with brioche which was a souped up French version of the American bagel with lox and cream cheese. In this case, the cream cheese was a lovely herb cream cheese with a brioche bread on the side and fresh smoked salmon. There was a little avocado, small cornichons, tomatoes, and cucumbers. There were also a few slices of red onion. It was delicious. It was also properly proportioned. Prior to that, they did bring a mini French baguette with fresh butter. For my drink, I ordered a spritz with orange pavana... Just lovely. The prices are very reasonable and over all, it is a fabulous experience. I greatly enjoyed this brunch and would not hesitate to come back again.

What can I say... I am a huge fan! We went for Bastille Day. Great atmosphere! Great food! Don't recommend for a romantic date because it is a bit loud. Great service! Just wish they told us our steak came with fries before we ordered fries as a side. And I am a sucker for a champagne cart!!!

Our server was really great. We try the escargots which was different, wrap around pastry. Not bad. I had the sea bass and it was really delicious with the fennel and potatoes. The double rib eye with the different sauces was great also. Fries was not crispy, just ok.

Had two great prior experiences then poor service, food, and seating last night.  Server rarely appeared and couldn't even pronounce the food (in English - not looking for French pretense).  The fish was chewy and raw.  It's understandable that any chef can have an off moment and lose focus so no big deal.  Wasn't looking for a freebie but they offered to take it off my bill - but see comment about terrible service so of course it wasn't.  

Inconsistency of food, service, and seating comfort is the death of any restaurant.  Be careful especially if you're entertaining guests or colleagues. I know it must be hard to find good help in this town, but at $150/person that shouldn't be my problem. 

Would love to have addressed this with them rather than on Yelp but no one was available and their web site has no contact method.

Bardot was just a joke! It's an elegant venue with impeccable service but the  kitchen is without a vision. Poor ingredients, flavourless meals, ridiculous pricey list of wine make your experience at Bardot just awful. Vegas is plenty of restaurants with serious chefs and meals. Stay away from this place.

What a wonderful discovery!  We went to Bardot's for our anniversary and had an amazing experience.  Bardot is located in Aria, but you can easily avoid having to deal with any Strip traffic by coming into City Center from Harmon and parking at the North Valet (we are locals and weekend traffic on the Strip is about as much fun as having your tonsils removed with a grapefruit spoon).  Bardot's is on the 2nd level promenade, so no casino noise or flashing lights, just a nice relaxed restaurant area fronted by a very cool lounge.  From the series of small tables sitting outside, to the interior decor, it feels very authentic...reminded me very much of Brasserie du Louvre and this time I didn't have to sound like Quasimodo trying to speak French.  We were greeted warmly and once seated we were presented with an anniversary greeting card, with a handwritten message welcoming us for our special night, signed by all the wait staff...it was such a nice touch and really kicked the night off perfectly.  The wine list is quite extensive, including the by the glass section and in addition to the expected selection of French wines, it was nice to see some old favorites from California.  We started off with half a dozen oysters...it was our anniversary after all  ;-)   My wife ordered the King Crab crepe as her main (she's little and fills up fast) and since my favorite French meal is still Moule Frites, I sort of created my own dish by ordering Mussels Marinieres and added the pommes salardaises...three words....Stu-Pen-Dous!!!  The oysters were excellent, very fresh, briny and good...I preferred the West coast to the East coast.  My wife's crepe was rich, savory and incredibly flavorful...each element was there, the rich flavor of crab, the nuttiness of the mushroom the amazing creamy sauce all set off in a buckwheat crepe.  My mussels were perfect...yeah, I work out...okay, so my muscles are a bit old and tired compared to what they are serving up at Bardots, but you get the idea.  The mussels were all perfectly cooked, plump and bursting with flavor and the sauce was a little slice of buttery garlic heaven!  There was plenty to soak up my fries before plucking out a mussel to combine for the perfect bite!  The mussels come with one of Bardot's French Baguettes, which honestly could be its own food group, and the sauce that was left over after my french fry dipping was quickly devoured with the amazing bread.  If plate licking were acceptable, it would have been on!
When it came time for dessert, we opted for the "Frozen Paris Brest"...mainly because I wanted to be able to order a Brest out loud and not get smacked for it!  It came out displayed on a plate which read Happy Anniversary in chocolate writing...a very nice touch!  The dessert, like everything else we had was amazing, flavorful and absolutely irresistible...hazelnut, chocolate and this amazing salted caramel!  
My only suggestion for Bardots would be to give the Sommelier a few assistants, she was very knowledgeable about her craft, but she shouldn't also have to be in charge of pouring every glass of wine...Yes, I'm a lush and it pains me to see an empty wine glass.
All in all a wonderful evening at an amazing restaurant...we will definitely be back!

We came here for dinner Thursday night at 7pm and the restaurant was about 1/3 full.  It absolutely pains me to write this review and only give 3 stars because I feel like there's so much potential here!  The menu is enticing, service absolutely 5 stars, prices are very fair and ambiance is perfection.  The catch is....the food was mehhh 3 stars at best.  Considering this is a restaurant review, I have to base my stars on the quality of the food.  What we ordered:

1. Foie Gras Parfait- 4* delicious and creamy but it was more filler (i.e. cream) than foie gras.  still very yummy though
2. Beef Wellington for 2 people- 3* SO SALTY!! the filet was cooked beautifully and that along with the foie gras sauce would have been perfection together.  But the dry outer crust and the insanely salty duxelle made it unpalatable.  My hubby and I had to scrape the outer parts off and just eat the steak and sauce.  Plus it was $130 for the two portions and it didn't even come with a side.  That's expensive even by Vegas standards.
3. Black truffle french fries- 0* terrible.  The first batch we got was stale and not even warm so we sent it back.  The second batch we got was still stale and the truffle flavor wasn't even detectable.  You could see the black flecks of supposed truffle but there was absolutely no taste of truffle at all.  We didn't want to be a bother and send it back again so just left it untouched.  tragic

We skipped dessert because we didn't want to be disappointed further.  Our bill amount to $230 including a glass of wine.  Not bad- but not worth it.  There's potential here if they could get their kitchen to execute as well as their front of house staff.
This was a cute place. I was there for Valentine's Day when they had a special menu. The salmon was very good. If you like French food in a cute setting then I recommend this place.

Unfortunately a huge letdown! I was super excited to come here with my team being as I work next-door and have always wanted to come for brunch. We made reservations and indicated to birthdays that we are celebrating. My general manager, myself ( AGM) my production manager and some teammates Who work at a property next-door came in for brunch. We arrived on time and were greeted at the host stand. Only a five minute wait as we had a reservation we were walking to the backside of the dining room to be greeted by an empty dirty table. The hostess seem flustered and apologized saying that she thought the table was ready and it is not so we'd have to go back up front and wait. We waited for an additional 15 minutes upfront and we're finally sat at our table. Unfortunately the service kept going downhill because Server was late on the greet and we waited about 5 to 7 minutes and still took 10 to 15 minutes to even get water on the table. There was a couple items that we ordered but never made to the table as well. The food was good as we expected. My steak was cooked perfectly French toast was awesome.They never  acknowledged birthdays that we were celebrating as well. Completely disappointed in the service that someone has worked in the area at a restaurant next-door I couldn't believe it.

We have been there twice for Brunch, and will definitely be back.  The food is always incredible, and Rosie has become our favorite server in all of Vegas.  

So far, we've had the Ham & Gruyere Croque, the Paris Ham Croissant Benedicts, the Hunter's Waffle, and the French Omelette, and we are looking forward to trying a number of other selections on the Brunch menu.  The bottomless champagne is completely worth the $25 also, as your glass will never be empty.  

Try the coffee.  It's the best in Vegas.  

Miss you, Rosie!  See you again soon!

I came here for my Birthday and was quite disappointed. I've honestly had better food for the amount I'm paying. 
First off, the food was just okay. We started off ordering the King crab crepe and foie gras parfait for the appetizers. The king crab crepe was just so so.. flavor or texture did not impress me at all. The foie gras parfait spread was nice and creamy but the toast that came along with it was too thick and it made the whole appetizer unbalanced. 
Starting with entrees, we ordered the heritage chicken roti and the loup de mer. The word for both of those dishes are bland and boring. Me and my best friend couldn't even finish our food.. and we usually finish our food! 
So 2 star rating is for the service. Food gets 0. 
Although food was not that great, I will come back and try the brunch menu. Hopefully, it will be a completely different experience.

Went to Vegas for a vacation last month, and went for brunch on a Sunday morning. Britton(sp?) was our server, and he was the greatest. He was very attentive, professional, and friendly. The food was DELICIOUS. We were big fans of the pastry basket (which you MUST get) and the coffee bar selection. Our entrees were the Bardot Breakfast Sandwich and the American in Paris. Both were amazing, but you definitely can't go wrong ordering any of the other selections. Everything is worth the price. If we do go to Vegas again (which I hope is soon), we will definitely be coming back.

Hospitality starts at the entrance, where a friendly hostess greeted and escorted me to my seat. My server promptly welcomed and presented me with the menu. Although service was professional, there was no sense of warmth in the service provided ... orders were taken, delivered and the occasional courtesy check was intermittently made.  No complaint at all from me ... again service was very professional. The food was nicely presented and very well seasoned.  Absolutely no need for the salt and pepper shakers at the table. All ingredients used were very fresh and cooked to perfection.  I highly recommend Bardot Brasserie to any culinarian who would like to experience a great meal.

One word: Oscar. We came here for brunch today and anticipated delicious food, of course, but our expectations were incredibly surpassed. I work in the service industry and I have never had an experience like this before - Oscar is the best server I have ever had in my life. The kindness, patience, generosity, and joy that this man exudes is above and beyond the call of duty and we could not have been more appreciative. One of the best meals and experiences I have ever had. Oscar - you are one for the books and we will never forget today! We adore you!
Great brunch menu, probably the best selection in town. Great service and atmosphere. Highly recommend!!!

After a couple of meals at Bardot Brasserie, it's fair to say the hors d'oeuvres are more interesting than the entrees.  The initial visit had my wife and me tapping out after indulging in 5 appetizers and for the most recent visit, we went with six appetizers and two entrees for a party of 3.  PEI mussels, dayboat scallops and king salmon aren't normally things I turn my nose up to, but French food occasionally tickles my snobby bone, so I said "Reste loin de moi!" to all that.  

The wood grilled duck wings a l'orange belong at a tailgate party for millionaires.  That distinct flavor that only duck has went splendidly with the blood orange glaze and the maltaise could challenge many a wing sauce to a duel and win.  This is an excellent starter to share or hog all to yourself.   

Whether it's grilled, torchon, parfait, or rolled up into balls and thrown into my mouth by a circus clown, foie gras is fucking awesome.  Their seared version with beluga lentils, caramelized shallots and prune confiture was everything I was hoped for, everything I need.  Lightly smushing and spreading the prune on top with the back of a spoon ensured a nice tart fruit flavor in each bite.  

Not my choice to order, but I found the filet mignon to be a total snoozefest.  Although I could NOT get enough of the "beef fat fries" that it came with.  Can I preorder "beef fat cake" for my birthday??  Crunchy, salty, and borderline immoral, I wished more places offered this.  Get the stellar "Lamb Rack Frites" for an entrée over steak and ask for a side of fries.  

- Ask for bread with the prime steak tartare.  It's much better than the potato chips.
- The "onion soup gratinee" was too sweet for me.  

So tapas it up and share it all!  Everlasting Rosé for $30 makes life even more grand!

Just finished a great dinner at Bardot, but the most memorable part was the service and Nelson our waiter! 
My husband ordered the pork chops which were VERY salty and just couldn't eat them...He wasn't sure if to say anything but decided to, Nelson replaced his order within minutes and also gave us two(!) desserts for the inconvenience..Such a sweet way to not make you feel like a tourist-one-time-comer that will not get good service..
Thanks for a wonderful evening and great food!

We came here for my honey's birthday brunch as he read great reviews about this restaurant.  When we were greeted by our server, I asked her if she could do something special for a birthday.  Her immediate response was not "Thank you for coming to celebrate with us or Happy Birthday" but instead it was a blunt - "We do not give free dessert."  Ummm.... really?!  Did I ask for free?!  I gave her a disgusted look and said, could the kitchen put a candle or something on a creme brulee or cake?!  She didn't even apologized for her tactless comment and simply said, "We can write Happy Birthday on the plate."  I replied and told her, "Yes, will you please ask the chef to do that after our brunch?" and she smiled (finally!) and said she'll be back to take our order.  After what seems like forever, she came back and took our order.  She recommended the Hunter's Waffle, which I ended up getting.  Sad to say, Michael Mina would have been disappointed at the dried, tasteless meat that was supposed to be "duck confit".  I never add salt to my meal, but I had no choice this time to give it some flavor!  I tried to catch our server's attention to let her know but she was no where to be found.  We tried to flag down other servers but all of them seem to have their eyes trained on looking down on the floor or tables -- and not on customers.  Granted -- it was a Saturday and they were busy but seriously, I was NOT impressed by the slow service -- or should I say the lack of service.  The only reason I gave this place a 2 star is because my honey's beef short ribs croissant benedicts was tasty.  Overall -- a truly disappointing dining experience...

This is a fairly new restaurant in Las Vegas.  And a little difficult to find at the Aria hotel but had we heard about it from a salesperson at Tom Ford.
True in the parisian decor, lighting could have been dimmed a little for more atmosphere.
The food was really good, but I had to downgrade my rating because the service was completely lacking.  They just were not interested 
With all the great restaurants in Las Vegas, I would not go back because of it

I've been here 3x so far and can't go wrong with French food! I was super impressed my first time dining in, food was wonderful, service was superb, however my most recent visit in, the server forgot our drink orders for half the table and was difficult to find/flag down for additional service/help. Especially now with having to pay for parking to dine here, I'm really counting on an excellent service/meal but coughing up $200 for a family meal for mediocre service is pretty annoying and overshadows the good food.

Came for brunch, ordered frisée salad and the quiche. Both were very good, they also offer $20 bottomless rose which we didn't get but seemed like a good deal. Place is cute on the inside and for Vegas  decently reasonable. I would go back.

The Best French Toast Ever!!!

If you like french toast, you must make a weekend brunch stop at Bardot Brasserie at Aria.  It is huge and comes with a large portion of vanilla mascarpone and almond brittle.

I'm keeping this review short and simple to highlight the french toast.  Go, now, stop reading and experience what French Toast was meant to be...

When I went here for brunch, there was an accordion player strolling around the tables. If that was for authenticity, it wasn't at all necessary: you're transported to France from the first bite of the French baguette with a perfectly crispy crust and soft dough. I ordered the Benedict with Prosciutto (can also get it with smoked salmon and a couple of other things). The croissant they serve their perfectly poached and seasoned eggs on is a delicacy onto itself. I don't know if I'll ever be able to eat eggs Benedict on an English muffin again. The service is prompt and friendly.

Where do I start?! Came here for Brunch, best decision of my trip to Vegas. So, not only can you get bottomless rose or sparkling rose, the food was off the charts good.  I chose the still offering, what a great deal...definitely got my money's worth!  Reminded me of a quaint brasserie in Paris. This place is legit. The only issue we had was deciding what to order!  We ended up sharing the beef Bourgogne croissant Benedict and the French toast. I can say that hands down the best French toast I've ever had. It was unbelievable. The Benedict was awesome too. Service was perfect, and attentive. Please go here. Michael Mina is amazing.
They lost my credit card and then charged me for someone else's food and didn't do anything to remedy the situation. They made me 1 hour late to my concert.
The atmosphere is elegant and relaxed. The service is flawless and food a joy. My favorite place on the strip for fine dining.

To start, this reviewer is not a fan of French restaurants, but this is not your average stuffy French restaurant.  I must say that the experience from walking through the doors to dessert was off the charts great.  The location within Aria is odd, given it is situated with two other restaurants at the end of a corridor on the second floor of a poorly trafficked area.  Upon entering Bardot, you feel like you found the coolest French inspired speak easy around.  The restaurant is alive with energy, the drinks potent, the menu selection is celestial, and the service PERFECT.  I was in with a large party, and our server delivered a mix of seasoned professional with comic relief.  Being a picky pescatarian, I was offered a special plate from Chef, although I declined.  I was so touched that the Chef would make something special for me, and delivered such an amazing epicurean experience, I couldn't stop raving about the food while there that our server arranged to bring out Chef Jeannie.  She was such a great sport and chatted with us for a while.  

We started with assorted appetizers, and all were exceptional.  I had the Salad Bardot, and the Salmon Aux Lentils.  Both were 10's.  I topped it off with the chocolate macarone, this was rich and could be split with two others.  I dine in Vegas regularly, and have been let down more times than I was inspired, and this place hit the spot.  Please make the effort to try Bardot.

Went here for a bachelorette brunch. Food was okay, did not care for the chicken French dip or croque madame. Both were very average choices. Service was shocking. Rude waitstaff, never saw the server, asked for our bill three times, did not refill water the entire time. Disappointing.

I think it is safe to say that whenever you start your day with French pastries and Rose that life is pretty darn good, and that's exactly how Bardot made me feel! 

After a night out in Vegas there is nothing better than a beautiful brunch comprised of dishes ranging from out of this world fluffy french toast to savory steak and eggs. Lot's also not forget the most important party of brunch... The Bloody Mary. Staked with all the necessary accessories (a la olives, celery, pickle and lemon) this drink eliminated any pain caused the previous night and is possibly one of the best BM's ive had in Vegas, however be warned it is quite spicy but they are happy to make it to your tasting. 

Bravo Bardot! Hope to see you again soon!

Thank you #YelpLADoesVegas!!!

When staying at ARIA, Michael Mina's French bistro BARDOT is a must. Especially for Happy Hour. I'm not sure if I'd go here during regular hours as prices are $$$$ but then again, Happy Hour...

HH prices for cocktails were around $10, and small plates between $10 and $19. Highlight were the Tartines - shrimp, avocado, and fried egg were all delicious ($8 each).  

The bartender kept the drinks coming, and one is happily eating away. Good times.

Great location for a very special occasion for what ever it is. My girlfriend made reservations here for my birthday l. I had a great time and the setting was on point. Our server was very helpful and friendly on serving us, making it a great experience for my birthday. 

The salmon entree we ordered was the best salmon i ever had in my life. It was so moist and so much flavor. The oysters are super fresh. The escargots was out of this world which i never had before. I would love to come back again to this place.

Loved the feel of this restaurant.  Mom, brother, hubby and I came here for dinner one of the nights we were in Vegas, on advice from the chef at Other Mama.  Thankfully, reservations were not hard to make.

If you're familiar with Balthazar in NY, it reminded me very much of that restaurant.  It was busy/buzzing but not pretentious or snobby.  Our server was a rarity - a handsome, 50-something, funny/flirty French guy.  I wish we had him at all the French restaurants we've been to.  Even mom couldn't get over his looks lol.  Between him and the helpers, we wanted for nothing the entire evening. (Although he did try to make me feel bad about getting tap water for the table when I ordered sparkling for myself.)

To start, we went with the special bread and butter to which our server said he wanted our opinion on how it compared to the regular bread service.  The fancy butter was definitely more flavorful.  But both were delicious and we ate a buttload.

We also ordered the beef tartare and foie gras parfait.  Both also very delicious.  I'm a huge fan of both dishes in general and Bardot does them well.  We sure did layer on that foie gras parfait very thickly...yum!  Mom got the French onion soup and she loved it.  She shared a little but otherwise, went to town on the pastry crust and soup.

To be honest, at this point, we were feeling really full already (especially mom) but we still hand our entrees coming.  Mom and hubby both got the 14oz ribeye with fries.  I got the duroc pork chop to be different.

Mom's ribeye was pure decadence.  So much marbling and so well cooked to the medium rare we asked for.  Wow.  My pork chop was also very delicious though I should have gone with my instincts and asked for it to be done at medium instead of well done.

We were so stuff we had to skip dessert.  Our server understood completely.  

Fantastic dinner, pristine service and wonderful time had by all.  Love it!

Bardot @arialv brings #Bagel and #Lox to the next level. This is how #smokedsalmon should taste. Subtle, light, not too fatty, not fishy at all, melt in your mouth, slightly salty, with a kiss of smoke. Like the #Salmon was born to provide me with some essential brain #nutrients 
#Healthy and #delicious is by far the hardest combo to achieve. Well done. Golf clap.

It was out first time to eat brunch at Bardot and it was definitely not the last time! We live in LA and came for a long weekend. And I wanted to eat something special. We got a table for 4 and had to change it to a table for 6 because two more friends had been on their way. The waiter was very kind and reseated us. When we arrived the server introduced himself (Oscar) and brought out fresh baguette with delicious butter. I had asked for gluten free bread but they didn't have any. It was totally fine. Oscar said he would get it for me if I knew of a place that served it in the Aria hotel but I didn't. What a super nice thing to do!!! Well, Oscar managed to actually get me some gluten free warm toast and came back a couple minutes later! WOW! Amazing and kind service! Thank you Oscar, you left an impression! Lovely to see when people love their job and service people so amazingly. 
Delicious coffee and lobster scramble was amazing! Couldn't have been happier and fuller walking out of this place!

********************* 1249 **********************

    BARDOT Brasserie, Las Vegas' debut French concept from James Beard award-winning chef Michael Mina, is now open for dinner and weekend brunch at ARIA Resort & Casino. Paying homage to the skillful culinary techniques, celebrated libations and sexy atmosphere for which The City of Light is renowned, Chef Mina has created a stylish and unforgettable interpretation of a Parisian brasserie in the center of The Strip.

    Created by Bishop Pass Interior Architectural Design Studio, BARDOT's space exudes a dark and sexy, almost enigmatic atmosphere. I couldn't believe this was former American Fish's space, it's lavishly beautiful, chic, and elegant at the same time. 

    BARDOT's main dining room offers a traditional yet luxurious dining space. Walls of black lacquer are paneled with gold pen striping, surrounding a series of Parisian columns. Burgundy leather booths and bistro-style tables spread across a pristine marble floor, where guests can sneak a peek inside the restaurant's show kitchen as they watch their meals come to life.

    Sidewalk Café - A nod to Parisian sidewalk cafes, BARDOT features intimate seating outside of the restaurant for an entertaining dining and people-watching experience. Situated in the courtyard overlooking ARIA's second-floor promenade, the locale's French-inspired storefront and high windows transport guests to a 20th century literary café in Paris.

    Innovative Cocktails by none other than Mina Group's Director of Cocktails Carlo Splendorini and ARIA's Mixologist Craig Schoettler salute French drinking tradition with an inventive beverage menu. The restaurant's cocktail program combines the best of French culture and Las Vegas style. Signature sips include And God Created Women, a satisfying layering of French spirits and egg whites; and the Voltaire, a cider-based cocktail that dazzles the senses with baked apple bitters and housemade ginger syrup. 

    Finest Wines - Wine Director Kim Wood curated one of the most extensive by-the-glass programs, as well as the largest selection of French wines in Las Vegas at BARDOT, highlighting the finest small production and rare vintages from across the globe. 

   Happy Hour at Bar and Lounge 5-7 PM daily, very reasonable at $2-$6. Try these dishes: 

- PRIME STEAK TARTARE $6 sauce verte, slow cooked egg, gaufrette potatoes

- ESCARGOTS $6 toasted hazelnuts, chartreuse butter, puff pastry shells

- DUCK WINGS À L'ORANGE $4 wood grilled duck wings, seasonal citrus, sauce maltaise

- BONE MARROW $5 roasted bone marrow, red wine onion jam, grilled country bread

   The brunch menu is pricier, of course, but dinner is by far the best. 

- FOIE GRAS PARFAIT ruby port gelée, grilled country bread - delicious

- ONION SOUP GRATINÉE you must add Périgord truffle, braised oxtail & soft poached egg. 

- HEARTH-FIRED MARROW burgundy onion jam, grilled country bread, so tasty!

-  CARLSBAD MUSSELS MARINIÈRES garlic butter, dolin vermouth, warm baguette, this broth was flavorful, well balanced, and the mussels were perfect in size. 

- Les Steak Frites - a must try, with filet mignon and  foie gras butter sauce, ummm it was so tender and melting in your mouth good!

    And don't forget to try the Champagne Cart with my favorite Champagne KRUG GRANDE CUVÉE REIMS is only $38 by the glass! 

    Service by the same GM of American Fish before, a Michael Mina Group veteran Roberto Liendo, always a pleasure to dine here. I'm looking forward to return and try other dishes.

The food took a really long time to come out, even long for french restaurant standards. There were 8 of us.  We all ordered drinks, apps, entrees, and desserts.  The apps took an hour to come out after we ordered them.  The rest of the food was pretty timely but I feel that the service could've been better.  I'm not sure if it was the server or the kitchen's fault (the server was very nice.) But, we weren't updated on the status of our food until the food came out (an hour later.)

My review is a tad but late but it does not change how much I loved the interior and the food of course! 

I came in about two weeks ago with my better half for brunch. We had been viewing they're menu for some time now and finally decided to pull the trigger! 
Haha 

We showed up and fell in love with the bar they have at the entrance. 

Our server was a French girl I believe sorry if I'm wrong but she was amazing!! 

We ordered the foie gras parfait with toast the port jelly on there was nice tart and sweet for the richness of the foie..

The lobster scramble with caviar was frikkin awesome! Perfect amount of caviar it will not be over whelming I will definitely order this again. 

Of course being a Sunday we both ordered bottomless Rose that they offer and our server made sure to keep it flowing!!! 

Thank you Bardot!

I'm very disappointed We came here 3 years ago spent 500 dollars had the time of our lives we decided to try them again made our reservations very excited for our New Years plans. We ended up sick as a Dog Throwing up ETC on our New Years Eve Party ended the night sick as a dog in our room ruined our New Years Eve. Went to talk to the manger the next day instead of helping us sent us to security ( WHY ) made me feel like he didn't believe us we had to fill out a bunch of paperwork and no answers from management Do Not Go here there are a lot of places in LV enjoy elsewhere
Happy hour here was incredible. All tartines were amazing, French Onion Soup was delectable. Highly recommended.

Truly incredible experience from beginning to end. Our sommelier was friendly and very knowledgeable and eager to help us choose the wine that would best accompany our taste buds as well as the entire meal we had planned. The food was amazing. There are a few other comparable French restaurants in the Las Vegas area that I usually frequent when in town (out of courtesy I'll refrain from naming names) but this was my first visit to Bardot and it is hands down the best dining experience I've ever had in Las Vegas. The food was exquisite and everything was cooked perfectly. I tried a little bit of everything but the highlights worth noting (at least for me) were the foie gras parfait, the duck wings a l'orange, the mac and cheese (yeah you heard me right) and the chickpea fries with ratatouille and eggplant purée. Everything was perfect. I'm not very good at describing good food in text, but this was amazing and you have to try it for yourself.

I am a HUGE fan of Bardot (and most things Michael Mina). Bardot is Aria's take on a french brasserie - it's not intimidating or really over priced. The decor is beautiful and it's a very intimate restaurant.

The service is always fantastic - I prefer to go sit at the bar during happy hour because they have great specials, but sitting in the dining room is just as great. Plus, 2 words: CHAMPAGNE CART!! Don't miss out this! During brunch they offer $20 bottomless rose, which is just crazy! 

The Le Steakburger is really good, but I think my favorite dish has been the roasted chicken french dip....it's really good! I definitely suggest checking out Bardot, they have a lot to offer!

My favorite French restaurant in LAS Vegas! We sat at the bar because they were really busy and the service was impeccable. Our bartender Dino made fantastic cocktails and made us feel so special. The food though..... Outstanding!!!! I almost want to shed a tear. I will definitely be back many, many times.

I had an absolutely delicious meal here. We arrived a little early so we grabbed a drink at the bar. Attentive bartenders and a great selection of liquor. The hostess came by to grab us when our table was ready and almost immediately our server arrived with a bottle of water. We opted for the Summer in Provence tasting menu and the wine pairings. We both selected the tuna tartare, the scallops, sea bass, and strawberry pavlova. The alcohol pairings allowed for either a wine with each course of cocktail/beer. Our server was incredibly accommodating and said it would be no problem if I wanted to try the cocktail with my first course since I really wanted to try "And God Made Woman." 

First, the food was amazing. The portions were good and the wine with each course was delicious. And damn if that "And God Made Woman" cocktail wasn't worth asking the server for a sub. Seriously, get a glass, it's awesome. 

Having never had strawberry pavlova, I was super surprised by the presentation and now I'm going to research how to make it at home because it was just that good.

Hands down one of the most expensive meals we've ever had, but we both agreed we'd come back. I mean, I don't know what else to say, it's just really good. Also, say yes to the bread when they ask.

One of my go to spots in Vegas. 

Inventive French cuisine. I've loved almost everything I've tried there. It's on the pricier side of things so I've had some buyers remorse on a dish or two, but nothing horrible. 

The burger is one of the best fine dining burgers I've had.

Amazing place and great atmosphere! 
Came here on father's day for brunch so it was very busy. It did take a while to get our food, but it was worth the wait. The server was attentive and very friendly. 
The Maine Lobster Scramble was my personal favorite! Dad had the Steak and Eggs and really enjoyed that too.

We went back for a second visit while on property at the urging of a friend from another property. 

The hostess staff is amazing! Friendly, attentive and a great start to a fabulous meal. 

The venue is stunning. It's has all the making of an amazing space that caters to all aspects of the city.

The service was top flight and attentive. We wanted for nothing. 

The number of items on the menu is impressive. The charcuterie is exceptional. The Frisée salad was amazing. We all had steaks and sides. They were cooked perfectly. 

They have made some management and staffing changes since my original visit and review. We will definitely be back.

What a hidden gem in the Aria set just next to Jean George's Steak House! The service was amazing (we had a group of 11 tucked into a table near the front), the food was fantastic, and decor transportive. I feel like not enough people have mentioned the great deal of the $25 bottomless rose (still or sparkling) special that a bunch of people ordered with brunch. Our server, Latisha, was very accommodating and kind to our group. She even kindly split the checks into about 5 groups!

The french bread served prior to the meal was to die for: super crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. As a novice bread baker, it really got my creative juices going. I certainly feel the need to go and try out a variety of french baguettes until I find something that resembles that bread! 

For the two of us: french onion soup $18 was just amazing. You can tell the cheese wasn't crazy heated under a salamander for tons of time prior to serving. The broth was deep and flavorful with the perfect amount of bread inside. I wish I could make something that came even somewhat close to the caliber of that soup! We also split a frisee lardon salad ($19) and prosciutto benedict ($21). While you can skip the frisee (mostly eaten so that we could say we had something green), the benedict on a croissant was delicious. After going to Parma, we are suckers for proscuitto de Parma... Yum. Lastly, a large french press coffee was $9.50. This lasted around half of the table and was worth the cost as well. Overall, totally worth the price and probably the best hang-over-curing-brunch I'll ever eat.
This was a great place for dinner. Had a couple great pomegranate martinis along with a great steak dinner. Excellent service nice atmosphere.

I had high expectations for this place and it was very average for me. I got the New York steak which was highly recommended and I thought it was tough and grizzly. The service was fast and attentive and the appetizers   was excellent but I really thought  the steak was average at best. If I'm staying at the aria I'm going to Sage in a heartbeat over this place

I highly recommend Bardot if you're looking for an elegant and relaxing dinner. The space is beautiful, food delicious, and price surprisingly reasonable given this is Vegas, on the strip, and a Michael Mina restaurant.

I ordered the 4-course summer tasting set, and I chose:

-Tuna Tartare: fresh, refreshing, and a little bit different than your usual tuna tartare with the additions of chopped olives
-Scallops: delicious and sweet, although I tried my friend's choice of Duck L'orange wings for this course, and I would have ordered those instead. The wings were so tender, juicy, and flavorful and if I had been eating these at home by myself I probably would have done a much better job polishing off the wing.
-Sea Bass: very generous serving and delicious, although a smidge on the plain side. My friends ordered the sole for this course and said it was amazing so I would have chosen that instead.
-Strawberry Pavlova: Served with lavender ice cream a la mode and a tiny but fragrant piece of fresh lavender, this dessert was humongous and I could only finish the lavender ice cream before calling it quits.

My friends and I also shared the seared foie gras, foie gras parfait, and bone marrow. All extremely decadent and delicious, but I would have to choose the parfait as my favorite. It was creamy and savory, and I loved the Rose Port gelee that provided a tiny bit of tartness to the dish.

I would definitely come back and try their other dishes! They also have a daily Happy Hour (weekends included!) with some more casual fare like tartines, oysters, and tartares that could definitely be a meal.

Another night in Vegas and time to try a new place. We went to Bardot on 06/28 and it was so very good. The wait staff were very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. I started with the onion soup and it was delicious with so much melted cheese (maybe a bit big for a first course). I then had then scallops for dinner with a side of green beans (hey sue me, I like green beans) and the scallops were seared beautifully and the green beans delicious (maybe a bit to much salt on the green beans-one less shake of the salt shaker would have been okay)

For desert I had the warm cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream. I wasn't sure about the pairing of cherry pudding with pistachio ice cream but it works beautifully together. The cherry pudding was full of cherries!!  This is a very rich dessert and I could not finish it all but it sure was good

Well... I probably had very high expectations, having recently been to both Paris and Jaleo. The food technique was good, but not impressive. 

We had the charcuterie ensemble; prosciutto was fresh and delicious but a bit think for the type (I think it was Parma or some sweet Italian). 

Onto roasted octopus salad: the texture was just off; tough and chewy.
I know it's vegas and we don't have octopuses swimming around freely on the strip... but don't put it as a special. 
It turned me off to order anything else. Especially because the rubber octopus didn't come cheap. 
But I was a masochist and ordered dessert. 
Salted caramel something with hazelnut creme. It was ok - it was basically a stale donut with some creme in between. 

Drinks were ok - weak and overtly sweet. I felt like I was drinking syrup out of a glass. 

You might think - why the 4 stars then? If you have complained all the way?

Well, Kim, our server, was really nice and friendly. She made sure we were taken care of. 
The vibe was good. The bread was fresh. The ingredients were fresh.
But it just didn't come together in execution.

I will check it out again in two weeks. We will see!
Most authentic French restaurant west of Paris. Incredible foie gras and steak tartare. A must!

I've been here twice for the weekend brunch and this would be one of my favorite French restaurant. Chef Michael Mina did a great job on the variety of menu it has to offer. Let's start with complimentary french bread that is toasty on the exterior and soft on the inside with house butter. 

Appetizers:
french onion soup with truffle, shortrib, poached egg, and gruyere cheese - This is goood $16 bowl of french onion which taste so home -made and delicious. The beef broth was not salty and doesnt taste like it's from the can beef broth. It's not heavily dumped with onions. This is one darn good bowl of french onion soup. 

steak tartare - it was good and fresh, but i've had better. It comes in half or full order. 

escargot - Nicely presented and the escargot is wrapped in pastry puff. 

French toast with vanilla mascarpone and almond brittle - This is a huge brick of bread! Literally, it's probably about 2.5inches thickness and 4x6inches in length/width. I was only able to eat half of the french toast. Outside is toasty, but the inside was soft and quite mushy, but tasty. It's not your typical french toast. 

Burger with aioli fries - Juicy, huge, and tasty! the fries is a must have!

Ham croissant benedict - Interesting combo and the sauce was delish!

Hunter waffle with duck confit - It 's a good plain waffle atop with duck confit. It was just okay. 

Apple tart - Not your typical apple pie or tart, but it's really good. Not soo sweet, but full of apple flavor. 

Vanilla creme brulee - Full of vanilla flavor and creamy! One of the better creme brulees!

I would definitely return to try the happy hour menu in the bar area next time i'm in town!!

We had such a great experience here. I got the sea bass, BF got the chicken. We split a bottle of wine, the frisee salad and the macaroni. Everything was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Great service, beautiful atmosphere. We were so relaxed and happy the whole meal. Highly recommend. I think the dish I'll crave the most is the macaroni. Uniquely prepared and so tasty.
We can't get enough of this place. Everett time we are staying at the Aria we come here several times!  Brings back memories of trips to Paris.

I came here last weekend for a small birthday dinner, and was blown away by the experience. Tucked away inside Aria, this place is a true gem. The ambiance is intimate, service warm and friendly, and the food is delicious. Every dish is beautifully presented and reasonably priced. 

+ PRIME STEAK TARTARE: We ordered the small order to share (among 5 people), and it was more than enough, especially if you're looking to order multiple appetizers to share. The beef is delectably tender and is ground to order. 

+ SEARED FOIE GRAS LYONNAISE: The more extravagant of their two foie dishes, this is the one to get if you want the full on texture of foie gras. The foie melts in your mouth, but the star of the dish was the beluga lentils, I could eat a whole plateful of the lentils.

+ KING CRAB CREPE: I loved the simplicity and elegance of this dish. The trumpet mushrooms paired very well with the crab, and the buckwheat crepe was very delicate. Tasty dish and also very Instagrammable

+ BONE MARROW AU POIVRE: Rustic and hearty are the two best words to describe this dish. Aesthetically beautiful, the bone marrow is a golden brown and is served with country bread. Usually I'm tentative about onion jam, but I enjoyed their rendition.

+ ONION SOUP GRATINEE: We got the basic onion soup (definitely will get all the fixin's next time). All I can say is, if you love cheese, get this soup. I'm salivating just thinking about it. The soup was also very flavorful. The dish is a bit heavy, but that's expected of French onion soup.

+ OAK SMOKED DUROC PORK CHOP: I can't resist a good pork chop, especially one that's topped with even more pork (bacon lardons). Loved loved LOVED this entree. The Pork was extremely moist and well -cooked. Topped with the crispiness of the lardons and the crunchiness of the carrots, you have a great balance of flavors as well.

Food was good but the cocktails were the true highlight. MIXOLOGIST LILLIAN is ridiculous. We got to watch her work and she is meticulous. We asked her to make a few custom drinks and they were all phenomenal. I asked for a twist to an Old Fashioned, not too sweet and it came out perfect. My wife's drink (I can't remember all the great things she added but egg whites was one!) was exactly what she wanted. Lillian's first attempt was not satisfactory to her so she just threw it out. Sit in bar area and watch her work. Talk to her and you will get a perfect drink.

Overrated, simple as that. I expected more and during this visit they didn't deliver.

Atmosphere - A negative. The décor is very nice but the sound volume makes this an enjoyable place for a couple. There are large groups, bad acoustics and they pump music in the background that builds it up. The noise level is very loud. Also surprised to see a lady walk in with a bulldog on leash following her across the tile and she sits down at the table next to us so they should advertise being pet friendly. Considering the place sent me a text reminding me of their dress code I was surprised to have a dog sitting two feet from us while we tried to enjoy the dining. Maybe it was a French bulldog so it was allowed.

Service - While I went in with the mindset to not rush through dinner they took it to a new level. We had to order our first drinks from a manager who checked on us and went down from there.

Food - While the dishes were very good they didn't meet up to the hype and pricing (yes, I know it is Vegas). The pricing doesn't bother me it was that the dishes didn't rise to that level.

Overall, I take their stars down for atmosphere, definitely for service, food and the dog.

Lovely spot inside the aria. $7 for 4 hour parking. Came here for brunch. A little Too pricey for the size of the entrees. Got attracted to coming to this place by the billboard advertisement of the french toast facing the strip. Was unimpressed when it arrived. Way smaller and it tasted ok. A little over toasted but the sauce was good. The escargot crusted with a flakey bread was delicious. The clams was fresh. Overall a pretty decent place but dont plan to come back soon. Bill was $210 for us 3. A few entrees and one round of cocktails.
This is one of the most excellent restaurants in Vegas! If you are visiting, you must go and eat here. Great date place. Food is fantastic, and service is top-notch. You will not be disappointed!!!

Good service great wine by the glass list and most amazing chocolate macaroon dessert I ever had in my life. I have to say though the moules frites are so much better at Bouchon. But the beet salad and pork chops were phenomenal. I got dessert to go and they glued the pastry down in the box with chocolate sauce so that it did not slide around which was such a nice touch.

We came here for brunch and all I have to say is.... YUM! The pastries r to die for... So Ooooo gooood.. And the hunters waffle was awesome.. The staff was friendly n attentive.. I definitely will be coming back.

If your reading this just go, you wont be sorry.  And for a different experience go here and sit at the bar.  Dino, Tim and Erick are pros and will take good care of you and they serve full menu at the bar.  They have an everlasting Rose option for $30 which is exactly what it says you drink as much as you like.  Rose is not my first choice in wine, but it was summer time and I figured Id give it a try.  It was excellent.  And then there is the food.  All I have to say is bravo to the chefs that are clearly taking their jobs very seriously.  This review is actually referring to 2 different times I went there within 2 weeks. 
Night 1
Drink:  Aperol White Wine Spritzer (if you have been to Italy you know what this is and Dino made it perfectly), Also had a glass of burgandy and a pinot. pretty solid.
Food: Foie Gras Parfait- this was some of the best prepared Foie gras Ive ever had and Ive traveled in multiple parts of France.  
Onion soup with egg and truffle-so good, Im kind of a purest so I wouldn't order it this way every time, but wow the flavors, and broth were outstanding.  
Bread:  They have complimentary baguette and the butter tastes house made, very good.  

Night 2:
I decided to order the 4 course summer menu:
TUNA NIÇOISE TARTINE-very solid and the quail egg was a nice touch
DUCK WINGS À L'ORANGE-I love duck and these wings were cooked to perfection and the maltaise sauce served in a tangerine skin was such a nice touch
LAMB RACK "FRITES": Cooked perfectly and the chick pea frites were exquisite, your brain is of course expecting a french fry, which makes for quite a surprise, but in a refined way that is in every way positive.  
CHERRY CLAFOUTI- The cherrys in this are so flavorful and the pistachio cherry flavor combo is slightly reminiscent of home made spumoni ice cream.  

The only constructive criticism I can muster on this place is that one or two lower cost (maybe $10) house red wines would be nice as the red wine starts at $16 per glass, but hey it is Vegas after all.  Otherwise price points are pretty solid.  
Michael Mina delivers with this wonderful place, with stellar food that rivals many places Ive been in Paris, and spectacular service.  I could definitely become a regular at Bardot if I lived in Las Vegas.

Brunch was amazing. If you can sit in Tish's section, you should DEFINITELY request to do it. She is absolutely fantastic and made the already incredible meal so much better. Her recommendations were spot on (not the "oh it depends on what you want..." type thing, she is ACTUALLY helpful), she was so nice and personable, and she was incredibly attentive to every detail. The food was delicious as well. I got the burger and the fries with garlic aioli, and I could have licked the plate afterward if we weren't in public. The manager, Matej, is also amazing and extremely attentive. If you're on the fence, do yourself a favor and come here. Food, ambiance, service are all top notch.

Thank you for making our brunch (and my husband's 30th birthday meal) so perfect.

Upon coming here prior for a Yelp elite event, and loving the oysters, I came back here JUST to stuff my face with more. But, while at it, tried a few other items. 

Truffle fries- 1 star.  The fries were undercooked, meaning touch and hard on the inside, and not crisp on the outside. The flavoring was off with too much salt. 

Oysters- 2 stars. Got 1 dozen oysters, thinking I'd be blown away like last time, but no, I unfortunately wasn't. 

Steak tar tar- 2 stars. This dish was OK as well. It was almost too cold in temperature, as though it had been thawed only a couple hours ago and chopped up. 

Service- 5 stars. They checked on the table multiple times and water was filled constantly. 

Based on my recent experience, I won't be back.

The overall experience here was terrible, not because the food was horrible but that the service was atrocious.  Our waiter, Oscar, thought he was in France and was giving attitude like he was a Frenchman to an American tourist.

First off, Oscar just had mad attitude taking our order.  When we didn't order alcoholic drinks nor appetizers, he got all pissy.  We had a nice dinner planned at é by José Andrés (that's a place you should def check out). that night so we wanted a light lunch.  Plus not everyone in Vegas is a degenerate that drinks and gambles at all hours...so what if we didn't order drinks.

When it's my turn to order, I see they have a french dip, which I usually really like.  I turn to him and start to order but I noted that the french dip is a chicken french dip.  I tell him to cross that off since it's not a traditional beef french dip.  He rolls his eyes impatiently.

I quickly switch my order to the French onion soup but I asked him about the option to add short rib, black truffle & a poached egg.  He says its a completely different soup.  So I ask his opinion about the soup and whether or not he likes it.  He replies "if you need to ask its not for you" and he just walks away.  WTF?!?!?!  Seriously?  He is in the service business and if he can't provide customer service go do something else.  Have you ever had a waiter just walk away from you in the middle of a discussion?

The food itself was average at best.  The pastry basket was bad as most of the pastries didn't look or taste fresh.  Do yourself a favor and go to Bouchon in the Venetian for pastries.  We just returned from SF were we had awesome KA's at b. patisserie and we also recently tried Dominique Ansel's new bakery in LA where he had the DKA's (his spin).   All of these places blow the pastry basket at Bardot out of the water.  I can't believe they even sell this stuff here.

A couple of us got the French onion soup, which wasn't bad but pretty average.  At least it wasn't overly salty like bad French onion soup.

My wife ordered the burger.  When it arrived it looked like a pretty average burger but she said it was awesome.  So of course I took a bite and I have to admit looks can be deceiving.  It was pretty damn good (and for $20+ it better be).  The meat, caramelized onions, and bread all went really well together.  Easily the best thing we ate there.

But I wouldn't go again for the burger (since the best of the food was average or below par at best) and the service probably one of the worst we've ever experienced (Recommendation to Oscar: if you want to be a waiter do it properly otherwise go do something else).  It's unfortunately because we were just in SF and had dinner at Michael Mina's flagship restaurant (named after himself) and it was an awesome experience from the service level to the food.  If only a small portion of that restaurant rubbed off on Bardot, the experience here would be significantly better.

Absolutely stunning and breathtaking view the moment you walk in ...the view is of an eclectic bar with bottles all neatly placed and organized. One of the best brunch spots we have had the pleasure of visiting. You must try the sticky bun!! But be sure to share it with your lucky other half since it's that delicious but sweet and good all around. The food display is spot on, the food is ordered and cooked table by table so you can dine at your leisure.  Service was absolutely wonderful and the coffee is just delicious! Loved the color of the eggs! How'd they do it? I guess you'll have to go and see :)

Very upscale. The food was amazing and cooked perfectly. The mixed drinks were unique and delicious. Try to make a reservation ahead of time if you plan to go on a weekend as this place will be packed.

Had drinks and snacks at the bar. At first the bar tender was pretty cold but he lightened up a little later. The setting was cozy and the food and drinks were good, but not memorable enough to go into detail

Came for a Elite Yelp event and stayed for the delicious drinks.  The peach infused bourbon was absolutely amazing!  Eric was our bartender and he suggested fabulous drinks and was quick on the refills.  We ordered the Fries with Chickpea sauce...oh the fries...so light and crispy.  We also ordered the beet, goat cheese, arugula salad...plate licking good!  I will definitely be back in the near future to sit down and enjoy a dinner here.  The service was great and the atmosphere was fun but classy.

It was an amazing experience! The food was outstanding and the service even better. Oscar was attentive, went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of and was so friendly. We even talked about the World Cup and he made me feel better about my country playing England later this week. Thanks Oscar!

This is probably my top place to eat in Vegas ! Everything from the ambiance to the food is spot on . My wife and I have had the pleasure of dinning  there 3 times and each time it gets better . We look forward to our next visit ! Must haves are the duck wings ...the French onion soup with the added truffle and poached egg ! .. and any one of the steaks on the menu ...the chef and the staff are genuinely caring and you can taste it and see it in the dinning room .. can't wait till the next time

Aside from beautiful interior, the duck wings which were supposed to be their signature item were not great. The foie gras patr was less than average, but the drinks were great... Overall not very impressed...

The Food was scrumptious  should have taken pictures , but too busy eating this amazing food.
 Desert to die for Chocolate Macaroons. I am going back.

If only for the Sea Bass and Frisse Salad. The decor was ok.  Quintessential "French" ambiance ...sorta.  But the food was divine.  A huge huge Frisse salad with just enough tang in the dressing, lots of flavor, perfect egg.   Enough to share and the Sea Bass was a large and beautifully prepared piece of fish that was fresh, flavorful...yummy. 

I'm definitely a fan!!

There are no words to express the amazing food here. We love the breakfasts- regardless of what hotel/casino we stay at, we always make a special breakfast reservation at Bardot. Yes, it's expressive but so are all fine restaurants in Las Vegas!

Arrived early and was seated, thanks for making life easy.

I love good food and enjoy trying new places.

For my main course I had PARISIAN GNOCCHI AU PISTOU.  Delish.  Felt light and fresh and yet very filling.  

The Fresh french bread served in a bag , with fresh butter with salt was good.

For dessert i had:
PAVLOVA AUX FRUITS ROUGES
vanilla meringue, lemon chantilly, strawberries, cassis coulis, lavender gelato

Was a amazing mix of flavors on the mouth, meringue was itself a bit big, but an dessert well worth the calories.  Good job on the gelato, lavender is hard to work with.

Friendly staff, great service(I enjoy my water and they never let my glass be empty).

My boyfriend and I came in and sat at the bar to grab an appetizer, dessert and a couple of drinks. The bar service was a little lackluster at first, but by the end of our time there our bartender seemed to warm up to us. Maybe we made a bad first impression upon him?

Service aside, Bardot Brasserie is incredibly impressive. The bar is the first feature that you see when walking inside, and it is glorious. It's a tower of glass, lights, and bottles, and it is beautiful and sets the scene perfectly.

We ordered the Steak Tartare to begin, and it is out of this world. We would certainly order it again. For dessert, we ordered the famous dark chocolate macaroon and ate every single bite.

The little taste of Bardot Brasserie definitely whets my appetite for more. I look forward to returning for a full meal on our next Vegas visit.

Last night in Vegas it was decided that steak and fancy needed to happen.  So we made a quick reservation through Aria's website and showed up pretty much on time.  What I really liked is that the hostess did not pawn us off to the bar.  I can't even count on two hands how many times this has happened.  Sorry, I know it's Vegas but this one time I'm here to eat, not drink.  

So the waiter comes out with the menu's, gives us some time to look them over and we order.  Then out comes the still warm bread!  So the wife ordered the prime rib and I and ordered the filet.  Her's came with some kind of cheesy potato stick and mine had truffle fries.  I dunno about her meal but mine was awesome!  Honestly it's been a really long time since I've had a steak that good and with the blue cheese sauce it just made it even better.  The fries were amazing too, you could see the black truffle on the fries and it wasn't overpowering.  

I wish I had tried this place sooner because this has got to be a must go to place when visiting Vegas now.

2018 Yelp 100 Challenge!
22/100

Had the pleasure to dine here with my love! Awesome experience and one I will NEVER forget!

Upon arrival the host was sweet to assist and let us know that we still had a little time to kill :) We made our way to the beautiful bar and got us the best tasting champagne "Renardat-Fache" - or they call it "Bugey/boogie Fache" - delicious fruity sparkling champagne!

As we were checking out the menu we knew right away what we wanted and go into work! Our server was great! He knew my love for food will need more space on our table! 

We ordered the following:
- King Crab Crepe $22 - Literally the most interesting dish I've ever had so far! King crab w/ fried eggs? Who knew?!?!!? DELICIOUS!
- Bone Marrow en Persillade $19 - served with 2 different flavor bread I say this is one AMAZING dish.. the only thing I didn't like was the thickness of the bread...maybe a little thin slice wouldn't hurt (Do not plan on getting full with just bread)
- Scallops Meuniere $46 - HUGE I mean HUGE scallops I've ever seen in my life! Perfectly cooked and full of flavor I LOVE!
- Loup de Mer au Fenouil $56 - MY FAV DISH! I enjoyed this plate very much! the buttery sauce with enough lemon...PERFECT. Boneless: easy to eat & the skin peels right off~~ DAMNNN drooool
- Bone in New York Strip , Creekstone $61 - Cooked to perfection and truffle fries.. Perfect match! My love enjoyed this VERY MUCH!
- Roasted Brussel Sprout $14 - GET IT!!!!!!

Overall this place is AMAZING and I give my man 2 thumbs up on choosing this place for our romantic dinner + being wise on making reservation beforehand :) (thats a MUST)

In my mothers words, "that was one of the best brunches Ive ever had". Whenever I have a poor experience at a restaurant that consistently gets 4 and 5 star reviews I always want to go back and give them a second chance. My second visit to Bardot was extraordinary. 

We decided to try Sunday brunch this time and it was packed full. Service however was excellent from the time we sat down until we left completely stuffed. We started with peach bellini's and that wonderful pastry basket filled with light delicious pastries that will make you think you are in Paris. 

Our table shared the king crab crepe which was presented beautifully. It was served open faced with the perfectly cooked egg in the center of the dark buckwheat crepe. When you mix the egg, crepe, king crab and mushrooms together it is a rich and elegant way to start your brunch. 

We also enjoyed the Le steak burger, hunters waffle and the french toast. The steak burger was excellent, cooked perfectly medium rare and the hunters waffle was an interesting mix of duck confit and poached eggs served on a waffle. Now...for that french toast. 

You have never seen anything like it. It is HUGE. A super thick slice of brioche with a giant scoop of vanilla marscapone and two large pieces of almond brittle. Stunning when placed on the table but even better in your mouth! The almond syrup is a perfect match. The outside of the toast is crispy and the inside soft and warm. This is a must order item. 

The food and service was worthy of all their 4 and 5 star reviews. I am really glad we came back to Bardot and it definitely won't be our last time.

Blown away. This was the best brunch i've ever had.

Should you start with the bottomless sparking rosé? Yes, you should. My brother and I both got that, and I would venture to guess, that between the two of us, we went through at least two bottles and change. The waitress just kept coming over and topping us off; I don't think we actually ever had completely empty glasses.

Carbs? Yep. If you're jumping on the bottomless train, you best supplement with breads of many varieties. We got the basket of bread/pastries, a basket of sourdough, as well as "the world's best butter" - I think between this carb-festival and the rosé, I could have stopped right there.

But did we? Of course not. We also HAD to start with the Nutella cinnamon bun to get that initial fat explosion we needed to really get our metabolisms going. We divided that up between all of us, because only a crazy person (or someone with an iron stomach) could house that whole thing themself.

From there, you can't really go wrong with what you order. Our table had some salmon, some french toast, and steak and eggs floating around, and they were all fantastic. I had the steak and eggs, which was grass fed NY beef (local for me, less so for LV) nice and rare, with perfectly over easy eggs and fat sourdough to soak it all up.

This easily outdoes any NYC/NJ brunch i've ever had - where else can you get bottomless sparking French rosé for $25?

Again, not the cheapest meal you'll eat, but most certainly worth every penny. Next time I am in Vegas, Aria or not, I will be back.
We just had brunch there during Christmas holidays.  It was AMAzing.  Highly recommended!

Omg this place is my favorite in Vegas and I've been to many high end French restaurants here in town. Great Forbes 5 star service as expected at the Aria. The food is great. Everything that we ordered was like a piece of art. The mixture of different flavors and textures in the buckwheat crepe was mindblowing. Foie gras brulee = food orgasm. Best advice - go there very hungry.

Had brunch here before our flight back home. The hostess was prompt to seat is after checking us in for our reservation. Aloof, polite service and a trendy French atmosphere. My partner got the loaded French onion soup that had short rib and an egg in it. I chose the smoked salmon plate which was beautifully presented and delicious. Would have been great for sharing. I'd consider coming back and would recommend to pink wine drinkers as they have an unlimited Rose option with brunch.

The best French Restaurant on The Strip! 
I had escargots Bardot, seared foie gras, octopus a la basquaise for appetizer. 
Escargot is wrapped in pastry with amazing sauce. I LOVE the seared foie gras but I don't like the camargue rice. The octopus is very tasty & cooked perfectly but eating the beans with it seemed to ruined the taste.
I had the scallops & king crab crepe for my entree and both are DELICIOUS!!!

I'd say it was an okay experience. Average at most. The hostess and wait staff were friendly and attentive. The food was okay but not knock your socks off great. We love the pork chop because it was juicy and was cooked to perfection. However, the macaroni and cheese is sub par. It was missing the cheese part! For me, the best part was the dessert - a big chocolate macaron.

Was extremely pleased with the service and quality of food at this restaurant. I was staying at the aria resort and casino for business and decided to try this place for dinner. Not disappointed one single bit. The waiter was fantastic and suggested a great beer prior to dinner. He was extremely knowledgable of the menu. I highly recommend this place.

Great food, small plates. Staff was attentive and entertaining ( one server was quoting Pulp Fiction! )

Would absolutely go back when in Vegas again. Foie gras parfait was amazing, olive tapenade with fresh breads the same. Escargot was a let down, but only because I thought I was getting escargot with puff pastry and a garlic butter sauce for dipping. Instead, the escargot was wrapped in puff and had a garlic pesto sauce on top. Still really good, just not what I wanted.
Overrated. Worst omelet I've ever had (how do you screw that up?). Could have gotten better food in the hotel lounge.
Great ambiance, excellent cocktails, good service and tasty food. I recommend this place if you are looking for a great dinning experience.

When we are in the mood to splurge this is our go to spot! Our two favorite things on the menu are the heritage chicken and the diver scallops, which are both very tasty and cooked to perfection. The service is always great no matter how busy they are, which is to be expected at such a nice place. 

My only issue is it can get pretty loud, as they do have a tv at the bar. I'd suggest requesting one of the more secluded areas or at least a table where the television is not in view. To me, it's just not fitting to pay $200 for a meal (for 2) while watching a sporting event on the tele. It just doesn't go, at least not for me. 

Aside from that, everything is ALWAYS amazing which is why we return, but more importantly venture to the strip. If you're a Vegas local, you'll understand that statement.
